Job Description:
Are you in search of an exhilarating career dedicated to the advancement and nurturing of local businesses and entrepreneurs? All the while, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to our community. The Itasca Economic Development Corporation has the perfect job for you, featuring exceptional flexibility, attractive benefits, and a welcoming work environment.

Itasca Economic Development Corporation is looking to add a Business Consultant to our team!

This position will report to the IEDC Director of Business Development. This position will dedicate 75% of their time to direct client work including preparation time and consulting. The remaining 25% will be instructing or assisting with training programs and other special activities.

Job Duties:

Provide direct client consulting assistance.
Preliminary screening and evaluation of new ventures and business expansion plans.
Prepare comprehensive business loan packaging, financial analysis and marketing plans.
Maintain required client reporting in designated database system.
Help develop SBDC training programs.
Represent and promote the regional SBDC office.
Work with IEDC staff to develop business development strategies for Itasca County.
Outreach into rural Itasca County, meeting with owners of local businesses.
Other responsibilities as assigned by management.

Qualifications:

B.A. or B.S. degree in business, economics, accounting, or related field.
Excellent communication skills, strong analytical ability.
Minimum of 3 years of relevant business experience.
Experience in business management, and or financial business analysis.
Meet the ASBDC/MN SBDC Core Competencies (within 1-2 years)
Complete the Basic Economic Development Course (within 1 year)
Desire for ongoing education.

Employee Benefits:

$55,000 - $65,000
Competitive Benefits Package
Great Working Environment with Endless Coffee!

JOB DESCRIPTION

HHHC is looking for a collaborative, committed, and hard-working professional to join our Billing team full-time. This individual will be focused on supporting our ‘billing’ process and also have the opportunity to work on broad-based operational initiatives and interface with company leadership.

THE ROLE

You will work directly with the Billing team to:

Prepare, review, and post claims using billing software to payers
Trouble-shoot denied/unpaid aging claims to identify root causes of issues and prevent reoccurrence
Develop claims processes in order to streamline billing team workflows as we scale
Communicate with and train field employees on timecard processing and charting
Understand state and insurance billing regulations and requirements
Improve our general technology, systems, and processes to help make our core operational functions more effectively and efficiently
Collaborate with other departments to push out billing initiatives as the company grows
Support general operations and other job-related duties as needed

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

BA/BS degree with strong academic performance
At least 2+ years’ experience with claims or medical billing
A “no task is too small” mindset
Ability to balance a variety of tasks and prioritize, highly organized and strong attention to detail
Knowledge of/ability to quickly learn the industry payment processes
Demonstrated leadership skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and friendly/positive demeanor
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

HHHC offers benefits including health insurance and paid vacation. We are hiring for this position immediately.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Working Hours

Due to the important nature of the projects this position will be supporting, this position is in person at our offices in St. Paul. Working hours will be 9am-5pm; Monday-Friday.

Employment Benefits

Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Life and disability insurance
Health savings account
401(k)
Paid time off and paid holidays

HHHC remains a strong advocate of this vision, which is more important now than ever before. Join our team, help us continue to grow and thrive, and make a difference in countless lives!

The Business Analyst Developer plays a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions within an organization. This position combines the responsibilities of a business analyst, who identifies and defines business requirements, with those of a developer, who designs and implements software solutions to meet those requirements. The Business Analyst Developer collaborates with various stakeholders to ensure that software applications align with business goals and operational needs.
This is a hybrid, full time salaried position, that requires one live locally in the immediate area

Essential Job Functions



**Requirements Gathering:**

Collaborate with business units, stakeholders, and end-users to gather, document, and refine business requirements.
Analyze and understand business processes and workflows to identify improvement opportunities.




**System Design and Development:**

Design and develop software solutions that address identified business needs and requirements.
Configure the enterprise resource planning system to meet operational needs. If needed, utilize development tools, programming languages, and databases to create custom applications or modify existing systems.




**Data Analysis:**

Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data as necessary to support business analytics, reporting, and decision-making processes.
Implement data validation and quality control measures to ensure data accuracy and integrity.




**Testing and Quality Assurance:**

Develop and execute test plans to validate software solutions against business requirements.
Debug and resolve software defects and issues to ensure optimal performance.




**Documentation:**

Create comprehensive documentation, including functional specifications, technical specifications, and user manuals.
Maintain accurate records of system changes and updates.




**Technical Support:**

Provide technical support to end-users, troubleshooting issues and resolving problems in a timely manner.
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure system availability and reliability.




**Collaboration and Communication:**

Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and the development team, facilitating effective communication and collaboration.
Present findings, progress, and proposed solutions to non-technical stakeholders.




**Continuous Improvement:**

Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to propose innovative solutions and process improvements.
Suggest enhancements and modifications to existing systems to optimize business operations.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Technology, or Business.
Proven experience in business analysis, software development, or a related role.
Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, C#, SQL) and development tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall).
Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL).
Understanding of data modeling and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Project management skills are a plus.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA, ScrumMaster) are a plus.
Conclusion
The Business Analyst Developer plays a crucial role in aligning technology solutions with business objectives, ensuring that software applications meet the needs of the organization. This position requires a blend of technical and analytical skills, as well as strong communication and collaboration abilities to drive business success through technology.

Physical & Environmental Demands

Cretex Companies may use cutting oils, solvents, and other chemicals in the manufacturing process. Testing is conducted on a periodic basis to ensure that all chemicals are kept well below the OSHA permissible exposure levels.

Position:

As a Sales Operations Analyst at Pace International, you will play a crucial role in ensuring our sales and operations teams work in perfect harmony to optimize resources, meet customer demand, and enhance the overall customer experience. This multifaceted position offers a blend of responsibilities that encompass demand planning, inventory management, customer relationship management, data analysis, and more. If you're passionate about using data to drive business decisions and thrive in a dynamic environment, we invite you to join our team.

Job Description:

Demand Planning / Sales Forecasting: Assist in developing demand forecasts based on historical sales data, market trends, and input from the sales team to support the Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning (SIOP) process.
Inventory Management: Collaborate with inventory control teams to optimize inventory levels, ensuring stock availability while minimizing carrying costs.
Customer Relationship Management: Collaborate closely with the sales team to provide a seamless customer experience, addressing inquiries, resolving order-related issues, and ensuring on-time deliveries.
Order Processing: Manage the end-to-end order processing cycle, including order acknowledgment and coordination with other departments (e.g., logistics, production) for timely and accurate product/service delivery.
Sales Incentive Programs: Support the design, implementation, and monitoring of sales incentive programs.
Data Analysis: Analyze sales data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement, including sales performance, pipeline metrics, conversion rates, win/loss analysis, and sales forecasts.
Reporting and Dashboards: Create and maintain sales performance reports and dashboards for sales managers and leadership, enabling data-driven decision-making.
Data Integration and Database Management: Identifying data sources and verifying accuracy of that data. Define and implement data acquisition and integration logic, ensuring scalability and performance of data solutions.
Visualizations and Communication: Create interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, communicating insights effectively to stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement: Proactively analyze data to answer critical questions, identify areas for improvement, and enhance efficiency and productivity.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with department managers to understand their analytics needs, deliver actionable insights, and build strong working relationships.
Other Duties: Undertake additional responsibilities as required to contribute to the success of the sales operations team.

Required Education:

Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Business, Data Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or Statistics

Skills and Experience:

Proven experience in sales operations, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, and visualization.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI, SQL).
Detail-oriented and process driven with a commitment to data accuracy.
Experience with ERP and CRM systems is a plus.
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations.
Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques.
Strong communication skills, oral and written.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team.
Ability to thrive in a small company environment that is dynamic.

Physical Demands:

A majority of time is spent sitting.
Some standing and walking may be necessary but are not essential to performing the jobresponsibilities.
Simultaneous movement of hands, wrists, and fingers is an important element to this position.

About Pace:

Pace International is an industry leading distributor of equipment and content in the Telecommunications and Services Industries. Pace was established in 1972 in Rochester, MN and is the only national hardware and content distributor for Dish Network. Pace owns and operates leading B2B and B2C business units that support cable, wireless, and satellite TV customers throughout North America.

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch

Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients

Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches

Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation

Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Benefits + Perks





Comprehensive Benefit Plan

Hollstadt offers a competitive and comprehensive benefit package which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Long Term/Short Term Disability, and Life Insurance. With three different medical plans to choose from, you can enroll in the coverage you need from single to family, or anywhere in between!




Remarketing Process

Hollstadt is based on retention and relationships. We get to know your strengths and career wishes throughout your assignment and then start remarket discussions 6-8 weeks prior to your end date. By being proactive, we are able to keep your down time between assignments as short as possible, unless you choose otherwise.




Professional Development

Hollstadt offers free bi-weekly training courses for our consultants as well as on-demand access to past sessions through our consultant portal. Trainings give our consultants the continuing education they need to excel on their projects.





401k + Matching

One popular benefit is our 401(k) match on the first 4% of your contributions. Hollstadt wants to help you reach your long-term financial goals and understands that planning for your future is critical. Consultants also have access to support from a Financial Advisor.




Bonus Opportunities

We appreciate and reward loyalty. Join Hollstadt, stay for 5 years, and we’ll give you a $5,000 Longevity Award bonus! Additionally, we know great talent knows other great talent. If you are on contract with Hollstadt and refer one of your connections who gets placed, we’ll pay you $1,000!




Ongoing Support & Networking

We have made a significant investment in building a support program for our consultant team - so you never have to feel like you are going it alone. We also have a Consultant Coach program which acts like a 'work buddy' to provide a safe ear for questions or concerns at your client site.

Title: Business Analyst

Location: Saint Paul, MN/Hybrid - Couple of days onsite in a week (Monday & Tuesday)

Duration: Long-term Contract or 6 Months

Experience: 3-7 years







Sample Tasks:

Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints. Write requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely. Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or scenarios, where appropriate. Plan and facilitate project discovery sessions. Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements specifying an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those that must base their work on the requirements. Write user stories with relevant acceptance criteria and review/update with the development team at refinement sessions and Scrum events as needed. Work with the product owner to align with priorities and build product backlog with refined stories for the development team. Plan, manage, and track teamwork items. Identify the current- and future-client business processes; define quality attributes, external interfaces, constraints, and other nonfunctional requirements. Perform requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards. Translate business requirements to System/Functional specifications and pass them on to Application Developers. Coordinate Business Validation to verify that a set of end-to-end business processes function as intended. Participate in peer reviews and inspections of user story maps, epics, user stories, requirements documents, and work products derived from those artifacts to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly. Manage requirements traceability information and track requirements status throughout the project.

Minimum Qualifications:

Seven (7) years of experience in an IT Business Analyst role Three (3) years of working as an IT Business Analyst on Agile project/product teams One (1) year of experience as a Scrum Master

Desired Skills:

Experience working with Law Enforcement or Criminal Justice Systems Business Analyst Certification (IIBA certification or equivalent) Certified Scrum Master Experience with backlog management, story writing, and story refinement. Experience working with Agile work management tools such as JIRA. Analyzing, defining and documenting requirements for object-oriented applications, relational databases, complex queries, interfaces, extraction processes, reports, and dashboards using multi-system data. Leading the design and implementation for multi-faceted, complex, application development projects involving multiple stakeholders and IT functions. Problem-solving skills in problem definition, information gathering and research, alternatives analysis, applying creative solutions to unique and/or immediate problems, and appropriate resolution implementation. Ability to communicate clearly, present complex information to users in a comprehensive style, and translate technical and system information for non-technical stakeholders. Ability to collaborate, work effectively as part of a team and maintain working relationships with all levels of business customers and technology staff. Leadership, mentoring and coaching skills for IT professionals. Experience performing, and advanced knowledge of, Quality Assurance and Project Management activities.

Job Title: Senior Dynamics 365 Sales Analyst, Enterprise Data Services
Job Description:
CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our 10,000 employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.

Summary

CHS has an exciting opportunity in our Information Technology division. We are seeking a Senior Enterprise Data Services Analyst to join our growing team and support our Customer Experience and Sales Enablement Dynamics 365 Product team. Responsibilities
Deliver analytical and reporting solutions from core Dynamics 365, ERP and Data Lake source systems.
Consider business impact, value of data and information management processes.
Leverage data domain experience and best practices to bring creative solutions to complex problems.
Monitor and improve data quality by initiating corrective actions identified through performing root cause analysis.

Facilitate source and target system data migration requirements gathering from process areas and data governance.
Collaborate with business and technical subject matter experts to identify, analyze and document data migration transformation rules from legacy source systems.
Collaborate with business resources and product team resources to design dashboards, reports and other required visualizations.
Analyzes business strategy and user needs, documents specifications, and translates business objectives into proper system requirement specifications.

4+ years of Information Technology and/or IT Business Systems to include:
Data analysis, analyzing and visualizing raw data to present actionable information for stakeholders
Knowledge of data governance or data management practices
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products
Strong analytic skills with attention to detail providing front-end data analysis, requirements gathering, design, testing, documentation implementation, and support of assigned data projects
2+ years of experience with Power BI to include:
Creating and editing visual content including maps, charts, and graphs
Transforming data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals
Providing visual, technical and editorial guidance
Experience with Data Modeling, ETL and SQL Development
Additional Qualifications
Experience configuring Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform tools
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint and Visio, Azure DevOps and SQL Server
Agile/Scrum framework knowledge, including user story development

Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.

The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.

Join the 2,500+ professionals of Minnesota IT Services (MNIT) who connect Minnesotans to services that will improve their lives. This position serves our partners at the Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED). The MNIT DEED team provides technical support to help improve employment conditions in Minnesota. The team supports work that improves workforce and community development, increases business recruitment, and helps Minnesota small businesses to expand into international trade.

Job Summary



Come join MNIT partnering with the Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED) to work on DEED’s Workforce Development Systems. This posting will hire two individuals who will work together, along with other IT professionals and DEED agency professionals, to modernize DEED's Workforce Development Systems and digital services; making them more functional and easier for our customers to navigate.

These positions will perform business analysis functions using a set of tasks and techniques to successfully act as a liaison among stakeholders to help clarify and understand the structure, policies, operations, and to recommend solutions that enable projects to be successful and goals to be met. Your position includes participating in requirements gathering sessions to analyze, define and document business processes, software requirements, data management systems and development of specifications for technology initiatives.

You will work as liaisons between the Business Product Owner, IT staff, and agency business subject matter experts in order to capture requirements and functional specifications. Much of your time will be spent documenting and validating requirements and understanding business processes and translating them into configured, procured, and developed functionality.

The incumbents will get to participate in and practice: Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring; Elicitation; Requirements Management and Communication; Enterprise Analysis; Requirements Analysis; and Solution Assessment and Validation using industry best practices for generally accepted standards outlined in the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK), or equivalent industry standards and best practices, and by MNIT.

This position is temporary and includes full state fringe benefits; it is anticipated to last for up to three (3) years.

**We will be filling a total of two (2) vacancies from this one posting. All applicants will be considered for both vacancies.

This position is currently eligible for full-time telework:

Telework for Minnesota IT Services allows an employee to perform work from a telework location and an employee may be required to be in the office based on business needs and other dependencies in St. Paul, Minnesota.

Only candidates located in Minnesota and bordering states (Iowa, North Dakota, South Dakota, or Wisconsin) are telework eligible.

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must clearly demonstrate all of the following qualifications in their resume:

This position requires a minimum of three (3) years of experience in performing IT business analysis functions.

Experience must include:

Experience eliciting and managing business requirements.
Experience working as a business analyst writing system specifications.
Ability to deliver effective verbal or written messages that facilitate a mutual understanding on both parties.
Customer service skills that include active listening, empathy, and problem-solving.

A master’s degree in Information Technology or a related field substitutes for three (3) years of experience, OR a related bachelor’s degree substitutes for two (2) years, OR a related associate’s degree substitutes for one (1) year.

Preferred Qualifications
Ability to collaborate and work effectively as part of an Agile team.
Experience using the Microsoft Suite of tools, including Power BI, and Excel to manage and summarize data.
Experience with APIs (e.g., creating, testing, publishing, managing, monitoring, and securing).
Knowledge of and / or experience with Power Apps, Microsoft Azure, and Azure Services (e.g., cloud technologies, managed databases, API Manager).
Experience working with vendor products, configurable products, and commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) product implementations.

System Administration, integration, and configuration experience

Implement product enhancements; understand and document business processes and requirements
Manage customer support cases via case management tool
Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing regularly scheduled system upgrades
Develop collaborative relationships with IT peers, Talent Management, Quality Systems, external partners, and various operational teams to help design, develop, and deliver learning solutions that satisfy business requirements

Ensure data integrity including quality, accuracy, security, and usability of employee data and related interfaces by adhering to established processes and controls

Job Description

Looking for an IT Business Analyst that wants to participate in a fast-paced environment supporting the implementation of manufacturing solutions. The MES Business Analyst is responsible for the planning, development, maintenance, and enhancement of the functional areas of application packages. They are assigned to teams within an assigned business unit and independently utilize various client/server platforms. Individuals collaborate with company customers, staff, IT and other stakeholders to identify user requirements, assess available technologies, and recommend solution options. They are proficient in assessing business objectives and design business processes for medium to high level objectives in such a way that they may be effectively modeled, configured and measured within the package application environment. Individuals are proficient in communicating the application package capabilities and possibilities to designated functional areas, while seeking ways to collaborate with IT members to facilitate transition to and support of the application package.


Supply Chain (plan, source, and make) and manufacturing execution system (MES) experience are required.


QUALIFICATION AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's degree in Management Information Systems or Business Administration with an emphasis in a specific functional area or equivalent work experience and technical training
3+ years of experience in relevant functional area, two years of experience with application package modules, and one package implementation
MES Experience
Supply chain operations experience
Good business understanding in one or more functional areas, as well as an understanding of the organization’s industry
Strong verbal and written communication skills, proficient in the ability to express medium to high level technical concepts in business terms
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work well on cross-functional project teams and foster team commitment to tasks
Developing project management skills, operating as part of a team organizing, planning, and executing projects from vision through implementation
May regularly coach other team members. Has no direct reports or staff responsibilities with respect to providing career development, training opportunities and conducting performance evaluations.
Agile Experience
Ability to work across teams and functions to identify requirements, and develop solution options
strong technical aptitude as the person will need to work with multiple application teams – systems analyst skills are required
Interest in working in plan, source and make areas of supply chain


PRIMARY TOOLS & TECHNOLOGIES:

Rockwell FTPC, Quality Management, Performance Management, Vantage Point, Historian
Various other shop floor/manufacturing application
Microsoft OS, SQL Server
Unix, Linux, JBOSS
Java, PNUTS, Mulesoft and various development/scripting abilities







Benefits + Perks





Comprehensive Benefit Plan

Hollstadt offers a competitive and comprehensive benefit package which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Long Term/Short Term Disability, and Life Insurance. With three different medical plans to choose from, you can enroll in the coverage you need from single to family, or anywhere in between!




Remarketing Process

Hollstadt is based on retention and relationships. We get to know your strengths and career wishes throughout your assignment and then start remarket discussions 6-8 weeks prior to your end date. By being proactive, we are able to keep your down time between assignments as short as possible, unless you choose otherwise.




Professional Development

Hollstadt offers free bi-weekly training courses for our consultants as well as on-demand access to past sessions through our consultant portal. Trainings give our consultants the continuing education they need to excel on their projects.





401k + Matching

One popular benefit is our 401(k) match on the first 4% of your contributions. Hollstadt wants to help you reach your long-term financial goals and understands that planning for your future is critical. Consultants also have access to support from a Financial Advisor.




Bonus Opportunities

We appreciate and reward loyalty. Join Hollstadt, stay for 5 years, and we’ll give you a $5,000 Longevity Award bonus! Additionally, we know great talent knows other great talent. If you are on contract with Hollstadt and refer one of your connections who gets placed, we’ll pay you $1,000!




Ongoing Support & Networking

We have made a significant investment in building a support program for our consultant team - so you never have to feel like you are going it alone. We also have a Consultant Coach program which acts like a 'work buddy' to provide a safe ear for questions or concerns at your client site.

Perform daily operational activities including customer onboarding, trade matching, reconciliations, position management and life cycle events and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal control standards.

Monitor status of customer-facing processes including customer onboarding and maintenance, trade confirmation, invoicing and settlement in accordance with established procedures and timelines
Suggest improvements or new developments to mitigate risks, reduce costs and improve efficiency.
Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned. Qualifications

Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.

The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.

Job Summary



This posting may be used to fill multiple vacancies. Telework is available and negotiated at the time of hire. There may be periodic requirements in office, roughly once per quarter or at the discretion of management.

The Department of Revenue is looking to add a member to the Operations Solutions Team. We’re looking for a tech savvy creative superstar to collaborate with key stakeholders across the agency to drive best practices and develop innovative operations solutions using technology to create communication and engagement programs to reach a diverse employee base. The Operations Solutions Team will support the daily coordination, governance of content, visual design, and site navigation for the department’s SharePoint intranet platform. These positions will drive agency internal communication strategies to enhance employee engagement through use of the department’s SharePoint intranet platform and M365 tools. In this role you will have the opportunity to lead change and improve the employee experience across the organization by making recommendations to improve work methods and procedures using SharePoint, M365 applications, and other appropriate platforms.

As an employee at the Department of Revenue, you’ll join a group of professionals who strive to be innovative, collaborative, and results-driven by thinking big, having fun, and promoting the common good. We are committed to an inclusive work environment that values each employee and works to continually address the needs of the communities we serve. This position provides a flexible work schedule with hybrid telework options available.

Teleworking employees are required to live in Minnesota or in a state bordering Minnesota.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications

Three (3) years of professional experience, which includes experience in writing, producing, and maintaining web site content in coordination with organizational leadership*

Bachelor's degree in a closely related field as determined by the agency may substitute one (1) year of experience; master’s degree substitutes for eighteen (18) months of experience; PhD substitutes for twenty-four (24) months of experience

Applicants who meet the above experience requirements will be further evaluated based on the following:

Advanced level proficiency with various Microsoft O365 applications sufficient to design SharePoint sites and identify and implement innovative business solutions
Experience in internal communications initiatives to increase employee engagement
Knowledge relating to basic principles of effective communication for a variety of audiences and communication channels, including but not limited to the areas of plain language, writing, and editing, and digital communication.
Strong project management or facilitation skills
Ability to prepare comprehensive reports, policies, and procedures
Experience in analyzing system operations and resolving issues between business needs and technology and organizational barriers
Preferred Qualifications
Strong teamwork skills, including willingness and ability to consult with subject matter experts across the organization
Experience in planning, developing, implementing, and disseminating internal communication strategies that provides timely and informative employee communication and engagement across the department
Experience in implementing responsive website development and optimizing output to function across various departments
Demonstrated experience leading and managing change
Experience in developing and implementing new procedures and techniques to meet business needs
Ability to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace and work with individuals from all background, with the experience of creating a work environment where differences are valued, encouraged, and supported
Experience exhibiting judgment on complex and ambiguous issues, fostering collaboration among leaders, teams, and stakeholders.
Physical Requirements

Requires occasional moving of articles such as boxes, accounting records, laptop computer, and portable printer.

Additional Requirements

Prior to an offer of employment, a background check will be conducted. This will include, but is not limited to checking degrees and licensures, criminal history, and tax filing and payment history. All individual income tax filing and payment obligations must be current prior to interviewing for this position.

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

The Minnesota Department of Revenue works to fund the future for all of Minnesotans. We manage over 30 different taxes and collect $26.7 billion annually in state taxes, which funds state programs such as healthcare, transportation, public safety, and early childhood, K-12, and higher education.

Revenue is dedicated to an inclusive work environment that celebrates and values the diversity of each employee and reflects the communities we serve. We're committed to a culture of inclusion where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and thrive.

We value a work life balance for our employees, and many of our employees telework in a full or hybrid capacity. For those that come to the office, regularly or occasionally, we invested in a state-of-the-art hybrid workspace located at the Stassen building in St. Paul.

Overview:
We are seeking an analyst who understands and considers both the business and the technical engineering/IT needs to ensure quality digital products and related operational workflows to meet/exceed the desired business objectives.
Key Responsibilities:
Able to perform cost, benefit and risk analysis associated with the proposed product/services and recommend alternatives for solutions throughout the product life cycle.
Collaborates with stakeholders and users to synthesize, articulate, and document business and system requirements.
Performs data analysis, defines, and documents business requirements, translates business requirements to technical/engineering specifications, acceptance criteria, user experience requirements and system validation while considering the complete technical and non-technical solution.
Technical specifications are utilized by Engineering/IT in the final technical design and eventual product build/acquisition or integration.
May assist product and operations leaders to coordinate deployment of deliverables (varies by product).
Provides input for development of other product documents, project charters and plans, work assignments, deliverable target dates, and other aspects of assigned work.
Applies systems engineering methodologies and discipline throughout the product and project lifecycle based on assignment.
Recruits, hires, and manages team.
Drives BA best practices through training, mentorship, and skill development of team members.
Researches, analyzes, and validates complete and accurate business and systems requirements.
Establishes scope boundaries for basic and routine products and technical requirements with accuracy and clarity.
Plans and monitors work scope estimates and schedules for the defined scope of the product.
Assesses and defines problems through root cause analysis and proactively brings solutions to the table.
Able to read, assess and interpret vended and solution architecture and translate into scope of work and technical specification requirements for integration into engineering/technology systems and product operations work-flows.
Understands and helps define product implementation change management requirements for those products not requiring formal Implementation Team resourcing.
Understand business strategy and business planning principles and applies with minimal guidance to assigned work.
Understands design, build and operations capabilities and requirements of current digital product technologies.
Actively seeks to understand new and emerging technologies, their capabilities, and how to translate to technical specifications for purposes of design, build and integration.
Able to understand and effectively communicate overarching product strategy to provide context to technical requirements and specifications.
Able to understand and effectively document business, operational and technical requirements for product, operations, and engineering/IT teams.
Able to document technical requirements and specifications in the chosen BA requirements tool(s).
Applies system and analytical thinking methodology and discipline.
Position Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree (business, communications, advertising, marketing, statistics, engineering, technology, health care) and 2+ years of relevant business and/or technical experience.
Candidate must have CMS/CCMS, Agile, Azure DevOps, and DITA XML experience.
Additional Information:
Fully Remote Role
W2 Candidates Only

Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.

The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.

Job Summary



Minnesota Housing is hiring! We’re a mission-focused financial institution looking for a Business Systems and Process Support Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will provide essential help desk support, troubleshoot business system issues, participate in testing of applications and create, maintain and update process documentation. Your expertise will be crucial to ensure a seamless operation and user satisfaction within our customer focused work environment.

Essential Job Duties

Provide Help Desk support via phone and email during Agency work hours which may include working with internal staff as well as external partners to troubleshoot problems encountered with business systems and provide solutions to resolve the problem. (i.e. Mortgage Cadence Platform (MCP) LOS, Grants Management System, FileMaker, and other systems and applications used by the business)
Actively identify, troubleshoot and escalate issues that cannot be resolved independently.
Prepare and generate recurring program reports related to system workarounds and complete any required updates, maintenance and follow up.
Participate in discussions of program changes as they relate to impacts to systems and provide input and recommendations for solutions.
Complete client set-up/management for internal user access in the loan commitment system (LOS)
Serve as Subject Matter Expert for web administrator functionality in the loan commitment system (LOS) and train and support others conducting training related to this functionality
Update the Minnesota Housing internal and external web pages including program updates, training info, daily rate updates, documents/information, and any SF related items checked out and/or updated on web, etc.
Test version upgrades, enhancements and break fixes so that systems are accurate, consistent and reliable. This testing may be for changes made by the system vendor or the internal Business Systems and Process Support (BSPS) or Business and Technology Support (BTS) teams.
Create, maintain and update process documentation so they are accessible, accurate and available for business partners (this may include job aids, document control, document creation, converting documents to accessible, creating PDFs and eSignature capabilities, etc.).
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications

To be qualified for and considered for this position, applicants must meet all of the minimum qualifications listed below. Ensure that your resume contains descriptions of your work experiences sufficient for comparison against the requirements stated below and indicate the beginning and ending month and year for each job held.

Only applicants whose resumes clearly demonstrate fulfillment of each of these minimum qualifications will considered for this position.

Two (2) years of professional work experience with housing/mortgage lending which includes knowledge of mortgage lending operations and practices. This is required to understand the overall consumer mortgage lending process from application through closing to effectively troubleshoot and support business partners with a variety of escalated program, process and system related issues.
A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Housing or Real Estate or Information Management may substitute for one (1) year of professional experience
Demonstrated customer service skills providing support for internal and/or external customers in a Help Desk Support role, handling a variety of requests that come via multiple ways (phone/email/IM), listening and understanding the request thoroughly, trouble shooting and resolving the requests and issues for the customer.
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills, including the ability to research and resolve issues using independent decision making where authority is delegated or escalating where necessary
Excellent writing and documentation skills to clearly log issues/requests and how they were resolved, to write/edit training and procedural materials and to document testing results
Demonstrated communication skills, including ability to comprehend and communicate complex information in plain language
Cultural competency as demonstrated by skills for communication and interaction across cultures and awareness of one’s own world view and that different world views exist.
Preferred Qualifications
Five (5) years of related housing/mortgage lending experience in the area of mortgage lending production or operations
Experience with mortgage lending origination system (LOS) testing and/or system support,
Our employees are dedicated to ensuring cultural responsiveness. Preferred candidates will have a variety of experiences working effectively with others from different backgrounds and cultures.
Physical Requirements

Requires moving office items such as file folders and small office tools.

Additional Requirements
Reference checks
Job related background checks

Minnesota Valley Transit Authority (MVTA) is seeking a highly energetic and forward-thinking professional who is passionate about serving our communities with innovation and sustainability in mind. The IT Business Analyst is a contracted position projecting a twelve-month assignment. MVTA serves as the public transportation agency for seven suburbs south of the Twin Cities within the large population of Dakota County and rapidly growing Scott County. This is an exciting opportunity for an IT Business Analyst to make a broad impact by shaping the services MVTA delivers through an IT lens.





POSITION SUMMARY

Under the direction of the Information Technology Officer (ITO), the IT Business Analyst is pivotal in bridging the gap between IT and business operations. With a blend of data analytics and project management skills, this role is a strategic problem solver who will assess processes, determines requirements, and delivers data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders. Collaborating with IT professionals and business teams, the IT Business Analyst ensures technical and business objectives are achieved through carefully managed projects.


JOB DUTIES OR ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The essential functions of the position include, but are not limited to the following:

Collaborate with IT teams and business stakeholders to gather, understand, and validate business requirements.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications and assist in the design of technical solutions.
Analyze and model business processes, identify areas of improvement, and make data-driven recommendations.
Develop and maintain documentation, including system workflows, use cases, user stories, and technical specifications.
Engage in system design sessions to provide insights from a business perspective and ensure alignment with business goals.
Work with the IT team to ensure data quality, integration, and system performance meet user requirements.
Provide feedback on testing and implementation processes, ensuring solutions are aligned with business objectives and user needs.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data governance policies and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory standards and data privacy requirements.
Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions.
Train and support end users on new processes and systems, ensuring seamless adoption and minimizing disruption.
Serve as a liaison between the functional managers and IT, ensuring clear communication, understanding, and positive working relationships.
Stay updated on the latest business analysis techniques, tools, and best practices to continually improve analytical effectiveness.
Participate in user acceptance testing to ensure the solution meets business requirements.
Define and document data migration strategies and approaches considering specific constraints and requirements of both the third-party systems and the primary environment.
Perform other duties as assigned or apparent.



This position may encounter not public data in the course of these duties. Any access to not public data should be strictly limited to accessing the data that are necessary to perform the duties. While data are being accessed, this position should take reasonable measures to ensure the not public data are not accessed by individuals without a work reason. Once the work reason to access the data is reasonably finished, this position must properly store the not public data.




MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the formal education, experience, training required, and skills/abilities.




Education

Bachelor’s in Information Systems, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.



Experience

Three (3) years of experience in a technology business analyst role that includes building graphs and charts to communicate useful insights in the data.
Proven experience in project management and familiarity with project management tools and methodologies.
Strong understanding of compliance and regulatory standards relevant to the industry.
Demonstrated ability in data analysis, documentation creation, and translating business requirements into technical solutions.
Proficient in SQL or other database querying languages.
Strong analytical skills, interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
Proactive, solution-oriented, and adept at working in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with Power BI, SSRS, or any enterprise-level reporting platform.
Experience creating process maps, gathering business requirements, writing functional specifications, writing user stories, creating test plans, and writing test scripts.



Skills and Abilities

Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, gather requirements, and communicate insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to analyze complex problems, identify alternative solutions, and make data-driven decisions.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
Extensive experience with data visualization and project management.
Excellent organizational, communication & documentation skills with high attention to detail.



DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

The requirements listed below are representative of the formal education, experience, and training preferred to exceptionally perform all the functions of this position.




Education

See minimum qualifications section.




Experience

Four (4) years of experience as a business systems analyst or business analyst



Certificates, and Licenses

Business Analysis Professionals (CBAPs)
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)
Professional in Business Analysis (PBA)



COMPLEXITY

Work requires many different processes and methods applied to an established professional or technical field/s.




RESPONSIBILITY

Supervision Needed

This position both (a) operates under minimal supervisor based on overall objectives and available resources and (b) must make decisions based on inadequate guidelines that require considerable interpretation and force the employee to plan all the phases of the assignment and develop some new methods.


Supervision Given

High coordination of work with others, e.g., Project Lead or first level supervisory, or managerial roles in charge of an individual function.




Impact

Works affects the overall efficiency and image of the organization.





REQUIRED PHYSICAL ABILITIES AND WORK CONDITIONS

The physical demands and work conditions described here are representative of those that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Purpose

This position is responsible for the accuracy and integrity of the store’s inventory. Full-Time and Part-Time Positions Available.

Minimum Eligibility Requirements

One year of inventory control experience in a “big box” retail company or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.
Demonstrated point of sale analysis and reporting experience.
Business analysis experience is a plus.
Intermediate computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite.
Must be detail-oriented and highly organized.
Must possess excellent customer service skills and work well under pressure.
Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment.

Essential Functions

Demonstrate a thorough understanding and compliance with the company’s safe lifting practices standard operating procedures.
Follow the daily cycle count and category review calendar.
Research all inventory-related discrepancies and make appropriate adjustments in the inventory system.
Review shipping and receiving documents for accuracy.
Bring to the attention of the department managers immediately any discrepancies noticed in tagging or SKUing of merchandise.
Audit the BFR daily in accordance with the Inventory Control SOP.
Audit incoming and outgoing trucks randomly.
Audit the SOR process in accordance with the Return of Sale SOP.
Audit the SRR process in accordance with the Return of Sale SOP for Voids and Partial voids.
Audit the RTV process to ensure RTV’s are being processed per SOP.
Audit to ensure the security of the facility by notifying management of any issues.
Audit the customer merchandise storage area weekly in accordance with the Customer Storage SOP and timely resolve any issues with the CEM and Operations Manager.
Provide assistance to the Operations Manager during any physical inventory period.
Ensure that the “Sample” tape is applied to all wood boxes that have been written off to “Sam”. If not, notify the department manager to immediately address.
Run the OSDR Report for DMG, RTV, VA, DIS, WO, CHR, PRV, USE, LF, STL, WEB and SAM monthly to ensure correct movement of merchandise was done and correct any discrepancies. Document report of findings/corrections, submit to the Operations manager for review, both initial and archive monthly in the cycle count drawer.
Check a minimum of 10 customer receipts daily and randomly. Either “Pickup” and or “Take With” Tickets. Any discrepancies adjust immediately and notify CEM/Operations Manager of mistake(s).
Communicate to Store Management Team the discrepancies found in the day’s CCYL and propose solutions to fix the issues which may have caused and or potential may cause shrink via e-mail. Failure to fix the outstanding issues upon your follow-up, you will need to notify the CEM/Operations manager immediately.
Maintain all cycle count paperwork per SOP.
Follow-up to ensure that all changes were implemented.

Working Conditions (travel, hours, environment)

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to a warehouse environment and moving vehicles. The noise level in the work environment is typically moderate to noisy.

Physical/Sensory Requirements

Medium Work – Ability to exert 20-50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or 10-25 pounds of force frequently, and/or greater than negligible up to 10 pounds of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. The employee is often required to use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl.

Store Hours

Monday - Friday 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM

Saturday 8:00 AM - 7:00 PM

Sunday 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Bonus opportunities at every level

Career advancement opportunities

Relocation opportunities across the country

401k with discretionary company match

Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Referral Bonus Program

A personal holiday and Volunteer Time Off program

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and other Insurance Plans (subject to eligibility criteria)

POSITION SUMMARY

Hyperautomation is a term that describes the use of multiple technologies to automate end-to-end business processes. Hyperautomation includes technologies such as robotic process automation (RPA), intelligent document processing (IDP), artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and Microsoft’s Power Platform. These technologies, used in conjunction, allow us to simplify tasks, enhance efficiency, and reduce errors by harnessing the power of automation. They handle repetitive work and simplify complex tasks, making our operations smoother and more reliable.

A Business Analyst (BA) – Hyperautomation, is responsible for working with the business to identify business processes that can be automated and developing solutions that leverage hyperautomation tools. The BA is working closely with the developers, project managers, and other stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery. Strong analytical and communication skills, as well as a process driven mindset are essential.

WHY Würth:

Health, Vision and Dental Benefits for Full-time Employees & their Families!
Paid Time Off – start accruing on day one!
Paid Holidays
401(K) with Company Match
Free Life Insurance
Partner Discounts (Ford, Verizon, Harley Davidson and more!)



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and prioritize hyperautomation opportunities Evaluate business processes and find areas where hyperautomation can enhance efficiency and accuracy
Prepare comprehensive Process Design Documents (PDD) which build the baseline for development
Develop detailed business requirements and use cases for hyperautomation solutions
Work with developers to ensure that solutions are delivered on time and meet business requirements
Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and provide feedback to developers
Assist with the deployment of hyperautomation solutions and provide support to end-users
Develop and maintain documentation related to hyperautomation solutions
Other duties as assigned.

2+ years of experience as a Business Analyst preferred.

Curious about new and innovative technologies

Job Title: Marketing Analyst - North America Business Unit
Job Description:
Location: Minneapolis, MN

Schedule: Hybrid (in office Tuesday-Thursday)

Do you want to work with a top performer? So do we! We’re Katun Corporation, and we’re looking for a talented Marketing Analyst to join our performance-proven team of professionals.

For over 40 years, Katun has been one of the world’s leading providers of OEM-compatible imaging supplies, photoreceptors, and parts for copiers, printers, MFPs, and other imaging equipment. From our humble beginnings in 1979, we pioneered and helped legitimize the imaging supplies aftermarket. Today, we serve 10,000 customers in 116 countries from our headquarters in Minneapolis and dozens of worldwide locations. We believe that in order for people and businesses to prosper, we must protect the environment first, as a healthy planet and a healthy community go hand in hand. This applies to our local and global communities as well.

Job Summary:

North America Business Unit (NABU) Marketing has three areas of focus – Programs, Promotions, and Pricing/Product analysis. The Marketing Analyst position is responsible for promoting and driving sales in North America by providing primarily product and pricing support. This includes working within the NABU Marketing and NABU Sales teams to aid in new product sales, market growth, new product identification, and competitive data gathering. Establish a two-way communication flow with the Business Unit salesforce by providing guidance on new products and market pricing. This position also serves as the collection point for sales, market, and customer feedback and a voice of the customer back to Katun operational teams.

Our Marketing Analyst position is centered around in-depth data analysis. A high proficiency in Excel is essential, as it's the main instrument for analyzing and decoding market insights. This position calls for keen analytical skills to decipher market data and derive meaningful insights.

Key Responsibilities:

· Responsible for product-related activities – work closely with colleagues in Product Marketing and Product Development on forecasting, new product launches, and development review feedback. Proactive in requesting cost downs and new product opportunities.

· Key point of contact for all product-related questions, pricing management (cost changes, campaigns, and special pricing arrangements) including maintaining the internal databases.

· Support sales in completing savings analysis, bids, and quotes.

· Work with Director of Marketing, General Manager, and key Sales Representatives to support sales and marketing functions with catalogs, product flyers, and general product support.

· Communicate pertinent marketing information to NABU Marketing Management and Corporate Marketing through the use of competitive information and customer feedback.

· Monitor the competitive situation of the market by analyzing and interpreting competitive information collected by the salesforce and through established data points.

· Work with the salesforce and monitor salesforce activity and performance to ensure proper utilization of marketing materials and product support information.

· Perform analytical reporting to identify market performance and trends and use the results of the analysis to identify opportunities to grow customers and maximize Katun’s market share.

· Participate in continuous improvement and quality initiatives, and personal and professional development to maximize individual, departmental, and organizational capacity.

· Perform other projects, work and activities as assigned to deliver consistent internal and external customer service.

Education and Experience:

· College degree in marketing, finance, or business.

· Desired related business experience of 3 years or more.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

· Detail-oriented.

· Process-oriented.

· Project coordination.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Ability to handle multiple tasks and/or projects simultaneously.

· Strong interpersonal skills.

Direct Reports:

· None.

Equipment/Software Utilized:

· General office equipment: personal computer, telephone, printer, fax, copier.

· Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Excel (Expert Level), PowerPoint, Access.

· Outlook, Teams, Datawarehouse (for reporting), IFS (ERP system), SFDC (CRM tool), KARROTS.

Work Environment and Physical Requirements*:

· Ability to sit for long periods of time.

· Vision abilities required to validate and enter data on computer.

· May occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 lbs.

· Hybrid work schedule – in office Tuesday-Thursday.

*This list does not represent all physical demands. Descriptions are representative of those that must be met by employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Business Intelligence Analyst - Semantic Layer

Hormel Foods Corporation

ABOUT HORMEL FOODS - Inspired People. Inspired Food.™

Hormel Foods Corporation, based in Austin, Minn., is a global branded food company with over $12 billion in annual revenue across more than 80 countries worldwide. Its brands include Planters®, SKIPPY®, SPAM®, Hormel® Natural Choice®, Applegate®, Justin's®, Wholly®, Hormel® Black Label®, Columbus® and more than 30 other beloved brands. The company is a member of the S&P 500 Index and the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats, was named on the "Global 2000 World's Best Employers" list by Forbes magazine for three years, is one of Fortune magazine's most admired companies, has appeared on Corporate Responsibility Magazine's "The 100 Best Corporate Citizens" list for 12 years, and has received numerous other awards and accolades for its corporate responsibility and community service efforts. The company lives by its purpose statement - Inspired People. Inspired Food.™ - to bring some of the world's most trusted and iconic brands to tables across the globe. For more information, visit www.hormelfoods.com and http://csr.hormelfoods.com/.

Summary:
We are looking for a Staff Business Intelligence Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst within our IT Analytics team to design and build our semantics and data virtualization layer for our enterprise data platform. This is an exciting opportunity to modernize our enterprise data platform by enabling a standard, interconnected semantic layer for our business areas across Hormel Foods! Individuals interested in this position will need strong skills in data modeling, communication, business understanding and requirements gathering. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining the semantic layer and data virtualization tool to ensure our end users have an accurate, connected and consistent self-service layer to consume data from.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Requirements gathering, designing, developing, and testing the logical layer using semantics layer tools. Perform issue resolution and maintenance for existing and new logical layers. Focus on understanding the organization's business processes to create the optimal logical layer to support the enterprise for a long-term data analytics foundation. Give training to end users and write technical and functional documentation.

The person in this position will:

Create and maintain the semantic layer, defining business rules, and ensuring data accessibility and accuracy for end-users.
Recommend underlying data models and structures that support the semantic layer.
Govern consistency and create standards for the semantic layer and enforce adherence when standards are not followed.
Create a logical layer that abstracts the complexities of the underlying data sources, such as databases or data warehouses.
Develop data models and structures that translate raw data into business-friendly concepts.
Translate complex SQL queries or technical data terminology into business terms and concepts.
Develop and maintain business rules and calculations to facilitate reporting and analysis.
Document metadata, data definitions, and data lineage to provide context for users.
Set up user access and security permissions to control who can access and modify the semantic layer.
Define roles and permissions for different user groups.
Ensure metadata is accurate and up to date.
Collaborate with data engineers, data architects, business analysts, and other stakeholders to align the semantic layer with business objectives.
Monitor the performance of the semantic layer and optimize it to ensure queries and data retrieval are efficient.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Level of position offered (Staff BI Analyst or BI Analyst) will be determined based on the candidates experience and skill set.

Required:

Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, Data Analytics, Physics, Statistics, Math, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
3+ years of experience with reading and writing SQL.
3+ years of experience designing and developing within a semantic layer or data virtualization tool like Oracle Business Intelligence Metadata Repository (RPD), Denodo, AtScale, Dremio, or others similar.
Experience understanding and designing business rules and data access security rules.
Proven ability to gather detailed technical requirements to design and develop semantic layer from beginning to end.
Experience understanding and developing or designing dimensional data models in a data warehouse or lake.
Experience leading meetings, groups of people or overseeing processes to achieve established goals.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Tested problem-solving and decision-making skills.
A strong pattern of initiative.
Highly developed interpersonal and leadership skills.
Must be a Citizen or National of the United States, a lawful, permanent resident, or have authorization to work in the United States.
Applicants must not now, or in the future, require sponsorship for an employment visa.

Preferred:

Prior experience with designing and developing a data warehouse or lake in Google BigQuery
Prior experience with performance tuning through data virtualization in a multi-cloud, federated query environment.
Prior experience working with and using Data Governance tools like data.world, Collibra, Informatica Data Governance
Prior experience working with Master Data Management practices and systems

LOCATION:

Austin, Minnesota preferred. Additional location options include Minneapolis, MN, Bentonville, AR, Naperville, IL, Bridgewater, NJ, or Willmar, MN.

A comprehensive relocation package to the Austin, MN area will be provided if willing to relocate.

BENEFITS:

Hormel Foods offers an excellent benefits package. Competitive base salary plus bonus, annual merit increase performance reviews, medical, dental, vision, non-contributory pension, profit sharing, 401(k), stock purchase plan, relocation assistance, paid vacation.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: Travel may be necessary 10% of the time.

For immediate consideration, send apply online at: www.hormelfoods.com/careers

TruStone Financial is a full-service, member-owned credit union that provides simple yet competitive financial tools to empower our members’ financial well-being. Founded by teachers in 1939, TruStone Financial has since grown to the second-largest credit union in Minnesota and our 550+ employees serve more than 200,000 members across 23 locations in Minnesota and Wisconsin. Our vision is to create exceptional financial experiences, and to do that we need our exceptional people! Join our growing team and help us deliver on our mission to engage, educate and inspire our members to achieve lifelong financial well-being.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:
This position works closely with the VP of Card Services and Card Services Manager on projects, efficiency improvements and organizational initiatives to maximize member value and growth. The person is responsible for supporting the effort to design, build, and execute key card related programs. They will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to identify, develop, and implement strategies to drive the success of the business. They will create key data-driven analysis, dashboards and reports that improve the way we do business. Identify and make recommendations that improve how we serve members and one another. They focus on providing a consistent and positive experience for our members and employees by delivering on our core values.


WHAT YOU’LL BRING:
Availability to work 40 hours per week Monday through Friday between the hours of 8:30am – 5:00pm in our Burnsville Administrative Office; Exempt.

In addition:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, or similar, or equivalent experience
Two years project and business analytics, or related financial experience.
Strong analytical, problem solving, organizational and technical skills.
Ability to manage projects and timelines.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and maintain a positive attitude at all times.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Word.
Excellent customer service skills.
Self-directed with strong initiative and decision-making skills.
Ability to maintain a high level of professionalism while working under pressure.
Ability to think creatively and willingness to explore new options.
Experience with agility project management (preferred).


WHAT WE OFFER:

Competitive pay and incentive programs for all positions.
Health insurance with the ability to choose which plan option is best for you – a Traditional Health Plan or Health Savings Plan.
Affordable dental and vision insurance coverage.
Earn 22 days of paid time off annually for full-time employees with an equivalent accrual for part-time employees – and, the longer your tenure, the more PTO you’ll have to enjoy.
10+ paid holidays each year.
Up to 16 hours of paid time annually to volunteer for organizations you are passionate about.
401(k) with 50% employer match on the first 6% you contribute – plus, after one year of service, an additional 3% safe harbor employer contribution that is immediately 100% vested regardless if you are contributing or not.
Eligibility for profit sharing opportunities in the form of a contribution to your 401(k) account.
Employer-paid Short Term and Long Term Disability benefits.
Employer-provided life insurance up to 2.5x your base salary with the option to purchase additional coverage for yourself, spouse and eligible dependents.
Reimbursement for higher education expenses of up to $5,250 per calendar year (including tuition, books and activity fees).
Career development opportunities – including our STEP job shadow program, TruStone Academy certification courses, and more.
Special employee discounts when you join TruStone Financial as a credit union member.
Employee activities, events, discounts, and many other great benefits and perks!


TruStone Financial Credit Union is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer of Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and all Protected Classes.

Who We Are:

We are looking for a Business Transformation Analyst to join one of the nation’s largest residential real estate services companies — HomeServices of America, a Berkshire Hathaway affiliate. HomeServices is the holding company for top-name real estate brokerages and related companies in more than 25 states, including Minnesota market leader Edina Realty. Our corporate team provides support, oversight, and leadership for subsidiary activities, while ensuring each company maintains local decision-making to operate how they know best. Our vision for the future is to continue to acquire leading companies in new markets. We are recognized for our industry influence, innovation, and professionalism. This new position within our Shared Success Center will be at the center of the action from initial planning to launch and ongoing operations, providing an amazing opportunity for your talents to make an impact!

Position Description:

The Business Transformation Analyst will support functional leads across our Shared Success Center, in documenting and operationalizing regional support models. Support other initiatives within business transformation as directed.

Key areas of responsibility for the position include:

Develop data-driven solutions to complex business problems.
Articulate complex and technical language with non-technical audiences in a manner that is clear, concise, and value added to these audiences.
Identify inefficiencies in reporting processes, provide recommendations, and implement improvements.
Support business transformation reporting and analysis including report development and modeling.
Analyze data, make recommendations and comments, and present to the leadership team for business planning & development.
Perform routine to more complex reporting and analysis while making recommendations that best meet business objectives.
Lead a variety of projects, which may involve developing solutions for problems within the business by effectively summarizing and communicating results.
Identify and recommend changes to policies, procedures, and business models. Provide accurate, timely & responsive services to the business.

Position Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting; or equivalent work experience and knowledge.
3-5 years of experience in business or financial analysis.
Experience with Oracle Database, SQL Database, or similar relational databases.
Experience with Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, or similar data visualization tools.
Understanding of business systems, processes, data, and user needs.
Strong technical skills and aptitude for learning new systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to communicate and collaborate with both business and technical stakeholders.
High level proficiency with Microsoft Excel; Power Query and VBA programming a plus.

What We Offer:

We offer a competitive pay and benefits program including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), paid parental leave, STD, LTD and a great PTO plan!

Our Shared Success Center has opened a new office in Eden Prairie, MN. Our location features many modern amenities, access to onsite parking and public transit, plus an opportunity for hybrid work arrangements!

Equal Employment Opportunity.
