Overview
The Operations Analyst is responsible to measure, analyze, and report on critical cost performance measurements and operation efficiency metrics. This role will identify areas for improvement, recommend improvement initiatives, and track the incorporation of the improvement initiatives.

Primary Responsibilities
Perform reconciliation & variance analysis of monthly operations expenses
Generate weekly and monthly Operations metrics, including data gathering and entry; reports include Annual Operating Budget, Monthly Operating Forecast, Monthly Financial and efficiency metrics
Take ownership of key projects related to operations, including process improvements, supply chain enhancements, and cost reduction initiatives
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Supply Chain, Inventory, Sales, and Finance, to drive efficiency and alignment across the organization, using Lean methodology for continuous improvement
Assess future risk, opportunities, and effectiveness; translate results into meaningful solutions to enhance decision-making; present findings to various levels of leadership
Create, monitor, and maintain metrics and key performance indicators, identifying resulting risks and opportunities
Review data capture processes and procedures; recommend modifications to systems to ensure all relevant metrics data elements are collected as a part of defined standard operational procedures
Audit and confirm the validity and accuracy of all data being reported data
Provide cost/benefit analysis for various projects, as needed
Perform other related duties as assigned

Additional Primary Responsibilities
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and three years of experience or equivalent education and related experience
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Six Sigma and Lean Methodology knowledge
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in data analysis
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project management, organizational, multi-tasking, and time management skills

Physical Demands
Physical demands include a considerable amount of time sitting and typing/keyboarding, using a computer (e.g., keyboard, mouse, and monitor) or adding machine
Physical demands with activity or condition may occasionally include walking, bending, reaching, standing, and stooping
May require occasional lifting/lowering, pushing, carrying, or pulling up to 20lbs

Required:

BA/BS degree and at least four years of progressive experience and cross-functional knowledge of Human Resources, including workforce planning, analytics, consulting, and execution of workforce plans and business intelligence report creation and generation, or a combination of education and/or experience to equal at least eight years.
Demonstrated experience working with diversity and other demographic data needed for diversity programming and/or affirmative action planning. Experience implementing workforce programming to promote engagement, and diversity and inclusion.
Demonstrated experience using data/reporting systems and software applications to create visuals/graphs such as Microsoft Excel.
Proven ability to think critically using data and reach conclusions despite changing circumstances.
Demonstrable experience working with external compensation and/or benefits consultants to design programming that is consistent with market.
Excellent relationship management and social skills. Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and maintain confidentially where necessary.
Demonstrated project management skills. Excellent analytical and creative problem solving skills.
Ability to write clearly and optimally, and experience with report writing and developing presentations.
Proven ability to mentor and influence through subject-matter knowledge and expertise.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with HR professionals and executive leaders across decentralized workforce to ensure equitable compensation practices.
Demonstrated ability to drive change initiatives and data-driven decisions with various audiences through pragmatic and business-responsive strategies.

Preferred:

Demonstrated experience working with senior leaders, both centrally and de-centrally located, preferably in both for-profit and non-profit settings
Demonstrated experience working in a matrixed workforce structure
Demonstrated experience generating business intelligence reports from various HR Management Systems (HRMS) and/or data warehouses.


This position serves as a member of the University of Minnesota Foundation (UMF) People, Culture, and Operations (PCO) team in a multi-functional capacity. The position will supply the information leaders need to make strategic decisions for workforce planning and talent retention, including compiling people analytics and compensation data to ensure market-consistent, reasonable compensation for foundation executives, staff, and development professionals. The Business Analyst will select and compile data—both external market and internal—and prepare business intelligence reports to use in advising UMF executives, chief development officers, and HR professionals across the University.

Starting Salary: $70,000- 75,000 based on experience.

Responsibilities

People Analytics and Reporting (50%)

Partner with the leaders to develop HR scorecard and metrics and supervise data-driven measures of performance and analysis through forecasting and analysis
Collects and compiles UMF workforce metrics and data from a wide variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS) and payroll outputs, management and employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, government labor statistics, competitor’s practices, and other sources.
Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations.
Prepares reports of data results, communicating and explaining findings to PCO leadership
Identifies and recommends reasonable short- and long-term goals, achievements, and benchmarks for key performance metrics.
Point of contact and subject matter authority for ad hoc people data and analytics requests
Continuously improve people analytics & workforce reporting strategy, support model and execution including identifying and improving metrics to support our overall strategy
Build solid relationships and collaborate directly with internal partners including Business leaders and HR business partners to determine reporting and business requirements
Partner with PCO leaders to build analytics deliverables
Lead monthly and quarterly reporting processes
Partner closely with the Sr. Philanthropic Insights Manager to use business intelligence standard methodologies including application and use of dashboards, metrics, interactive reports, and predictive and prescriptive analytics

Strategic Compensation Data (40%)

Working with the VP and AVP of People, Culture and Operations (PCO), strategically benchmark market-based and internal workforce data and translate trend analysis to develop innovative approaches to address workforce needs. Generate easy to understand reporting that demonstrates trend analysis and internal equity analysis
Educate leaders who employ development professionals about the internal and external market realities using data.
Generate and apply business intelligence reports to be used in advising Foundation and development senior leaders regarding the outcome of their market wage data analysis, executive compensation data analysis, and other workforce planning metrics, including turnover and hiring trend data.
Collect and synthesize executive compensation data, and generate reports using internal and external market data needed for the UMF Board of Trustees to settle whether UMF executive pay is reasonable and consistent with market to meet IRS regulations.
Lead UMF’s relationship and work with external consultants to run multiple wage surveys and resulting data needed to maintain competitive advantage for our development and functional workforce.
Plan and provide content for all UMF Board of Trustee (BOT) meetings so executives can make recommendations to the HR Committee based on robust competitive market data, workforce goals and Foundation priorities.
In partnership with UMF’s AVP HR, HR business partner, and the University’s Total Compensation team, provide data needed for internal and external equity considerations.

Other Responsibilities (10%)

Maintains current knowledge in HR business insights, industry workforce and HR trends and procedures through professional development activities.
Identifies and evaluates new tools and techniques in order to keep up to date on the trends and developments in HR across different labor markets
Provides back up to other functional areas and performs other related duties as designated by manager.
Maintains confidentiality and handles critical information and material in an ethical and professional manner.

Demonstrate dedication to valuing diversity and contributing to an equitable and inclusive working and learning environment (exhibit 100% of the time)

Continuous learning in diversity, equity and inclusion for oneself and team via training, podcasts, articles, etc.
Seek to explore and understand cultural differences and create a culture of belonging.
Develop and employ anti-racist practices and principles to accomplish work.
Advocate for employees of all ethnicities, genders, ages and backgrounds
Cultivate and develop inclusive and equitable working relationships with employees, colleagues, stakeholders, etc.

Other duties as assigned

The worker will serve as a Senior Business Analyst/Product Owner for the NF PDPM project. The Worker will be responsible for delivering quality products that meet the state's desired operational and technical requirements. The worker will have considerable latitude to use their experience and judgement to ensure successful completion of their assigned tasks. The worker will be required to multi-task, analyze priorities, communicate clearly, and set expectations for the phases of the project. The worker will be responsible for communicating with multiple internal and external stakeholders including program and technical staff, and other contracted and vendor resources. The worker will participate in meetings, track deliverables and schedules, and alert management of any issues that may impact providers.

The services to be provided include, but are not limited to the following:

A. Analyzes program policies, procedures, and processes to determine the impact on business systems and functional areas.

B. Analyzes and reviews system, data, and project deliverables such as business user requirements, design documentation, test plans, and risk assessment plans to ensure business and technical requirements are met.

C. Works with program area staff to solicit, analyze and document business processes and requirements.

D. Acts as a liaison between state staff and vendors to translate operational and business requirements to vendors.

E. Serves as the Product Owner for an agile team, including working with agile/scrum teams of contracted software vendors to implement system changes.

F. Analyzes and writes User Stories with Acceptance Criteria based on business needs and according to the Agile methodology.

G. Develops and maintains business user test scenarios and participates in systems and user acceptance testing.

H. Creates use case scenarios, test plans, and exit criteria that accurately map back to the documented business requirements or user stories.

I. Reviews, analyzes and executes test cases with a formal testing tool.

J. Tracks, documents and reports the status of testing.

K. Evaluates proposed test strategies to ensure appropriate test coverage.

L. Identifies potential project risks and issues and develops mitigation strategies,

M. Reports project status to management on established timelines.

N. Documents action items and business decisions.

O. Conducts meetings and/or presentation tasks as needed.

P. Manages schedule for deliverables as established.

Q. Other duties as assigned related to the NF PDPM project.

Are you an analytical and strategic thinker with a passion for work system optimization? Do you thrive on working with data to identify challenges and suggest improvements? Loffler is seeking a Tactical Business Analyst to manage project planning and execution support for our core process initiatives. In this role, you will work with departments across the organization, gathering data and analyzing work systems to derive simplifications and improvements. You'll create project charters, define project scope and objectives, and manage operational process analysis and workflow development. With your strong communication skills and attention to detail, you'll ensure successful project outcomes and build positive relationships with all Loffler departments and partners. This is a hybrid-remote position that will report to our St. Louis Park, MN office. Apply now and take the first step towards a rewarding career at our Loffler!

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

All areas of responsibility listed below are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position, with reasonable accommodation, if necessary. Any non-essential functions are assumed to be included in "other related duties as assigned":

Assist departments with documenting their Work Systems and Work Improvement Plans. Break down the long-term organizational goals, into shorter-term targets (ie. Quarterly).
Identify where challenges lie, and then collect and analyze data, and suggest work system improvements.
For resulting projects, create the project charters and through interviews with Product Owners, help define project scope, identify stakeholders, and understand the vision and objectives.
Define future state for project outcomes by outlining the greater vision, defining SMART (specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, time-bound) goals, and identifying processes that may need to change.
Define change strategy for project outcomes, and ensure a project delivers its intended results and outcomes, so there is adoption by all stakeholders.
Write effective project tasks with clear acceptance criteria, to achieve project requirements.
Define the current state of systems and processes, gather information about how a system really works and where the root problems exist.
Consult with the Operational Business Analyst on specific requests for change, and follow established department guidelines as it relates to Change Management.
Consult with the Strategic Business Analyst to discuss any alignment with larger business strategies
If needed, assist the Operational Business Analyst or other project team members, write out the necessary project tasks to achieve the deliverables, and create the acceptance criteria.
Manage operational process analysis and workflow development.
Utilize tools to create process diagrams, decision trees, and mind mapping to create the necessary workflows, alerts, dashboards, reporting, and security required for the business units to be as efficient as possible.
Follow established departmental procedures using ConnectWise Manage and project management software to track the status of change and issue tickets, project tasks, and the time spent on both.
Maintain open lines of communication and build good working relationships with all Loffler departments and partners.
Consistently exhibit Loffler's Core Values: Can Do Positive Attitude, Professional, Results Driven, Customer First, Integrity, and Innovative.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Strong attention to detail and critical thinking/problem solving skills.
Self-starter with ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Excellent listening and communication skills.

Education/Experience:

College degree is required
Business Analyst certification required or 5 years experience in business analyst work. May consider project management or IT Project Services experience as a substitute, depending on relevant experience.
Knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma is preferred.
Technical aptitude is preferred, ability to identify tools and create solutions.
Ability to write out user stories.
Experience with creating Power BI or Tableau dashboards and knowledge of how to extract data is preferred.
Knowledge of how to use Microsoft Productivity Suite, including, but not limited to, Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, and project management software is required. Lucid Chart is helpful.
Working knowledge of Loffler's core applications is helpful but not required: Eautomate ERP, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, ConnectWise Manage.

Job Summary



*** Telework (Within Minnesota or Neighboring States) and flexible hours options are available.***


As a Division Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for performing a variety of business related functions for the Economic Assistance and Employment Supports Division (EAESD) so that different program components of the Division support the mission and objectives of the Division and that the public receives the highest quality services. This person provides specialized consultative and technical assistance to program directors, administrators, and business management staff regarding their accounting for and compliance with program funding, eligibility and fiscal related matters, and field practices to work groups, community-based organizations and other internal staff. The incumbent is intricately involved with resource management of EAESD programs and works frequently across the division and agency. The incumbent interprets state/federal regulations and program circulars pertaining to financial issues, assist program supervision with understanding complex financial statements, provides analysis of financial reports; and provides other financial expertise related to EAESD programs as requested or assigned.

Responsibilities include but may not be limited to:

Provide financial expertise and support to the Division Director and deputy directors so that the division operates within budget funding constraints, and according to legislative mandates.
Provide leadership, guidance, technical, analytical and functional expertise and coordination to the activities of variety of teams and business areas performing evaluation, development, design, testing, and/or implementation of EAESD initiatives so that EAESD programs and decision making are carried out with maximum effectiveness and business requirements are met with minimal disruption to operations, county organizations, and the public.
Direct the development, execution and management of all the division’s RFIs, RFPs, professional/technical contracts, grants, interagency agreements, annual plans and any amendments.
Develop, implement and maintain reporting capabilities, both system and manual, to support the reporting needs for the Title V and Title 7 programs and the Division Director.
Analyze the division’s existing business processes so that the division knows whether it is meeting its objectives and serving its customers.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications

**To facilitate proper crediting, please ensure that your resume clearly describes your experience in the areas listed and indicates the beginning and ending month and year for each job held.**

Three (3) years of professional experience in project management or business analysis. Experience must demonstrate:

Knowledge of performance monitoring techniques, the use of management reports, and contracts to implement changes and detect performance trends.
Understanding of the statistical process and techniques and government financial practices.
Analyzing abstract data, draw inferences, and communicate these inferences both orally and in writing.
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to adapt to continuous change in processes, organizational structures, and roles sufficient to work constructively under extreme pressure, to cope with ambiguity, and to deal effectively with setbacks.
Variety of experiences working effectively with others from different background and cultures.
Additional Requirements

EDUCATION VERIFICATION - Applicants will be required to provide a copy of their college transcript or college degree/diploma at time of interview. Copies of the college degree/diploma are acceptable ONLY if it clearly identifies the field in which it was earned.

HealthPartners is currently hiring for Disease and Case Management Data & Operations Analyst. We are a nonprofit integrated care delivery and financing system based in Bloomington, MN. At HealthPartners, you’ll find a culture where we live our values of excellence, compassion, integrity, and partnership. By working together, we will improve health and well-being, create exceptional experiences for those we serve and make care and coverage more affordable. We seek colleagues who wish to help advance diversity, equity and inclusion and foster an environment where everyone feels welcome, included, and valued.


ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Develops and maintains a reporting process that supports the production and distribution of both routine and ad hoc reporting of outcomes and results for: Department programs and initiatives. Department key process indicators. Concurrent review data. Patient and provider satisfaction. Staff productivity. Vendor reporting. Member eligibility verification. Annual plan goals and objectives. Regulatory and accreditation requirements.
Designs and executes quantitative studies and analysis of data to support management action or decision-making.
Assures the production and distribution of well-designed reports to appropriate Disease and Case Management staff and leadership staff on pre-defined or ad hoc schedules.
Monitors, analyzes, and coordinates Disease and Case Management reports from other areas, including IS&T and Strategic Health Informatics, to ensure timely and actionable data are routinely received and used.
Assists with the development and implementation of appropriate departmental policies and procedures that maintain accuracy of data and efficiency of report management (in collaboration with IS&T, Strategic Health Informatics, or other data analysis units.)
Conducts staff training on data documentation, performance and outcomes measurement requirements.
Defines hardware and software requirements and capital equipment needs to support departmental accountabilities, recommends needs to management, and oversees implementation.
Uses available system tools, maintains knowledge of corporate databases, and works with other analysts within HealthPartners to improve data quality and consistent reporting standards.
Maintains appropriate confidentiality of information in accordance with HealthPartners corporate policies.
Participates in ongoing independent study, education related professional activities, and professional affiliations to maintain knowledge in the areas of case management, information systems, data analysis and reporting, and project management.
Demonstrates effective project management skills, including the use of project planning and tracking tools; development of achievable goals, objectives, and timelines; and innovative use of resources.
Demonstrates responsiveness to and appreciation of constructive feedback and recommendations for personal growth and development.
Willingly participates in and/or effectively leads various workgroups and projects as needed and assigned.
Performs other duties as assigned.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

BA/BS degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or equivalent in college courses and job experience.
Three years experience working with complex databases to extract data, identify trends, analyze and make recommendations or decisions based on findings.
Three years direct experience using Microsoft Office for spreadsheets, flowcharts, and word processing.
Two years experience and proficiency in developing reports in Crystal Reports, Business Objects, and Microsoft Power BI.
One year experience in project management or equivalent role.
Demonstrated skill and experience in effectively relating to and collaboratively working with directors, managers, and/or supervisors as well as peers.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or equivalent.
Previous work experience in managed care, health care setting, or case management department.
Experience working and negotiating with external vendors.


DECISION-MAKING:

This position is responsible for developing and recommending the type, scope and general direction for database, report, and project design and development. The Senior Director, or management designee, is responsible for decisions associated with department direction and long-term planning.

Description

Summary:

The Commercial Digital Integration team is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst to define requirements and designs for common reusable integrations across all customer facing Channels for Commercial Customers. You will work directly on an Agile scrum team in close partnership with business product teams and developers to deliver new features and functionality for customer facing commercial banking applications. The candidate would start with a focus on a new direct to customer API & Transmissions channel that is being newly formed and will be a major long term focus for growing our commercial business.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Work closely with the Product Owner, clearly defining user stories and ensuring that the right level of detail is included from a requirements, business rules, data mapping, etc. perspective to meet the teams’ definition of ready to start development in a sprint
Understands the needs related to the product by working closely with the Product Owner, SMEs, and other business partners, so they can clearly communicate the product vision and client's needs to the Agile project team and stakeholders.
Work closely with Architects and Tech Leads to ensure that technical requirements or technical debt is covered in the backlog and reviewed and prioritized as necessary with the Product Owner.
Completes system and data analysis of the source and/or target system and data mapping to support API development
Partners with data architects to ensure that API schema definition is completed and meets any necessary standards
Reviews or creates process and flow maps to understand the business processes and system flows
Documents and identifies story dependencies to help facilitate backlog refinement and prioritization.
Assist QA team members to ensure that appropriate testing is achieved and assist with testing as needed.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree
Min 5 years of experience in business systems analysis

Preferred Qualifications:

Demonstrated ability to organize and facilitate large cross functional meetings.
Conduct comprehensive requirements reviews with project stakeholders, development, architecture and QA teams.
Good reporting and excel skills, understanding of XML, JSON, web services and API mapping.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills

The Role:
We are seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst to join our Government Solutions team. As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality motor carrier administration systems and services to help jurisdictions manage their International Fuel Tax Agreement and International Registration Plan processes. This position provides support to both a project team responsible for delivering large project items, and a support team responsible for enhancements and resolving issues.
What You’ll Do:
A large focus for this role is writing and maintaining detailed documentation of user and system requirements, including user stories and acceptance criteria using agile methodology.
Includes providing technical analysis of business requirements, problem solving and troubleshooting technical issues. Acting as a liaison between developers and end users to provide business critical or technical solutions that meet user needs and improve their business processes.
Involves moderate to difficult analyst tasks, following Explore methodologies, and utilizing company tools and systems.
Execute project planning tasks including status reporting, updating and assigning tasks to developers, and participating in or facilitating team sessions.
Test, evaluate, and validate systems for business stakeholders and provide demonstrations of the system after milestone deliveries.
Provide new and innovative approaches to business solutions and leverage domain and analyst practice expertise to provide the most effective solutions to the business partners in the most efficient means possible.
Select and apply appropriate analysis techniques and tools (process modeling, use cases, etc.) for each project.
Negotiate technical and non-technical solutions that both satisfy the business users and conform to the technical architecture.
Participate in external client, vendor, and on-site meetings. Minimal travel may be required.
What You’ll Bring:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent.
Or a minimum of 2-4 years of progressive technical and business experience that includes analytical thinking and processes with problem-solving.
Business analyst experience performing requirements definition, analysis, documentation and design, and project management.
UX/UI/Design Experience
Polished presentation experience with excellent verbal/written communication skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Proficient in Azure DevOps or Jira.
Must be able to proficiently query data from a SQL server or other relational database.
Experience working within a defined development life cycle methodology including waterfall and Agile.
Inquisitive with a passion for learning complex systems to be able to extract and document requirements which aid in the design and development of enhancements and new builds.
Adaptability to work in a fast-paced environment while working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Adhere to and champion company best practices.
Successful experience working with external customers.
Ability to work independently owning tasks and delivering high-quality services on time.

POSITION OVERVIEW:

Responsible for leading and engaging with internal customers to deliver enterprise systems and software necessary for the college to conduct business and ensuring the support of said systems. Responsible for the technology systems on campus, and for coordinating the support of related external systems that interface with them. Works through project activity to improve and support data security, integrity, and project tasks for the College. Participates in development of the College’s technology plan.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES/FUNCTIONS:

Administer, support, and maintain the ERP system including the databases, applications, user accounts, security, including coordinating all system patches and upgrades.

Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.

Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.

Lead project teams related to administrative and business systems to ensure shared understanding of project goals, tasks, and timeline.

Participate in and lead negotiations with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure hardware, software, support, and other professional services.

Evaluate and implement best practices for data processing and client business processes.

Identify organization, department, and user requirements, procedures, and problems.

Analyze, automate, and improve existing systems and business processes.

Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings to enhance IT services for the Dunwoody community.

Perform requirements analysis, documenting the results, including documentation of IT standard operating procedures and map systems diagrams for the institution.

Effectively communicate findings, insights, and plans to cross-functional team members and management.

Ensure the administrative IT department’s goals, projects, and objectives are in line and help fulfill the educational mission and business operational needs of the college.

Ensure disaster recovery and business continuance of Dunwoody systems and applications are met.

Support IT infrastructure strategy and long-term planning based on institutional objectives.

Apply in-depth understanding of enterprise systems stakeholders to help map processes, workflows, and create efficiencies where needed.

Delegate or assign tasks and requirements to IT members and power users as required.

Direct the activities of outsourced personnel and vendors to provide continued maintenance and growth of the campus enterprise systems.

Assist with budget planning for projects and expenditures related to administrative systems.

Prioritize and manage college systems and projects according to Dunwoody project administration standards.

Coordinate with vendors to ensure that professional staff training needs are met.

Lead education and information sharing activities among departments on campus.

Serve as liaison to the campus regarding enterprise system offerings.

Support and maintain change management procedures for enterprise systems.

Establish a working knowledge of all other department functions as backup for absences and vacancies.

CORE COMPETENCIES

Strategic Skills:Has the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level. Makes good decisions. Provides sound advice
and problem solution. Provides honest and in-depth analysis on problems and issues.
Operating Skills:Makes decisions in a timely manner. Accepts responsibility for tasks and meets objectives and measures. Documents process,
progress, and results. Is committed to continuous improvement. Works toward the most efficient and effective work processes.
Courage: Has difficult conversations as necessary. Faces up to people problems on any person or situations quickly and directly.
Energy and Drive:Is action oriented and full of energy for challenging tasks/issues. Is constantly and consistently one of the top performers.
Steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
Organizational Positioning Skills:Can maneuver through complex situations effectively and quietly. Is sensitive to how people and organizations
function. Anticipates where the land mines are and plans his/her approach accordingly.
Personal/Interpersonal Skills:Relates well to all kinds of people. Builds constructive and effective relationships. Is dedicated to meeting the
expectations and requirements of internal and external customers. Supports equal and fair treatment and opportunity for all. Adheres to Dunwoody’s
core values. Is widely trusted - Keeps confidences and admits mistakes. Practices attentive and active listening. Is personally committed to and
actively works to continuously improve him/herself.

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, business information systems, or related field.

5 years of experience supporting multiple client/server applications and web applications on multiple server and database platforms, including Microsoft Windows Server and Microsoft SQL Server.

5 years of experience in business analysis, requirements gathering, collaboration, translating requirements into technical specifications, and documentation of all types including project, user, technical, etc.

Demonstrated knowledge and work experience with enterprise-wide relational databases, scripting languages, XML, SQL Server, BI reporting tools.

Proficient in using SQL for application development, reporting, data profiling, and data analysis.

Experience in data modeling and information architecture, including relational and dimensional.

Experience with data management and integration design and implementations.

Experience conducting quality assurance and user acceptance testing.

Job Profile Summary: This position consults with internal customers to analyze, design, develop and maintain the technical application systems to support business needs. Responsible for translating business requirements into technical system specifications for teams within the Information Technology (IT) department. Job Description:




Principle Responsibilities

Analysis and documentation
Identify and define business, functional and interface requirements.
Construct workflow charts and diagrams.
Process complex service requests from the analysis and definition of customer requirements through intake, approvals, service delivery, implementation and fulfillment.
Analyze and provide solutions or recommendations to resolve complex customer inquiries for functionality not working as implemented.
Validate resource requirements, develop cost estimate models and gain sign-off from stakeholder.
Manage simple requirement conflicts, and escalate complex requirement conflicts to senior level analysts.
Communicate to internal IT providers of hardware, software and network requirements. Partner with senior analyst if negotiation is needed.
Implement, modify, test, and administer business system applications under minimal supervision.
Improve current systems by studying practices and designing modifications.
Study and evaluate emerging technologies for potential company use.
Customer management and support
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Implement, tests, and deploy solutions to business problems.
Follow incident, change and release management processes.
May be required to provide on-call support outside of regular business hours.
Provide training for end-users and other analysts.
Project management
Under supervision, manage small to medium projects by developing project plans and monitoring performance.
Actively participate on larger project teams utilizing project methodology tools.
Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Other duties as assigned.

KGPCo is the go-to partner to Communications Service Providers. Our customers rely on our extensive range of network solutions and services to help them build, maintain, and transform networks that connect the world.

Responsibilities:

Gather business requirements from various cross-functional groups of their reporting and data analysis need and translate them into effective Power BI solutions.
Responsible for data integrity as well as the quality of data; collaborates with technology and other staff to develop plans to avoid or mitigate data quality issues.

Department/Location: Information Technology / 1001 Washington Ave N

Summary

The primary purpose of this position is responsibility for assisting with the planning, development, training/adoption and maintenance/support of the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and business process. The incumbent customizes and configures the applications, workflow and business process to allow the integration of applications to support the needs of the Agency. The incumbent also works on complex ERP projects, develops efficient/effective processes and ensures client needs are met through project management and analysis.

All activities must support the Minneapolis Public Housing Authority’s ('MPHA' or 'Agency') mission, vision and values.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

The position duties and responsibilities listed below describe the general nature and scope of work. Other responsibilities, duties and skills may be required and assigned, as needed.

Manages, develops and maintains the function and technology of the ERP system; maintains partnerships with the ERP and third-party vendors; supports the ERP system daily and involves the vendor support as needed.
Provides regular ERP upgrade planning, support and technical leadership to maintain a current ERP system.
Consults with key stakeholders in a proactive manner to establish project scope and timeline.
Develops detailed business requirements document (BRD) with input from process owners, subject matter experts (SME), and other stakeholders.
Provide applications design and architectural support on projects work with ERP system SMEs.
Responsible for quality assurance testing of the solution. Ensures that the scope, contract and business requirements are met.
Creates and manages project plans, ensures team accountability of the plan, and is responsible for key project constraints: scope, resources, schedule, budget, quality, risks, and issues.
Establishes communication plans including internal meetings, statuses with key stakeholders, and other communication as required during the project.
Evaluates alternative approaches with key stakeholders with a focus on value.
Elicits regular feedback from Agency stakeholders regarding effectiveness and operation of the ERP system; and makes recommendations for enhancements, improvements and changes.
Collaborates with consultants and vendors to optimize ERP system performance and determines scope/priority of ERP system enhancements as necessary.
Responsible for a 'change control' process throughout the project lifecycle, proactively monitors and controls any change in scope, and elicits approval or resolution of any changes among all internal and external stakeholders.
Develops partnerships to understand process and automation needs of MPHA, and to support department and Agency systems.
Partners with IT team and other MPHA departments to ensure that Agency needs are met through the ERP system. Partners with ERP system vendor to maintain expertise in the ERP system functions and regularly communicates with IT team and required users.
Develops and maintains ERP system and process documentation for MPHA. Responsible for ensuring process and automation adoption for the effective and efficient use of the ERP system to support the mission of MPHA.
Provides and maintains ERP system and process training for MPHA users and ensures capabilities are effectively used.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

Behavioral Competencies

MPHA expects all employees to exhibit the following behavioral skills:

Customer Service: Meets/exceeds the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; identifies, understands, monitors and measures the needs of both internal and external customers; talks and acts with customers in mind; and recognizes working colleagues as customers.

Commitment: Sets high standards of performance; pursues aggressive goals and works hard/smart to achieve them; strives for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and brings issues to closure; and persists despite obstacles and opposition.

Effective Communication: Employee is prepared, clear, concise and organized in all facets of communication in order to fully establish understanding. Actively listens and understands the audience to adapt message appropriately. Communicates information with appropriate personnel in a timely manner.

Teamwork: Balances team and individual responsibilities; exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; gives and welcomes feedback; contributes to building a positive team spirit; puts success of team above own interests; supports everyone's efforts to succeed.

Initiative: Proactively seeks solutions to resolve unexpected challenges. Actively assists others without formal/informal direction. Possesses the capacity to learn and actively seeks developmental feedback. Applies feedback for continued growth by mastering concepts needed to perform work.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

To perform this job successfully, the employee is frequently required to remain in a stationary position. Daily movements include sitting; standing; reaching and grasping; operating computers and other office equipment; moving about the office; and attending onsite and offsite meetings. The employee must be able to exchange information in person, in writing, and via telephone. The employee must occasionally transport up to 25 pounds.

Work Environment

This position includes an option for a voluntary hybrid telecommuting arrangement, following successful completion of the initial training program and in coordination with the supervisor. This option will be discussed during the interview process. Please note that hybrid telework arrangements are only an option when the telework location is in the State of Minnesota. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The work environment requires a demonstrated ability to interact effectively with persons from diverse economic, social, and ethnic backgrounds, including new immigrants, limited English language proficiency clients, and clients with a variety of mental health issues and other disabilities.

Office environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Experience and Skills:

Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in information technology, management information systems, computer science, or related field and a minimum of five (5) years of experience with: Enterprise Business Application implementation or enterprise class system experience in a business or technical capacity; managing a business project involving cross-functional team members; developing training materials and presenting technology-related training sessions to end users; and evaluating technology solutions and presenting results and recommendations. Must have experience working with Windows operating systems or public housing software applications. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Some positions may require possession of a valid driver’s license. Those positions may also require use of a personal vehicle and evidence of individual automobile insurance coverage, or the ability to be insurable under the Authority’s automobile insurance plan at the standard rate. Must pass a criminal history background check.

Technical Skills

To perform this job successfully, the incumbent should have strong computer skills including Office 365 (MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook), Visio, SharePoint (Form and Workflow design), SQL Database, SSRS, and EDMS. Yardi Voyageur experience is preferred. Must have previous exposure to and understanding of Housing Management Systems and Financial systems used in a government or regulated industry function. Must have the ability to learn other computer software programs as required by assigned tasks.
Job Benefits:

The Minneapolis Public Housing Authority also offers an excellent benefits package that includes: Medical and Dental Insurance; Retirement plan; 457 deferred compensation plan; Group term life insurance (and optional term life insurance plans for family members); Long term disability insurance; paid sick leave; paid vacation leave; 12 paid holidays per year; tuition reimbursement program.

Thank you for your interest in becoming part of the team at Legrand!
GENERAL PURPOSE
The Business Systems Analyst for LegrandAV.com plays a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs, customer needs, and technology solutions for B2B customers. This position involves the analysis, design, and implementation of effective systems and processes to enhance business functionality, productivity, and efficiency, with a strong emphasis on Agile methodology. They will work closely with stakeholders to understand their requirements, document them, and translate them into Agile-based technical solutions, facilitating successful project outcomes. This position will be a hybrid working position out of our Eden Prairie, MN office.
Act as a liaison between the business and technical teams to gather and document requirements for new and existing products and projects for LegrandAV.com and related applications
Analyze existing business processes, systems, and data to identify areas for improvement. Document current and future state processes, data flows, and system functionalities
Develop functional specifications that outline the requirements for technology solutions, including user requirements, system functionality, and data integration
Understand and document integration between LegrandAV.com and various platforms such as SAP, Salesforce, and e-commerce products
Work with the LegrandAV.com teams, cross-functional technology teams, and vendors to define technology solutions
Work with the technology team to drive the automation of key business process and ensure solutions are properly integrated with other systems and applications
Collaborate with product managers and technical teams to develop and implement technological changes, including managing internal tickets and prioritization
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to ensure project objectives are met
Develop and execute test plans to ensure that the proposed solutions meet the specified requirements. Collaborate with QA teams to identify and resolve issues
Identify and manage project dependencies, risks, and issues to ensure that projects are delivered successfully
Communicate project progress, risks, and issues to stakeholders and ensure that everyone involved in the project is aware of the status and any changes to the project plan
Conducting training and support for end-users to ensure that they can effectively use technology solutions
Develop and implement metrics to measure the effectiveness of technology solutions and identify areas for continuous improvement
Demonstrate our core values of Customer, People, Integrity, Teamwork, Continuous Learning & Improvement, and Empowerment & Accountability
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Essential Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Excellent skill in eliciting, documenting, and managing business requirements. This includes understanding user needs and translating them into technical specifications
Familiarity with web technology, frameworks, and IT systems and platforms such as SAP, Salesforce, CRM etc.
Should be able to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, UAT testers, and other business stakeholders
Ability to conduct interviews, workshops, and other methods to gain deep understanding of business processes and business needs
Ability to document process maps
Knowledge of user interface design principles and user-centric design processes
Strong understanding of project management principles and methodologies
Ability to drive change through influence and collaboration and able to effectively manage relationships with project sponsors and stakeholders
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical skills to evaluate and interpret complex data, systems, and business processes
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
Appreciation for design thinking
Foundational understanding of digital B2B
Minimum Education and Experience Required:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
Minimum 3 years of experience in business analysis and product management
Minimum 3 years of information technology experience in an enterprise setting
Minimum 1 year of basic project management experience
Experience with Agile methodologies

Job Title: Corporate Services Business Analyst - Hybrid in Minnetonka, MN
Job Description:
UnitedHealth Group is a health care and well-being company that’s dedicated to improving the health outcomes of millions around the world. We are comprised of two distinct and complementary businesses, UnitedHealthcare and Optum, working to build a better health system for all. Here, your contributions matter as they will help transform health care for years to come. Make an impact with a diverse team that shares your passion for helping others. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.

At UnitedHealth Group, we're changing the future of health care and we have the expertise, advanced technology, and global resources to make it happen. As a Senior Business Analyst, you'll work with the brightest minds in the business and find yourself digging deep to find the solutions to help people live healthier lives. You'll be responsible for analyzing, reviewing, and forecasting data for operational and business planning to impact the health care system. What could be more satisfying than that?

UHG Corporate Services is a dynamic member of UnitedHealth Group, one of the largest health care companies in the world. We’re doing everything in our power to make health care work better for everyone. That includes the entire spectrum of health care participants: individual consumers and employers, commercial payers and intermediaries, physicians, hospitals, pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers, and more. Corporate Services includes departments that provide vital support and partnership to UHG business customers and includes, Enterprise Procurement, Enterprise Real Estate Services, and Reporting, Data, and Analytics. Corporate Service departments provide innovative strategic planning and execution, analysis and reporting to ensure the enterprise operates at its highest potential.

As a UHG Corporate Services Senior Business Analyst in Reporting, Data, and Analytics team, you will work closely with UHG Corporate Services management to participate in analysis that may include any of the following: internal consulting, business case development, strategic alliance and change management, cost savings initiatives, marketing of the strategic sourcing organization and supplier diversity, financial modeling analysis of projects and proposals, and analyzing spend to develop innovative strategies that drive business value and enterprise consistency.

Candidates should be able to gather business information and synthesize it logically and analytically to communicate an effective message to leadership.

This role will support the Reporting, Data, and Analytics team on all goals, objectives, research, recommendations, partnerships, projects, and programs as assigned. You will be empowered to support short and long term operational/strategic business activities and develop, enhance, and maintain operational information and models that will have an impact on business decisions. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make contributions and create valuable solutions to improve the health care system.

Primary Responsibilities:

Provide analysis to support decision making including presenting economic outcomes and identifying key value drivers, benefits, perspectives, and risks
Effectively work with data produced through several digital tools, environments, and services. Requires comfort in ambiguity
Analyze, review, forecast, and trend complex data, including financial data
Provide insights and thought leadership to internal customers advising on options and contributing to decision making
Develop business cases to support strategic business activities and decisions
Present analysis and interpretation for operational and business review and planning
Develop concise, data-driven communications to influence internal customers, business partners and leadership; simplify complex information to ensure understanding
Develop ad-hoc client and operational reports and analysis to support Corporate Services’ initiatives
Present analysis and findings for operational/business review and planning purposes
Support short and long term operational/strategic business activities through online research and analysis
Develop recommended business solutions through research and analysis of data and business process to implement when appropriate

This is a complex, fast-paced, matrixed environment with a lot of moving parts. The challenge is in developing, enhancing and maintaining operational information and models. You'll be expected to interpret and analyze large amounts of data from multiple sources and use it to tell a meaningful story to a variety of stakeholders and personalities.

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelors’ degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration, related field, or 3+ years of experience in business / financial analysis
3+ years of experience in business / financial analysis
Experience with requirements scoping, financial analysis and compiling / communicating the findings and recommendations
Experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and / or evaluation of business processes
Experience gathering and documenting requirements from the client / business
Advanced Excel proficiency including financial and scenario based modeling/analysis
Demonstrated ability to develop model, communicate analysis, including trends and opportunities, effectively and concisely to internal customers, both in writing and verbally
Demonstrated ability to problem solve performing research conflicting / inaccurate or ambiguous data
Hybrid working model with minimum three days in the Minnesota Corporate office. Flexible on day selections
Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization (F-1 students with practical training and candidates requiring H-1Bs, TNs, etc. will not be considered)

Preferred Qualifications:

MBA degree
Software experience with SQL and Tableau
Multiple years of experience gathering requirements from the client/business and documenting
Experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and / or evaluation of business processes
Experience working with statistical models and performing statistical analysis
Ability and experience developing business cases (operational and financial) to support transformative initiatives
Working knowledge of relational databases and database structures
Proven solid history of quickly gaining credibility, partnering with business leaders, and exhibiting executive presence
Proven ability to articulate business strategies and formulate concise solutions to complex problems
Proven solid consultative, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
Proven champion continuous change, consult with versatility, exhibit personal leadership, and model a customer orientation

At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Position Description

As the largest and most vibrant city in the state, Minneapolis depends on purposeful, dedicated and innovative employees. Minneapolis has a large variety of careers for people of all experiences and backgrounds who come together for a singular purpose-serving the residents, businesses and visitors of Minneapolis.

We are looking to fill open positions in two departments, Performance Management & Innovation and Regulatory Services.

The Department of Performance Management and Innovation helps the City innovate and transform residents’ lives. Working with residents, City departments, elected officials, stakeholders, organizations and community partners, we push for bold new ideas, collaborate to develop solutions that support community-centered service delivery and demonstrate measurable results. An internal consultancy within the enterprise, our collaborative approach advances innovation and moves the dial on equity by:

Carefully exploring the issue and its unique challenges
Understanding what has worked before and what others are doing successfully
Leveraging techniques that generate new, relevant ideas
Providing structured project management to drive outcomes
Maintaining a data-driven culture that demonstrate results

The Department of Regulatory Services serves the City of Minneapolis and its residents through community-focused education and engagement as well as compassionate and guiding enforcement. These efforts mean that Regulatory Services is dedicated to protecting the health, safety, and welfare of City residents and pets through our business lines of:

Animal Care & Control
Operations + Engagement
Traffic Control
Inspections Services

We lead in innovative and creative ways, believing that how we do things is as important as what we do. As a department, we strive to support change and center equity in order to ensure a positive impact on our employees and the public we serve. Our meaningful work is supported by a healthy work culture, performance management, transparency and accountability.

The Business Process and Data Analyst will work in partnership with existing City staff and other stakeholders to identify areas where our public services are contributing to inequities. Perform research, data analysis, forecasting, data modeling, and generate dynamic content using enterprise, department, and third-party data sources. Provide assistance in the management, analysis, and visualization of department data. Develop data-driven processes to assess problems, generate responsive and innovative solutions, and deliver equitable and measurable results.

Work Location: This position may be eligible for flexible work arrangements, including hybrid work with some days working remotely and some days working in the office.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

Analyze performance data and interpret data trends using a variety of techniques and tools.
Coordinate research efforts, including best practice studies, literature searches and survey work to provide continued optimization of efficiency and effectiveness in operations and programs.
Develop, implement and sustain enterprise and department specific strategies related to the collection, reporting and stewardship of performance data.
Assist in the development and management of the team process for identifying and addressing continuous improvement opportunities for City services.
Assist in the coordination, creation and improvement of innovation generating techniques for City staff including the design and delivery of training curriculum.
Work with City staff to provide candid assessments of program performance and strategies for improving City services
Managing and maintaining strong relationships with numerous city government officials and other stakeholders
Assist in the development and maintenance of the city website to report performance information to the public, Mayor, City Council and employees.

Working Conditions: Normal Office Setting

Required Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree Public Administration, Business Administration, Economics or a related field or equivalent.

Minimum Experience: Two years of experience performing duties related to those listed above.

Equivalency: An equivalent combination of education and experience closely related to the duties of the position may be considered.

Selection Process: The selection process will consist of one or more of the following steps: a rating of relevant education and experience and/or an oral examination (100%). It is important that your application show all the relevant education and experience you possess. This information will be used to determine which candidates will proceed in the selection process. A submitted application is also used to verify the answers to any supplemental questions. Only those candidates who attain a passing score (70%) on each step in the selection process will be placed on the eligible list. The City of Minneapolis Human Resources Department reserves the right to limit the number in any phase of the selection process.

Interview Selection: The hiring authority reserves the right to determine the maximum number of candidates to interview from the established eligible list. If the hiring authority decides to interview other than by exam score order, they may select additional people to interview based on a candidate's education or experience related to the field, work history, or skills uniquely related to the operational needs of the position.

Background Check: The City has determined that a criminal background check and/or qualifications check may be necessary for certain positions with this job title. Applicants may be required to sign an informed consent form allowing the City to obtain their criminal history and/or verify their qualifications in connection with the position sought. Applicants who do not sign the informed consent form will not be further considered for the position.

Union Representation: This position is represented by a collective bargaining agreement between the City of Minneapolis and the Minneapolis Public Employees Association (MPEA). For more information on the terms and conditions of this agreement please visit:https://www2.minneapolismn.gov/government/departments/hr/labor-agreements/

Eligible List: The names of applicants who meet minimum qualifications and who pass the screening process shall be placed on the eligible list for employment consideration. This list will be certified to the hiring managers who may use the list to fill a vacancy of the same job title. This eligible list will expire two month after it has been established.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Ability to coordinate multiple projects at the same time and organize work to meet deadlines and conflicting priorities.
Ability to understand policy and management implications of program issues and make recommendations.
Ability to analyze, interpret and report results of analysis.
Preferred experience with GIS and mapping analysis
Ability to present clear and concise reports, both orally and in writing.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships in the City structure at all levels.
Knowledge of performance measures.
Preferred knowledge of business process analysis techniques - e.g., Lean
Knowledge of program planning, including evaluation, communication methods and techniques.
Strong knowledge and use of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Strong presentation and facilitation skills.
Preferred knowledge of City structure, policies and regulations governing the operations of City departments.
Understanding of income, racial and place-based inequities and related current

dialogue.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $62,730.72 - $86,736.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Minneapolis, MN 55415

.

Job Overview
In this role as a Business Analyst with an added focus on data engineering, you will assist in developing, deploying, and supporting various Digital Foundation (DF) initiatives and Smart Manufacturing applications. Your role will involve traditional business analysis tasks and working closely with data engineering technologies and practices. You should have a solid customer-facing background, with experience in the manufacturing process (food and beverage industry preferred but optional) and be comfortable working with team members across different time zones.
Your primary responsibility will be to work closely with business users to define problem statements/requirements, create and review mapping documents for data engineers, perform data analysis, manage data integration and quality checks, and ensure that data structures are designed effectively for analytical needs.
Responsibilities:
Participate in scrum calls to align with stakeholders on requirements, data strategies, and action plans.
Gather and translate business requirements into data models, data flow diagrams, and specifications for various Smart Manufacturing initiatives.
Contribute to the design, development, configuration, and validation of new product features, focusing on data integration and architecture.
Support ongoing data function initiatives, including data warehousing, data lakes, and big data platforms.
Assist plants in identifying, mapping, and onboarding Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and ensuring data pipelines are built and maintained to support these KPIs.
Proactively identify, analyze, and troubleshoot data-related issues: accuracy, consistency, delays, etc., including data pipeline debugging and optimization.
Collaborate with the Digital Foundation team and data engineers in identifying dependencies and data requirements for new features and ongoing initiatives.
Advocate for data quality, integrity, and reliability throughout the organization.
Skills and qualifications:
Business analysis and exposure to the manufacturing/CPG domains are necessary.
Proficiency in SQL and experience in database management or data warehousing technologies is required.
Familiarity with data engineering tools and practices, such as ETL processes, data modeling, and data pipeline management.
Exposure to Azure DevOps, cloud data services (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks), and agile ways of working is required.
Prior experience in OSI PI configuration, data integration, and troubleshooting is desirable. Knowledge of data visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI and familiarity with Microsoft PowerApps and SharePoint is desirable.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to translate complex data concepts for non-technical stakeholders.
Pay:
The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $96,000 - $135,000. In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus for the current performance period.
Benefits:
As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a “free time” PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take time needed for either sick time or vacation.

Job Title: FinTech Product Analyst - Data and Reporting - Solutran - Remote
Job Description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.


We are looking for someone to join our product team that wants to build the products that our customers love. The efficient flow of data to the right hands is paramount to our success. As our business continues to grow, so will the need to understand and analyze the vast swath of information on member behavior and system performance while maintaining our current data and reporting flow. We are using technology to scale Solutran’ s infrastructure. The right candidate is someone who can “think big” while diving deep, remain flexible to change, and someone with a passion for all things data.


You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.


Primary Responsibilities:

Identify and scope business needs and translate those needs into product requirements
Communicate product requirements and rationale with all stakeholders including technology development teams, QA, marketing, sales, finance, and executives
Be responsible for your product area and own the entire product lifecycle from conception to implementation
Support and define a standardized data delivery process
Manage prioritization and trade-offs between customer experience, business requirements, technical limitations, performance, and operational needs
Produce high quality documentation based on implemented methodology standards
Participate in and influence the definition of integration standard methodologies
Scope and prioritize feature requests, enhancements, and opportunities based on business goals and customer impact
Manage the backlog of features and integrations, prioritizing appropriately
Work closely with engineering and analytics teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources
Other duties as assigned




An individual in this position must be able to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities listed above. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

One year of post-high school education can be substituted/is equivalent to one year of experience.


Required Qualifications:

2+ years of Technical Business Analyst/Product Owner or equivalent experience
1+ years of experience with SQL (Oracle, MS, or MySQL)
Experience with analytics tools (Tableau, Power BI, or similar)
Experience designing and documenting user flows and workflows to support application development
Experience using quantitative and qualitative data to assess priorities and organize product backlog effectively
Experience with client reporting to support existing reporting structure and assist in building new reporting structure
Experience creating and editing file specs for client reporting standardization




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in healthcare or health insurance
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience with Databricks, Snowflake
Payment’s industry knowledge
Familiar with Agile/Scrum/Kanban process
Demonstrated project team leadership skills
Proven ability to break down initiative-level requirements into feature and story attribute level details
Proven ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences
Proven skilled at collaborating effectively with cross functional teams
Proven ability to communicate with non-technical and technical people inside and outside the organization




California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New York, New Jersey, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only: The salary range for California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island or Washington residents is $67,800 to $133,100 per year.
