Profile Summary:
The Sr. IT Claims Business Analyst role supports our Claims Business by working with the development teams with responsibility for eliciting, understanding and documenting business needs to determine and recommend the most optimal solution to conduct software development. Assists in formulating creative, technical contributions to defining user business and functional requirements for enhancements and projects and implementing IT business solutions. Acts as an adept analytical resource focusing on critical business priorities. Assists in establishing plans for defining, delivering, enabling and supporting information technology components into the organization architecture.
Profile Description:
Support our Claims ecosystem product development (Salesforce, Workato, Digital Properties etc.) based on business needs
Direct the requirements development for applying technology to satisfy business needs
Proven Salesforce.com integration and administrative skills
Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow.
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Work directly with and serve as a liaison between business units, technology teams and support teams.
Assist/Partner with our Claims QA team in defining testing strategy and risks.
Provide consulting regarding the practices and methods for defining detailed business requirements including planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to corporate standards.
Partner with our Business BA team to elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis
Monitor and manage data integrity while promoting best practices for system usage.
Understands all aspects of Salesforce configuration and technical/functional capabilities, including all changes and potential system implications related to the Salesforce release upgrades.
Manage and configure Salesforce Sales & Service Cloud.
Proficient in Lightning Platform and capabilities.
Partners with our Software Development Consultant in auditing data to uncover data integrity issues and/or opportunities for process improvement.
Document and refine business requirements to describe the business needs to a functional requirement level without presuming a technical solution. Under the guidance of a Software Development Consultant, ensure requirements are verifiable and testable once a solution is defined
Support the execution of the development pipeline and delivery of Voya’s software products including vendor solutions to QA, and ultimately to production
Work in execution of product development across all teams as part of the development lifecycle
Operate at a high technical level for identified phases of IT projects.
Identify applicable technology optimizations/modernizations to given business problems with the assistance and direction of the Software Development Consultant
Supports project manager/release manager by developing detailed project information such as scope information, estimates, evaluation criteria and results, etc.
Assist in the enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Helps shape our evolving claims product model with process improvement consultation
Coaches and mentors where applicable in support of the requirements/design proc
Knowledge & Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in a directly related field
Eight + years of professional IT experience in technical and business analysis with 2+ years of Salesforce experience
Certified Salesforce Administrator essential required or willing to work towards in the first 12 months post hire. Salesforce Platform Dev I and II certifications desirable.
Required Skills:
Salesforce.com
Middleware tools (i.e. Adeptia/Workato)
Enterprise Testing, Quality Standards, and software product knowledge (architecture, infrastructure security, DevOps, etc.)
SDLC knowledge
Agile Software development environment methodologies
Business requirement knowledge (i.e. elicitation of requirements, planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to standards)
Functional requirement knowledge (i.e. elicitation of requirements, planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to standards)
Requirements Analysis, Planning & prioritization execution
Requirements Elicitation and facilitation execution
Financial Management knowledge
Organizational Change Management (OCM)
Supplier/Vendor management
Analytical /data analysis skills
Change Management
Coach/Mentor
Consensus building to gather requirements
Interviewing skills among stakeholders
Meeting facilitation (in person and virtual)
Communication Skills
Written, verbal and presentation skills, detail orientated
Functional communication to technical stakeholders, Technical communication to non-technical stakeholders
Problem Solving Skills
Collaboration with internal and external teams and business partners
Business Acumen among LOBs (past, current, future goals, strategies and plans) Business relationship management

Support RiverSource Data Program with business decision-making by providing financial or statistical analysis that lead to recommended solutions for business issues as appropriate. Provide project support from design through implementation and monitoring. Be the liaison between the business, utility functions, and at times external parties to accomplish business objectives. Ensure adherence to data and model governance standards that are set and enforced by industry enterprise and business unit data governance polices and leaders.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with business leaders and/or analysts to provide analytical thought leadership and support for business problems.

Identify and interpret business needs, define high-level business requirements, strategy, technical risks, and scope.

Develop, document, and communicate business-driven analytic solutions and capabilities, translating modeling and analytic output into understandable and actionable concrete business knowledge.

Use data from a variety of sources to analyze complex business issues, incorporating company and industry knowledge, mathematical and technological expertise, and sound analytical processes.

Identify issues and/or recommend actions by using statistical analysis, modeling, & other quantitative techniques.

Manage multiple relationships across the organization. Be the main point of contact to answer questions within the business area of expertise.

Act as a liaison among the business and utility functions to gather information and share best practices, and to ensure initiatives are executed appropriately.

Gather data requirements from stakeholders/stewards to lead the development of business glossaries, reference data repository, and facilitate the collection of metadata attributes for critical data assets.

Manage the compliance of Governance policies and procedures. Understand all applicable regulatory requirements and be primary contact for audits or requests for data.

Facilitate the process for data access requests for and ensure timely review and decisioning based on defined policies.

Make recommendations that best meet client and business objectives by knowledge sharing to increase efficiencies and encourage a culture of continuous improvement.


Required Qualifications

Bachelors degree or equivalent

5+ years of experience

Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills and ability to use statistical analysis and modeling, with associated technology applications.

Strong relationship and communication skills in working with colleagues and influencing customers on recommendations and analysis.

In-depth knowledge of business operations and processes with ability to articulate these processes to others

Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)


Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge of Python and hands-on experience of SQL programming languages

Knowledge of PowerApps (Power Business Intelligence (BI) and forms)

In-depth knowledge of Insurance and Annuities business operations and processes with ability to articulate these processes to others

SUMMARY
Ceres is looking for a Senior Business Analyst that can add value to our team. At Ceres, we wear many hats, and this position will too. The primary goal of this position is to centralize reporting and data analytics across the organization through Power BI. This position has a heavy emphasis on financial planning and analysis, but also supports all other functions of the organization, such as Operations, HR, Compliance, and Commercial. This is an exciting opportunity to drive and champion positive change in an organization.
Responsibilities
Analytics & Financial Reporting

Collaborate with business leaders to provide analytical thought leadership and support for business problems. Help identify and interpret business needs, define high-level business requirements, strategy, and scope. Develop, document, and communicate business-driven analytic solutions and capabilities. Translate modeling and analytic output into understandable and actionable business knowledge.
Analyze financial information and provide insights to enable the organization to achieve financial goals and objectives. Analyze financial data and create financial models and forecasting for decision support. Perform financial forecasting, reporting, and operational metrics tracking. Work closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting. Coordinate the annual budgeting process.
Collaborate with other functions and key stakeholders to define requirements for metrics, tracking, and reporting.

Automation

Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement in business workflows.
Build intuitive and interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics.

Data Management

Identify, gather, store, analyze, interpret, and visualize large amounts of data. Develop data reporting forms/structures.
Implement scalable data management practices.

Qualifications:

Required
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related field.
5+ years relevant professional experience.
Strong financial acumen.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Experience reading and understanding data models.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize diverse tasks.
Effective interpersonal and communication skills.
Experience in organizing, planning and executing projects from conceptualization through implementation and execution across multiple stakeholders.
Preferred
Prior experience and exposure in the grain and commodity industry.
Experience with SQL statements.
Experience with Microsoft GP and Power Query Editor.
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) for Finance and Operations.

Job Title: Business Analyst of Sales and Marketing (Remote)
Job Description:
Midwest Veterinary Supply is seeking a Business Analyst of Sales and Marketing for our corporate office in Lakeville, Minnesota.

Job Summary:

The Business Analyst, Sales and Marketing is a crucial member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team that will work collaboratively across the department and partner with Sales and Marketing leadership to perform complete business performance analysis, recommend solutions to support sales and marketing execution strategies, and provide advanced support for Sales and Marketing leadership and their teams to enable Sales and Marketing leadership to make smart, data-driven, and fiscally sound business decisions. Act as liaison between the BI team and Sales and Marketing leadership to gather requirements, communicate progress of Sales and Marketing analytics goals and objectives, and voice solutions for continuous improvement. (This is a remote position)

Essential Job Functions:

Partner with Sales and Marketing leadership and their teams to own the knowledge relative to business intelligence, data analytics, and software capabilities. Facilitate discussions and collaboration between BI and Sales and Marketing to allow leadership and their teams to get the most out of the company’s BI tools, data sets, and consumables delivered by future software initiatives. Provide extensive knowledge of the existing opportunities for accessing data and information including knowledge of self-service reports, automated reports, processes, and data sources that result in the information that is necessary for Sales and Marketing leadership to consume. Partner extensively with data analysts to consistently learn about new data opportunities and to keep abreast with the evolving data architecture.
Act as a liaison between the BI team and Sales and Marketing leadership and become the point of contact for facilitating projects and data initiatives set forth by the BI team, the company, or the Sales and Marketing teams. Gather requirements for anticipated projects and requested projects, while offering up existing solutions. Develop project plans, identify issues, and communicate status of the defined projects and objectives to leadership. Lead or participate in continuous improvement initiatives, leveraging data and business knowledge.
Provide support, clarification, and field questions pertaining to existing content. Provide training and advanced to expert support for Sales and Marketing leadership as well as their teams. This includes providing training sessions and web-based information sessions to ensure the sales and marketing user-base is leveraging the tools available to the best of their ability. Be a knowledge base for the Business Intelligence team as it relates to sales and marketing content and how the end-users consume the information.
Coordinate and collaborate with the BI team to evaluate, challenge, and critique existing solutions and their impact on the company. Provide insights on project feasibility based on requirements gathered from leadership and SMEs (subject matter experts).
Ad-hoc special projects, reporting, and analysis for sales and marketing leadership
Perform other duties as assigned.

Organizational Competencies:

Must be able to perform job responsibilities in a professional manner, consistent with the needs of our internal and external customers and in accordance with all policies, procedures, and manuals. Maintain a good work ethic while taking intentional steps toward the fiscal health of Midwest Veterinary Supply.

Job Requirements & Qualifications:

Must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily
High School diploma/GED required.
Bachelor’s degree in math, finance, computer science, business management, or information systems preferred.
More than 2 years in a Business Analyst role or similar and being an individual responsible for knowledge transfer, both written and verbally, and acting as a liaison between SMEs and a technical team in a professional environment is preferred.
Experience with relational databases such as IBM DB2, Oracle, MS SQL Server, Postgres, or similar is preferred. Experience with BI tools or software that leverage dimensional and relational data sources is preferred.
Experience with IBM Cognos Analytics or IBM Planning Analytics/TM1 is preferred.
Experience with IBM iSeries/AS400/Power Systems is preferred.
Ability to read, write and speak English
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, employment policies, operating instructions, and procedural manuals.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Curious mind that seeks out best practices and continuous improvement
Proven ability to form, develop, and maintain strong relationships across the company
Proven ability to work with leadership teams
Must be able to learn quickly to gain an intermediate understanding of the Sales and Marketing teams and the industry in which the company resides including their strategies, business processes, and principles
Ability to convert business requirements into functional requirements
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and multitask
Must be self-motivated, able to work independently, and problem solve
Excellent attention to detail
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel is preferred
Strong customer service skills
Working knowledge of Business Intelligence tools is preferred (IBM Cognos, Tableau, Business Objects, Microsoft Power BI, or similar)
Basic computer skills, ability to operate a Windows-based computer and data entry
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals
Familiarity with project management software (ClickUp, Jira, Trello, etc.) is preferred
Strong problem-solving abilities
Life-long learner

Mental & Physical Demands:

Attention to detail critical to ensure accuracy and completion of objectives.
Regular interaction with people, team-player.
Fast pace of work requires multi-tasking.
Vision: close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Frequent use of a telephone – listening and speaking.
Ability to work at a desk throughout the day.
Frequent use of hands for writing and computer keyboard.

Equipment Used:

Regularly uses typical office equipment including computer keyboard and terminal, telephone, printer, fax and copier.

Work Environment:

Work will typically be performed Monday through Friday in an office environment. Working more than 40 hours per workweek may be required. This is a remote position.

About Us:
Midwest Veterinary Supply, Inc. (MVS) has provided quality service and merchandise to the veterinary profession since 1961. Our products are distributed from eight branches located in key geographic locations within our trade area. We take great pride in getting our orders out the same day as called in and having the product in the customer's hand the next day. MVS carries products and equipment from most major manufacturers. As we continue to grow, our goal will be, as it has always been, to provide the veterinary profession the very best in service along with quality merchandise at fair and competitive prices.

Midwest Veterinary Supply believes in providing equal employment opportunities for all employees and will not violate any law prohibiting discrimination for or against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of any characteristic protected under local, state, or federal statute, ordinance, or regulation. Requirements are representative of the minimum levels of education, experience and skills required to perform the essential functions of this job. Job Title: IT Finance Business Analyst BAAN and Infor LN
Job Description:
ANDERSEN CORPORATION SUMMARY:

We’re focused on bringing more light into people’s lives by helping them create healthier, happier spaces to build memories and do what they love. This applies to our team, too. By celebrating our differences and embracing a positive work-life balance, we are recognized as a Yellow Ribbon company, one of Forbes Magazine’s 2021 “America’s Best Large Employers” and a “Best Employer for Diversity.” As a 2021 Energy Star Partner of the Year, Andersen is also committed to environmental health and sustainability. No matter your role, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
SUMMARY:

Andersen Corp is looking for an Finance IT Business Analyst that has a background in Infor ERP tools like BaanERP, Baan IV and Infor LN. The position will include a variety of roles including implementing business improvements, project work and support. The IT Business Analyst is responsible for the planning, development, maintenance, and enhancement of the functional areas of application packages. They are assigned to teams within an assigned business unit and independently utilize various client/server platforms as well as, mentor others. Individuals collaborate with company customers, staff, IT and other stakeholders to identify user requirements, assess available technologies, and recommend solution options. They are proficient in assessing business objectives and design business processes for medium to high level objectives in such a way that they may be effectively modeled, configured and measured within the package application environment. Demonstrated ability to mentor others. Individuals are proficient in communicating the application package capabilities and possibilities to designated functional areas, while seeking ways to collaborate with IT members to facilitate transition to and support of the application package .

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for medium to high level business analysis and process design in one or more functional areas (finance, accounting, invoicing, etc.) within the enterprise in the analysis and redesign of application package functions and processes. Assists less experienced business analysts with design and knowledge transfer Completes comprehensive unit, system and performance testing of application that includes its components and interfaces.
Responsible for definition of application scope and objectives and devise/modify procedures to solve medium to high complexity business problems. Assists less experienced business analysts with problem resolution Adhere to Agile practices and other PMO or Team project methodology
Responsible for communicating application package capabilities/possibilities within one or more functional areas with medium to high complexity of requirements. Assists less experienced business analysts with application package capabilities
Responsible for the specification and validation of reporting universes. Responsible for Specifying, developing, and validating medium to high complexity business reports
Maintain business relationships and integrate activities with other departments to ensure successful implementation and support efforts
Develop and maintain good relationships with customers, IT colleagues, project leads and architects to meet expected customer service levels
May regularly coach other team members.
MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or related discipline.
Minimum of 3 years of development experience with a variety of leading-edge development languages and platforms, including VB.NET or similar development tool
Understanding of Financial areas/concepts including general ledger, income statements, balance sheets and other financial concepts.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills
NICE-TO-HAVE QUALIFICATIONS
Strong verbal and written communication skills, proficient in the ability to express medium to high level technical concepts in business terms
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work well on cross-functional project teams and foster team commitment to tasks
Developing project management skills, operating as part of a team organizing, planning, and executing projects from vision through implementation
SALARY INFORMATION:
Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to work experience, education, geographic location, certifications, etc. In addition to your pay, Andersen Corporation currently offers benefits such as comprehensive health benefits, 401k contribution, paid time off, 8 paid standard holidays, plus 2 floating holidays, a robust employee Wellbeing program, as well as profit sharing (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
CULTURE AND BENEFITS:
“Be Orange. Be You” is how we express our belief that by embracing our differences and empowering you, we’ll be a stronger team able to accomplish what otherwise wouldn’t be possible. This Orange spirit has helped us become the #1 innovative window and door brand* and the one homeowners love the most.** It’s also why we’re committed to supporting you to approach each day with a bright outlook.
Benefits include, and are not limited to:
Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
Health Savings Account contributions
Paid holidays plus PTO
401(k) plan & contributions
Professional development and tuition reimbursement opportunities
Charity contributions
Nationwide career opportunities
We look forward to seeing how your unique skills, background and experiences will inspire our team and help us continue to be the leader we are today.
2020 Andersen brand surveys of U.S. contractors, builders & architects
** 2020 Andersen Brand Survey of U.S. homeowners
In 2023, Andersen has set a profit-sharing target of $4,000 per eligible employee, prorated as appropriate. Profit sharing will be paid out in quarterly installments to provide eligible employees with payments throughout the year, with payment amounts tied to quarterly operating profit performance.
Andersen is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, disability, marital status, national origin, citizenship, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Summary

** This position is an in-office position, located in St. Cloud, MN.**

The Business Analyst (BA) has the primary role to collaboratively work with leaders in our Business and IT areas to identify and document business flows, ideas, issues, opportunities and translate into requirements. The BA will continue to partner with all Business and IT teams throughout the development and project deployment process to make sure the requirements are being satisfied. As work unfolds and changes need to be made, the BA also has the critical role of supporting the Project Manager with effective issue resolution with all stakeholders as we follow the change process.

"What's the scope of the opportunity?"

Business relationship management

Consult and partner with business process owners to continuously develop, improve and refine business requirements to organizational strategy.
Provide the interface between the technical resource pool and business partners.

Facilitation

Facilitate Process Mapping exercises to identify current state and then assist in identifying improvement areas.
Plan, conduct and facilitate the analysis of complex business issues to be solved with process changes and information systems.
Engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously and maintain ongoing awareness of project requirements.
Lead and participate in a variety of project requirements gathering activities including gathering and documenting user requirements utilizing established departmental practices and templates.

Documentation

Create documentation such as policies, procedures, workflows, process maps, and user guides.
Work with end users and developer resources to keep documents up to date during project life cycle.
Assist current IT staff in recording existing processes and organizing that knowledge base.

"What's needed to be successful?"

A four year degree in Information Technology or related degree (or equivalent experience) and five years’ experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in transportation.
Cross-functional facilitation experience with a variety of stakeholders.
Business Process Development experience combined with the demonstrated ability to work one on one or in groups with end users to elicit business requirements in a relationship-based manner.
Ability to effectively illustrate design, development, and testing process both to our Business partners using non-technical jargon as well as IT partners for technical delivery.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook).
Excellent communication skills (written, listening and verbal).
Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with a variety of people and cultures, within ATS business units as well as external customers, partners and suppliers.

What we have to Offer

The University of St. Thomas invites qualified candidates to apply for a Business Process Analyst position within Innovation Technology Services.

This position will have the opportunity to work remotely within the greater Twin Cities area and will be required to attend workshops and meetings on a semi-regular basis on the St. Paul Campus.

The University of St. Thomas embraces diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity for all. Our convictions of dignity, diversity and personal attention call us to embody and champion a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment. The University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (EEO). All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, status as a protected veteran, or other protected characteristic. We are committed to building a skilled team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives. This commitment is consistent with our mission: Inspired by Catholic intellectual tradition, the University of St. Thomas educates students to be morally responsible leaders who think critically, act wisely, and work skillfully to advance the common good. A successful candidate will possess a commitment to the ideals of this mission.

JOIN OUR COMMUNITY
The University of St. Thomas offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits program, which includes:
Up to 100% tuition remission for employees, spouses, and dependents upon eligibility
A generous Employer retirement contribution of 9.4% of annual salary upon eligibility
Medical, dental, and vision options
Employer-paid disability, life, and AD&D benefits

JOB SUMMARY
The Business Process Analyst uses their ability, knowledge, and skills for analyzing business processes and applications with the objective of improving and/or automating, increasing efficiency, and/or saving money. The BPA will perform these functions in the support of ITS initiatives, including IT Project Management support, improving cross-functional business processes, service owner support, and others.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
In support of the objectives above, the BPA will be expected to:


Lead the process of analyzing and streamlining complex business processes to best align technology-related solutions with business strategies. Define and complete complex user stories; consider the current and future business environment when designing solutions.
Design solutions to solve complex problems considering technology capacity and desired business results. Use "best practice” methodologies to manage and execute business process improvements with minimal supervision.
Provide stakeholders with necessary analysis documentation for buy-in, leadership decision, and implementation; conducts walk-throughs of recommended system functionality and prototypes with business users in small group or large group settings.
Manage end-to-end process change projects including, current state analysis, future state process design, identifying the requirements for change, testing, documentation, and implementation.
Assist project sponsors and managers with establishing project charters and formulating project scope and objectives. Collaborate with and educate business process owners responsible for managing and operating business processes. Work with service owners to improve IT processes.
Lead workshops for process redesign that involve eliciting business, process and/or system requirements.. Facilitate and lead interviews, focus groups, and workshops to establish current and future business processes; coordinates the communication between stakeholders and service owners in order to effectively implement solutions.
Lead efforts to build business process analysis competencies across ITS and the university. Develop, adapt, and share best practice methods and tools; coach, mentor and train other “apprentice” business process analysts. Other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree
Three years of relevant, professional level experience in business process analysis and improvement role(s) or a comparable combination of education, training, and experience

HOW TO APPLY
All interested candidates must apply online at https://www.stthomas.edu/jobs/. Follow the instructions to complete an online application which includes creating or updating an applicant profile, uploading a resume, and completing a job specific application.

In light of its commitment to create and maintain a safe learning and working environment, employment with the University of St. Thomas requires consent and successful completion of a background screening.

Official job posting is available at www.stthomas.edu/jobs.

Responsibilities:

Participate and collaborate with client, development, and testing teams throughout the design, development, testing, and implementation of a solution.
Support meetings with client subject matter experts (SMEs) to elicit, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Perform functional and technical analysis of the clients' current business process and supporting documentation.
Identify process improvements and facilitate reengineering of business process.
Ensure the business analysis deliverables are technically feasible.
Monitor progress and provide status reports to the Sagitec management.
Communicate to technical resources for continued implementation of the solution.
Execute production rollout activities.
Support end users during User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and, if required, throughout the duration of maintenance and support agreements.

Qualifications:

Master's or equivalent in Computer Science, IT, Engineering (any), Business, or related and 3 years of experience in the job offered or as a Software Designer, Developer, Tester, or Analyst.
In the alternative, we will accept a Bachelor's or equivalent in the above-stated fields plus 5 years of progressively responsible experience in the above-stated occupations.
Additionally, all candidates must possess 3 years of Team Leadership experience and 2 years of Pension, Retirement Systems, or Unemployment systems Domain experience.
Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience not less than the primary requirements plus special skills.
The position is based out of 422 County Road D East, St. Paul, MN 55117, and may require relocation to various unanticipated locations throughout the United States.

Business Unit Overview:
Headquartered in Lakeville, Minn., Post Consumer Brands, a business unit of Post Holdings, Inc., is dedicated to providing people and their pets with delicious food choices for every taste and budget. The company’s portfolio includes beloved brands such as Honey Bunches of Oats®, PEBBLES®, Grape-Nuts® and Malt-O-Meal® cereal, and Peter Pan® peanut butter, as well as Rachael Ray® Nutrish®, Kibbles ‘n Bits® and 9Lives® dog and cat food. As a company committed to high standards of quality and to our values, we are driven by one idea: To make lives better by making delicious food accessible for all. For more information about our brands, visit www.postconsumerbrands.com and follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news.
Brand:
Post Consumer Brands recently acquired several iconic pet food brands, venturing into a new market while remaining true to our purpose to provide delicious and accessible food that our consumers love. We’re always searching the center store for the next exciting product to add to our portfolio, and right now, we’re growing and need passionate, driven individuals with diverse perspectives to help us reach greater heights. That’s where you come in. Join a team where your voice is not only heard but valued. Make a real impact on brands enjoyed by millions of people and their pets.
At Post Consumer Brands, we take pride in our longstanding legacy of making one of every five breakfast cereals families eat daily. Today, we’re just as focused on our future as we expand our grocery business with different shelf-stable foods, including snacks and peanut butter. We are committed to providing accessible and delicious food for families, and we’re always searching the center store for the next exciting product to add to our portfolio. As we soar to new heights, we need creative, determined individuals from all walks of life to join our team, where your unique perspective and ideas are acknowledged and valued. Be a part of a company that empowers you to make a difference that’s evident on grocery store shelves and families’ tables across North America.
Location Description:
Post Consumer Brands corporate headquarters in Lakeville, Minn. is about 20 miles south of Minneapolis and St. Paul, Lakeville has all the benefits of smaller town living with access to everything a large metropolitan area has to offer. Join more than 400 team members collaborating on the two-building campus to help put breakfast on the tables of millions of consumers in North America.
Responsibilities:
Post Consumer Brands seeks a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst in Lakeville, MN to hold a highly technical, analytics-focused role that includes interaction and partnership with leaders across the business. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and developing visually compelling business reporting solutions using Tableau dashboards. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is also responsible for creating and supporting shared data sources in Tableau and related queries/views in Snowflake.

Working Location: Hybrid
This role is located at the Lakeville, MN Corporate office
Typical hybrid schedule includes 3 days in-office with remote flexibility up to 2 days a week.

Duties and Responsibilities:


Communicate and collaborate with business leaders and users to conceptualize and design reporting solutions that drive value and aid in business decision making
Design, build, and validate Tableau dashboards, data sources, and ad-hoc reports
Design, build, and validate Snowflake queries and views
Understand and leverage Tableau best-practices and advanced features to deliver intuitive, accurate, high-impact dashboards
Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to combine data from multiple sources and develop integrated data sources and dashboards
Develop a strong understanding of our enterprise data and source systems
Provide internal consulting to analysts and employees throughout the business
Identify process improvement opportunities and take the initiative to implement those improvements
Perform proactive and reactive Tableau maintenance and support tasks
Create documentation and design artifacts
Provide training on Tableau and the use of data/information to business users
Provide guidance and mentorship to less experienced analysts on topics such as analysis, documentation, industry best practices, efficient modeling of data etc.
Perform ad-hoc duties as needed based on changing business needs
Effectively manage competing priorities and multiple concurrent projects
Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Management, a closely related field, or a foreign equivalent degree
Tableau Data Analyst Certification may be considered in lieu of relevant degree
Four (4)+ years of experience developing dashboards and data sources in Tableau
Four (4)+ years of experience developing SQL queries and views. Snowflake experience is a plus but not required

Key Attributes:

Critical and Strategic Thinking – Ability to evaluate multiple options for designing efficient and effective BI solutions; ability to make informed decisions based on data.
Adaptability – Flexible and adaptable to changing business requirements, evolving technologies, and emerging practices in the field of BI.
Collaboration and Communication – Work well with cross-functional teams including analysts, data engineers, and business stakeholders. Understand business needs and foster a positive team environment.
Leadership – Experience leading BI projects, influencing stakeholders, providing guidance, setting expectations, and mentoring others.
Business Acumen – Demonstrate a strong understanding of the business domain, identify relevant metrics, and deliver meaningful insights. Experience in CPG or Retail is preferred.
Time Management – Effective time management, task prioritization, adherance to deadlines, and timely project delivery.

Job Title: Functional Business System Analyst – Finance/Costing SAP
Job Description:
Minnesota - Other

Hollstadt Overview

Hollstadt Consulting is a management and technology consulting firm dedicated to placing professionals at engagements where they will excel. When you work with us, you'll work with a refreshingly real company led and staffed by seasoned experts who are also down-to-earth, good people. We're committed to treating you with respect and helping you achieve your career aspirations.

Since 1990, Hollstadt has been a trusted partner to more than 150 domestic and global companies and has successfully completed over 2,000 projects. Our continued growth has created challenging and rewarding opportunities for accomplished IT and Business Consultants. Hollstadt Consulting is an equal opportunity employer including disability/veteran.




Job Description

The SAP Senior Product Costing Analyst will provide product costing expertise to ensure resources used during the manufacturing process are systematically recorded and reported in support of costing and profitability strategies. In this role, you will work closely with the finance and operations team to develop activity-based product cost standards that represent the true cost of goods manufactured, ensure when changes are proposed, the effects on the product costs are as intended and monitor the product costing process to ensure that transactions recorded reflect actual activity. As the domain specialist for product costing, you will analyze price and usage variances and advise the operations teams on possible methods to sustain or improve the manufacturing process.


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field or equivalent experience.
Strong knowledge of enterprise resource planning product costing.
Minimum of four years of related work experience.
Intermediate to advanced English skills.

Preferred

Experience within an activity-based costing environment.
Working knowledge of production flows and processes including supply chain.









Benefits + Perks





Comprehensive Benefit Plan

Hollstadt offers a competitive and comprehensive benefit package which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Long Term/Short Term Disability, and Life Insurance. With three different medical plans to choose from, you can enroll in the coverage you need from single to family, or anywhere in between!




Remarketing Process

Hollstadt is based on retention and relationships. We get to know your strengths and career wishes throughout your assignment and then start remarket discussions 6-8 weeks prior to your end date. By being proactive, we are able to keep your down time between assignments as short as possible, unless you choose otherwise.




Professional Development

Hollstadt offers free bi-weekly training courses for our consultants as well as on-demand access to past sessions through our consultant portal. Trainings give our consultants the continuing education they need to excel on their projects.





401k + Matching

One popular benefit is our 401(k) match on the first 4% of your contributions. Hollstadt wants to help you reach your long-term financial goals and understands that planning for your future is critical. Consultants also have access to support from a Financial Advisor.




Bonus Opportunities

We appreciate and reward loyalty. Join Hollstadt, stay for 5 years, and we’ll give you a $5,000 Longevity Award bonus! Additionally, we know great talent knows other great talent. If you are on contract with Hollstadt and refer one of your connections who gets placed, we’ll pay you $1,000!




Ongoing Support & Networking

We have made a significant investment in building a support program for our consultant team - so you never have to feel like you are going it alone. We also have a Consultant Coach program which acts like a 'work buddy' to provide a safe ear for questions or concerns at your client site.

Are you an analytical and strategic thinker with a passion for work system optimization? Do you thrive on working with data to identify challenges and suggest improvements? Loffler is seeking a Tactical Business Analyst to manage project planning and execution support for our core process initiatives. In this role, you will work with departments across the organization, gathering data and analyzing work systems to derive simplifications and improvements. You'll create project charters, define project scope and objectives, and manage operational process analysis and workflow development. With your strong communication skills and attention to detail, you'll ensure successful project outcomes and build positive relationships with all Loffler departments and partners. This is a hybrid-remote position that will report to our St. Louis Park, MN office. Apply now and take the first step towards a rewarding career at our Loffler!

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

All areas of responsibility listed below are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position, with reasonable accommodation, if necessary. Any non-essential functions are assumed to be included in "other related duties as assigned":

Assist departments with documenting their Work Systems and Work Improvement Plans. Break down the long-term organizational goals, into shorter-term targets (ie. Quarterly).
Identify where challenges lie, and then collect and analyze data, and suggest work system improvements.
For resulting projects, create the project charters and through interviews with Product Owners, help define project scope, identify stakeholders, and understand the vision and objectives.
Define future state for project outcomes by outlining the greater vision, defining SMART (specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, time-bound) goals, and identifying processes that may need to change.
Define change strategy for project outcomes, and ensure a project delivers its intended results and outcomes, so there is adoption by all stakeholders.
Write effective project tasks with clear acceptance criteria, to achieve project requirements.
Define the current state of systems and processes, gather information about how a system really works and where the root problems exist.
Consult with the Operational Business Analyst on specific requests for change, and follow established department guidelines as it relates to Change Management.
Consult with the Strategic Business Analyst to discuss any alignment with larger business strategies
If needed, assist the Operational Business Analyst or other project team members, write out the necessary project tasks to achieve the deliverables, and create the acceptance criteria.
Manage operational process analysis and workflow development.
Utilize tools to create process diagrams, decision trees, and mind mapping to create the necessary workflows, alerts, dashboards, reporting, and security required for the business units to be as efficient as possible.
Follow established departmental procedures using ConnectWise Manage and project management software to track the status of change and issue tickets, project tasks, and the time spent on both.
Maintain open lines of communication and build good working relationships with all Loffler departments and partners.
Consistently exhibit Loffler's Core Values: Can Do Positive Attitude, Professional, Results Driven, Customer First, Integrity, and Innovative.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Strong attention to detail and critical thinking/problem solving skills.
Self-starter with ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Excellent listening and communication skills.

Education/Experience:

College degree is required
Business Analyst certification required or 5 years experience in business analyst work. May consider project management or IT Project Services experience as a substitute, depending on relevant experience.
Knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma is preferred.
Technical aptitude is preferred, ability to identify tools and create solutions.
Ability to write out user stories.
Experience with creating Power BI or Tableau dashboards and knowledge of how to extract data is preferred.
Knowledge of how to use Microsoft Productivity Suite, including, but not limited to, Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, and project management software is required. Lucid Chart is helpful.
Working knowledge of Loffler's core applications is helpful but not required: Eautomate ERP, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, ConnectWise Manage.

Position Summary

You’ll be supported by a larger customer facing team in our Purina Sales department.
We offer opportunities at the global scale and cross-functional experiences that will diversify your knowledge, insight and your background. So, if your full potential could be unleashed, what would you add to the mix?

Provide ad-hoc reporting and communication for retail initiatives

1+ years of experience in retail sales


Other

As a Data Analyst for RVO Health, you drive problem-solving with autonomy, while being an expert at querying, transforming, and providing analytical insights. As a Data Analyst, you will communicate, support, and strategize with business, tech, and data teams stakeholders. You will act as a data-savvy consultant, telling the data story by understanding processes, solving problems, and making business and marketing recommendations.

Where You'll Be

To prioritize togetherness, culture, and accountability, RVO Health operates on a hybrid in-office work schedule. We expect employees to work from our Minneapolis office Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday each week. You are welcome to work remotely Mondays and Fridays if you wish.

11000 Optum Cir Eden Prairie, MN 55344

What You'll Do
Provide strategic insights derived from digital marketing, web event, sales, and coaching data that drive marketing investment and customer experience decisions
Use statistics to identify the significance, noise, and correlation in data
Conduct hands-on advanced analytics using multiple data sources originating from different applications and systems
Build relationships with business teams and data science teams to identify opportunities for deep analytics on customer behavior and site performance
Build compelling visualizations and interactive dashboards that enable us to democratize analvtics
Work with data science, data engineers, and business teams to build scalable and effective data products
Identify opportunities to use advanced analytics to develop new strategies and improve business performance
What We're Looking For
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in complex business analysis, digital analysis, or marketing analysis role
Proficiency in visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau
Extensive experience in building SQL queries across complex relational database experience
Experience designing scalable data models and ETLs
Demonstrated ability to solve problems with creativity and little direction
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into impactful insights and communicate recommendations to leadership
Effective interpersonal and communication skills, with a track record of working well with business stakeholders

Job Title: Customs Senior Analyst and Business Enterprise Support
Job Description:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 157 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.
Job Purpose and Impact

The U.S. Customs Enterprise Lead plays a key role within our Global Trade Compliance (GTC) function by driving standards of customs compliance across a wide and diverse customer and stakeholder base. In this role, you will utilize your customs/trade expertise to perform complex activities in areas such as risk assessment, value preservation review and regional/global customs (export/import) compliance improvement projects. You'll work closely with other members of Cargill’s Global Trade Compliance team and one or more internal business units to address risk and leverage customs opportunities, develop and implement control and compliance framework, contribute to government inquiries and provide advisory mentorship and training. Key Accountabilities

Manage internal client interaction and business partnership, providing strategic direction on global trade compliance activities and collaborate cross-functionally, internally and externally to implement cross-border solutions globally.
Support global trade operations compliance and Cargill subsidiaries, joint ventures, business unit staff and other customs departments by advising on low-to-moderately complex customs transactions and issues.
Follow import/export transactions, execute customs clearance and file import/export declarations.
Perform data management, analysis and reporting to detect and promote compliance with import/export regulations and provide support in tax/duty disputes.
Analyze and report key performance indicators to evaluate data for risk assessment.
Conduct complex customs-related research and analysis, using substantial understanding of customs practices and procedures with minimal input from senior team members.
Develop technical customs solutions to minimize Cargill's customs liabilities/risks.
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned. Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.
Minimum of four years of related work experience.
Demonstrated or proven skills to manage US customs and export law and regulatory framework.
Demonstrated customs compliance experience within the food/agriculture industry.
Experience implementing internal controls, risk assessments and internal audits.
Prior delivery of internal or external consulting/ advisory services acquired with a Big four accounting firm, major law firm or multinational company.
Ability to travel a 10% of the time.

Preferred Qualifications
Delivery of customs valuation analysis, including methods to assess and/or assemble evidence in support of compliant use of valuation methods and/or additions/deductions from dutiable value declarations.
Expert competency in one of the following import compliance areas: Antidumping/Countervailing/Quota regimes, Free Trade Agreement origin.
Excellent communication skills with focus on functional and business stakeholders
Strong leadership skills, ability to manage, develop and refine programs in a cross-functional team by influencing others
Global trade services knowledge
Ability to develop and implement a risk-based compliance program.
Minimum of eight years of customs experience.
Professional certification and/or equivalent experience Position Information

The business will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.
Relocation assistance will not be provided for this position
Location: Remote for the following locations only Wayzata, MN; Chicago, IL; Miami, FL; Wichita, KS

Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

Title: Web Administrator

Location: Minnesota (Remote)

Anticipated Engagement Start Date: September 15, 2023

Anticipated End Date: March 31, 2024

Experience: 2- 6 years

Salary: $55/ Hr.







Description of Project:

The Client partnering with the Minnesota Department of Commerce, is seeking one (1) full-time website administrator resource to perform services pertaining to the migration of Commerce's Caspio web forms to Formstack. Commerce wishes to move off of Caspio and onto Formstack as its web form solution. The resource under this engagement will conduct a complete inventory of all of Commerce's Caspio assets/forms and determine if they are still being used or can be deleted. The resource will then migrate/recreate the assets/forms still in use to Formstack if possible. For assets/forms that do not fit into Formstack, the resource will provide recommendations for other solutions. Commerce has at least 60 assets/forms in Caspio on a Tridion platform. There may be additional assets/forms not accounted for in this estimate. The bulk of these forms/assets should be able to be migrated to Formstack. The majority of the assets/forms are fairly simple single page forms with 10-30 fields each. The work order may be extended/expanded to include the migration/recreation of additional or more complex forms, and/or the implementation of other solutions for the forms that cannot be migrated to Formstack. Work will be performed off-site/remotely. For additional details on the request such as tasks, qualifications, and evaluation criteria, see the attachments found in the Buyer Attachment section of the Event. The State retains the option to extend the work order in increments determined by the State. It's 100% remote only for the state of MN.

Request for a Staff Augmentation Event:

The following document contains the tasks and qualifications for this Event.

Tasks:

Conduct a total inventory of Caspio assets/forms in Commerce's account and work with Commerce staff to identify the business units that own each asset/form. Work with business units to determine which assets/forms are still being used and which assets/forms can be deleted. Delete unused Caspio assets/forms. Migrate/recreate Caspio assets/forms that are still being used to Formstack. Make recommendations for other solutions for Caspio assets/forms that cannot be migrated/recreated to Formstack. Provide knowledge transfer to State staff. Perform other related duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

Three (3) years' experience in website administrator role(s) Six (6) months' experience migrating between types of web forms. Two (2) years' experience with creating forms in Formstack.

Desired Qualifications:

Experience migrating forms between Caspio and Formstack. Experience creating forms in Caspio. Business analysis experience. Web development experience.

Job Title: Functional Business Systems Analyst - Finance / Costing SAP
Job Description:
expires on: November 30, 2023

LOCATION: Minnesota-remote

JOB #: 102170

JOB TYPE: Consulting

CATEGORY: Business Analysis

DURATION: 12+ months

CLIENT: Agriculture


Job Description

The SAP Senior Product Costing Analyst will provide product costing expertise to ensure resources used during the manufacturing process are systematically recorded and reported in support of costing and profitability strategies. In this role, you will work closely with the finance and operations team to develop activity-based product cost standards that represent the true cost of goods manufactured, ensure when changes are proposed, the effects on the product costs are as intended and monitor the product costing process to ensure that transactions recorded reflect actual activity. As the domain specialist for product costing, you will analyze price and usage variances and advise the operations teams on possible methods to sustain or improve the manufacturing process.

tools.


Support financial reporting requirements with a focus on cost analysis.


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field or equivalent experience.
Strong knowledge of enterprise resource planning product costing.
Minimum of four years of related work experience.
Intermediate to advanced English skills.

Preferred

Experience within an activity-based costing environment.
Working knowledge of production flows and processes including supply chain.

With more than $1B in revenue, Tennant Company is a globally recognized leader in the cleaning equipment industry. For the past 150 years, we have been passionate about developing and manufacturing innovative and sustainable solutions for our customers. At Tennant Company, we are committed to stewardship and creating a cleaner, safer and healthier world. With manufacturing, operations and sales, service, and support functions across the globe, your journey at Tennant can take you places you never expected.

In this role, you will support programs and initiatives for the North America Service business. This role will be instrumental in working closely with our sub contractors and PM service contracts. He/she understands current interdependencies and business practices that impact both our employees and our customers. Working in an environment with varied priorities, this role will be key to ensuring collaborative approaches are taken to solve customer pain points and enhance the efficiency of our employees.

GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Support Field and Service Operations Teams.
Assist with:
FSM Platform oversight
Sub Contractor Program.
PM Service Contract Renewal Process
New Product Launch initiatives
New NA Field Service Initiatives
May work closely with the North America Sales & Service Directors to identify, implement and execute broad strategic initiatives and support tactical plans to enhance operational performance and the customer experience.
Foster and maintain a collaborative relationship with internal and external business partners to ensure customer satisfaction and loyalty.
Communicates, influences, builds commitment to and effectively manages changes that align employees and customers behind the direction of the organization.
Act as a key organizational influencer to identify and implement broad, cross-functional business process improvement, develop successful working relationships and collaborate with Service, Field Sales, Field Operations, etc. to facilitate new programs, messages, campaigns, and offerings.
Partner with Product and Marketing Leader on delivery of new products.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION:

Bachelor's Degree, preferably in a business-related discipline.
5+ years of Engineering, Business, or related position in Field Service
2+ years of Subcontract Program Management experience across the program lifecycle.
Advanced knowledge of program management standards and best practices (scheduling, cost accounting, Earned Value Management (EVM), Risk/Opportunity management).
Strong complex subcontract/contract experience, teamwork/team building expertise, proven leadership, negotiation skill sets.
Outstanding communication and presentation skills.
Demonstrated ability to proactively team with all levels of the organization/program.
Possess excellent English communication skills, both written, verbal, and presentation, to effectively communicate business cases to all levels of peers, suppliers, as well as program and executive management.
Proficient in Microsoft Applications and the ability to learn programs used in Tennant Field Service.
REQUIRED SKILLS

Highly collaborative with ability to motivate a large team across a matrix environment.
Ability to concentrate on tasks, examine issues from multiple perspectives, make decisions and work calmly and effectively in a high-pressure, deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to build and maintain positive relationships, both internally and externally, while maintaining a customer service orientation.
Openness to take direction for projects and tasks from leaders within the Field Service Business.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, organize and accurately prioritize work, be detail-oriented, understand when urgency is required and use good judgment in varied situations.
Consistently behaves in a way that reflects positively on self, function and Tennant Company.
Takes the initiative and ownership to identify and achieve goals and objectives, conveys an appropriate sense of urgency.
Understands and is responsive to others' needs and concerns; demonstrates effective listening skills; is respectful and considerate of others; values diversity and embraces differences in people and approaches
Through effective execution, regularly achieves objectives and desired benefits, sets appropriate timelines and follows projects and tasks through to completion.
Demonstrates ability to analyze complex situations and make sound recommendations and decisions effectively, and execute against those decisions
Excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication
KEY METRICS:

North American Service revenue, margin & operating profit
Joint ownership (with ADS's) of Service CX metrics: NPS, PM Pull %, Communication metrics
# of process improvement projects/initiatives completed (+ ROI metrics)
Additional metrics based on key focuses for the year
REQUIRED INTERPERSONAL & BEHAVIORAL SKILLS: In addition to the General Responsibilities, the following are requisite interpersonal and behavioral skills of the position as well as:
Collaborates: Involves others as appropriate to accomplish individual and group goals. Encourages unity rather than “us vs. them” thinking. Welcomes and acknowledges the ideas and input of others.
Customer Focus: Searches for ways to improve customer service. Follows up with customers to ensure problems are solved. Independently anticipates and meets customer needs. Internalizes customer feedback and provides innovative ideas to meet their future needs.
Decision Quality: Demonstrates good judgment in routine, day-to-day decision making. Makes sound independent decisions in urgent and non-routine situations. Considers various inputs, criteria, and trade-offs to arrive at effective decisions and recommendations.
Drives Results: Demonstrates a strong drive to achieve meaningful results. Drives tasks to successful completion and closure.
Innovation: Suggests creative ideas and innovative solutions. Explores multiple alternatives and approaches to overcome obstacles and find solutions. Is open to and builds upon new ideas and solutions offered by others.
Instills Trust: Is honest and straightforward when working with others. Honors agreements and commitments, even when working through competing priorities.
Nimble Learning: Applies new concepts and principles to address problems. Learns from mistakes and adjusts accordingly. Learns quickly when facing new situations
Values Differences: Behaves with sensitivity toward differences in cultural norms, expectations, and ways of communicating. Seeks out the diverse perspectives and talents of others. Works effectively with others who have different perspectives, backgrounds, and/or styles.

Eaton’s Energy Automation Solutions (EAS) business is currently seeking a ReSurge Program: Business Intelligence Analyst. Are you looking to change industries or functions from your previous experience? Eaton’s ReSurge Program is designed to support people just like you with both your professional and personal goals. Please note the Eaton ReSurge cohort will begin their 12-month assignment in April of 2024.

Eaton provides a competitive total rewards package commensurate with applicable skills, knowledge, and experience and consistent with internal and external market practices. The annual salary for this role is $90,000 a year.

Eaton’s 12-month paid returnship will give participants a multitude of opportunities to make an impact across a global organization. Participants will work to solve real-world challenges while refreshing the skills necessary to be a leader in our organization. You will gain enriching and diverse experiences and work side-by-side with experienced leaders and mentors to power your career. Successful participants may be eligible for full-time employment opportunities upon completion of the program.

All ReSurge participants will join a cohort with a unique learning and development experience. Each participant’s assignment experience will be customized to help them reach their highest potential; no two participants will have the same experience or set of responsibilities.

What you’ll do:

Business Intelligence Analyst:

The Business Intelligence Analyst will work with cross-functional teams across the business to transform data into value-added insights that can drive efficiencies in processes. You will be consolidating data from various sources, creating maintainable data models, and reporting that is intuitive and actionable. The position will require proficiency in data manipulation, data analysis, data modeling and visualization skills. Essential duties include:

Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to gather requirements and enhance data management models, driving best practices. Translate requirements into functional interactive dashboards using Power BI.
Document reporting developed solutions for long term maintainability. Create standard operation procedures and provide training to improve business analytics.
Develop improved data governance practices to ensure proper distribution of data, version control, and appropriately release incremental updates/upgrades.
Evaluate operations for inefficiencies and identify areas where you can create, automate, and develop tools to extract knowledge and actionable information.
Support the business with ad hoc reporting as needed
Qualifications:
Required (Basic) qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution
3+ years Power BI and SQL experience to build functional dashboards
Must be able to work in the United States without corporate sponsorship now and within the future
No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates that currently reside within 50 miles of location will be considered. Active-Duty Military Service member candidates are exempt from the geographical area limitation.

Preferred Qualifications:

1+ year of a voluntary career break from your profession
25% travel may be required.
Deep knowledge writing SQL queries for data preparation and ability to mine data from multiple platforms. Comfortable in complex data environments and understanding of data structures.
Strong ability to troubleshoot and resolve data issues.
Being able to quickly provide meaningful insights from data and apply best practices for reporting.
Be a passionate problem solver - breaking down problems and developing analytical insights.
Passion for automation.
Ability to organize and lead meetings with business and operational data owners.
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to report consumers.

Computershare Corporate Trust is built on a foundation of “Trust Makes it Work” – expertise, relationships, and innovation you can trust. When you join this dynamic team as a Treasury Operations Analyst you will enjoy a career, teamwork, flexibility and leadership you can trust to help accelerate your personal and professional goals.

Corporate Trust is a market leader with decades of experience as a provider of trustee and sophisticated agency services for private and public companies, investment bankers, asset managers as well as governments and institutions. We offer a wide range of services that fulfil our clients with a best-in-class reputation built on our high-touch approach to client service we are looking for people to join us and be a part of our exciting future as one of the top corporate trust firms in North America.

Do you bring trusted experience to Computershare Corporate Trust? Do your strengths consist of a passion for numbers with high attention to detail and accuracy, excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, ability to independently perform tasks within the Treasury lines of business?

If you’re a match to those skills and have the passionate drive to be part of something truly amazing, while working on a diverse team and have the willingness to learn multiple tasks, then this is the perfect opportunity for you!


A role you will love

The Treasury Operations Analyst is responsible for producing weekly and monthly reports for internal distribution. They will interact with various banking partners to ensure accounts are set up properly, assist with bank documentation, and monitor banking transactions to ensure they are completed successfully. The Analyst will also perform research and interact with internal Business units and banks to assist with questions and issue resolution.

Some of your key responsibilities may include:

Complete new bank set ups including documentation, KYC, and connectivity.
Assist in the preparation of bank documentation for opening and closing bank accounts.
Validate cash investment as directed by Front Office. Ensure in line with policy and exposure limit.
Perform reporting – giveback calculation, bank expenses, fee reporting.
Assist in perform security administrative functions on Treasury Management System and banking platforms.
Work on Audit and Regulatory requests.
Work with multiple mainframe systems, company applications, bank applications, and Microsoft Office applications. Excellent Excel skills are needed for very large and complex spreadsheets.


What will you bring to the role?

As you’ve probably gathered by now, we are looking for somebody with a real passion for Treasury Operations and a familiarity with banking, market, and investment products that are relevant to the role. In addition, you should be able to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.

Other key skills required for the role include:

Minimum a Bachelor’s degree or 4 years of experience in one or a combination of the following areas: trust, financial services, or account management is required
Knowledge of Corporate Trust Services business & products
Structured finance experience and familiarity with mortgage securitizations processes
Microsoft Suite (Advanced Excel, Intermediate Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Database software knowledge is recommended
Treasury Management System experience is preferred
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents
Previous customer service or client interaction strongly preferred


Rewards designed for you


Parental leave . We offer paid parental leave, flexible working and a caring and inclusive culture.

Health and wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family, even your pets. These include medical, dental, vision and a wellness reimbursement.

Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.

Save for your future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey with 401k matching and tax-advantaged flexible spending plans that include healthcare, dependent care and commuter.

Income protection . To ease concerns when the unexpected occurs our package includes short and long-term disability benefits, life insurance, supplemental life insurance (single/spouse/family) and more.

Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.

Extra rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.

Compensation . The base pay range for this role is $60,000 - $75,000. This base pay range is specific to St. Paul, MN and may not be applicable to other locations.
