Company Description


AcuStaf is an industry leader in Labor Management Software. Founded in 1979, AcuStaf provides Time & Attendance, Scheduling, and Staffing Solutions to 24/7 industries. AcuStaf is looking for motivated team members to work collaboratively to support our customers.



Job Description


Position: Implementation Specialist

Type: Full-time, Exempt, Remote & On-site Travel

Location: Bloomington, MN

Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Holidays, Paid Time Off, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k)

Position Summary:

The Implementation Specialist implements the AcuStaf staffing and scheduling solution to meet our clients’ needs. They will perform business process analysis, consultation, design, implementation, training, deployment, and documentation. They are responsible to document customer requirements and configure applications to meet customer-specific business processes. They will interface with customers during the design and deployment of business solutions. They can be involved in pre-sales activity to obtain and expand government medical centers and healthcare system business. They will build and maintain client relationships. They will manage the solutions through deployment, training, and hand-off activities.


Responsibilities:

Configures, tests, and deploys enterprise application and business processes for clients.
Coordinates with client to identify project resources and manage schedule to maximize productivity.
Prepares presentations, gains consensus from client and implementation team, and implements solutions.
Translates client’s business requirements into application configurations, creates and maintains system documentation, workflows, and requirements.
Prepares training materials, updates custom documents, and facilitates onsite and virtual training sessions and participates in user group meetings.
Supports the client following “Go Live” deployment to troubleshoot identified issues and promote additional methods to optimize the system for enhanced performance through consulting with peers.
Ensures all projects are delivered on time and within budget while tracking key performance indicators/metrics and providing status reports.
Promotes AcuStaf's capabilities to clients, identifies sales opportunities, and achieves contract extension or additional business within the account(s).
Participates in cross-functional teams to explore process improvement initiatives, measure results, and refine processes to achieve business objectives.
Performs internal educational sessions on the AcuStaf platform while serving as a peer resource and trainer to team members.
Special projects as assigned.


Qualifications


Required Qualifications:

Bachelor degree in Business, MIS, Communications or 4 years of relevant work experience.
1+ years of Software as a Service implementation.
Experience as a project lead or lead functional consultant identifying, analyzing, and managing project risks and impacts.
Experience in business analysis, requirements definition and providing options and recommendations on the best way to implement the requirements to meet overall business goals and processes, including integrations, interfaces, and data flows.
Experience with Microsoft Office product suite.
Excellent communications skills, including verbal, written, interpersonal and presentation.
Must be willing to travel up to 50% on average throughout the year.

Preferred Qualifications:

1+ years of Labor Management experience.
1+ years of relevant consulting.
Experience with Jira, Confluence, Zendesk.
Knowledge of scheduling, time and attendance and credentialing software.
Knowledge of payroll processing.

Additional Information


Job Specifics:

Job requires working on a computer for extended periods of time.
Job requires frequent communication via telephone, email, and chat.

What We Offer:

Competitive benefits and pay.
Small, collaborative teams.
Recognition for innovative contributions.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Title: IT Service Owner - Transit Technology (Business Analyst 2 or 3) REPOST
Job Description:
WHO WE ARE

This is a REPOST. If you previously applied to this position, you do not need to reapply, your application is still under consideration. This position will be posted until filled and may be removed at any time.

This position is eligible for a hybrid (both remote and onsite) telework arrangement. Candidate's permanent residence must be in Minnesota or Wisconsin.

We are the Metropolitan Council, the regional government for the seven-county Twin Cities metropolitan area. We plan 30 years ahead for the future of the metropolitan area and provide regional transportation, wastewater, and housing services. More information about us on our website.

We are committed to supporting a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve.

Information Services is the central IT department supporting all divisions of the Metropolitan Council. Our 140 team members provide technology, practices and innovative solutions that enable the core services of the Council.

How your work would contribute to our organization and the Twin Cities region:

The IT Service Owner - Transit Technology, which will be filled at a Business Analyst 2 or 3 level depending on qualifications, will work closely with business representatives to analyze the operations of a department or functional unit to support the development and enhancement of Transit technology services provided by Information Services. The IS Service Owner is responsible for managing relationships with business partners, developing and driving strategy, coordinating delivery of business outcomes, managing risks, and developing and managing the budget of services. The services managed by this IS Service Owner are critical in delivering the technology needed to enable Metro Transit and Metropolitan Transportation Services to provide a quality transit experience to the region.


In addition, this position will identify opportunities for improvement in business operations and process; be involved in the design or modification of business and/or IT systems; elicit, document, and analyze business needs and requirements; documents the functional designs of systems; and may help test solutions and create documentation and user manuals.


Business Analyst 2:
Anticipated starting salary range: $34.70 - $39.37 Hourly / $72,176 - $81,890 Annually
Full salary range: $34.70 - $52.36 Hourly / $72,176 - $108,909 Annually

Business Analyst 3:
Anticipated starting salary range: $37.50 - $42.56 Hourly / $78,000 - $88,525 Annually
Full salary range: $37.50 - $56.60 Hourly / $78,000 - $117,728 Annually

The starting salary will be based on the selected candidate's experience, skills, education, and internal salary equity, and includes a generous benefits package.

Benefits: Great work/life balance, insurance starting on day one, MN State Retirement Program pension, in-house clinic, salary continuance for injury or illness, 13 paid holidays per year plus generous annual leave, employee development, free Metro
Transit rides, and much more!

What you would do in this job

Own and act as a Service Owner of Information Services transit technology services, enterprise and/or non-enterprise services.
Negotiate service level agreements based on business requirements, outcomes, and service delivery cost.
Coordinate continuous improvement throughout the service delivery process.
Create service roadmaps in partnership with business partners.
Cultivate strong working relationships with business and IT function partners.
Coordinate the support and delivery of IT services based on established Operation Level Agreements by working in partnership with functional owners.
Establish measurable key performance indicators for the delivery of IT services.
Establish cost models and fee schedules for the delivery of IT services.
Manage service-level budget.
Will translate IT service delivery concepts into actionable steps in support of delivering business outcomes.
Analyze, document, and improve service delivery processes through business analysis methodologies and collaborative approaches.
Create, maintain, analyze, and coordinate routine reporting and queries to maintain service level information.
Present live and recorded technical training, generate training materials, and demo technology.
Assist with eliciting and documenting business requirements and system testing, as needed.
Develop and write user stories.
Assist in the development of Service Owner and business analysis best practices and creation of service delivery documentation.
Articulate technology concepts and specific technology use cases to all levels of the organization.
Facilitate/lead a Community of Practice for transportation-focused technologies, such as scheduling and dispatch applications.
Create and maintain training resources for business users of transportation technologies.
Perform special projects and other duties as assigned.

What education and experience are required for this job (minimum qualifications)

Business Analyst 2
High school diploma or GED AND seven (7) years of experience in the areas below:

In a Business Analyst capacity, assessing how organizations are performing and improving business processes and systems.
Ability to work with stakeholders to understand business needs and elicit business requirements.
Experience in eliciting, analyzing user feedback and usage data to inform service decisions.
Understanding of transit operations and technologies, tools, and practices used to deliver transit services.
Knowledge of transit technologies used on buses, trains, and facilities managed by Metro transit.
Knowledge of the transit operational environment.
Strong communication skills in writing, speaking, and presenting.
Ability to prepare clear, concise, and accurate documentation, reports of work performed and other written materials.

Note: Highest completed degree in the following majors: business administration, project management, management information systems (MIS) or a related field will count towards the minimum seven (7) years of required work experience.
Associates degree counts as two years of experience
Bachelor's degree or higher counts as four years of experience

Business Analyst 3

High school diploma or GED AND eight (8) years of experience in the areas below:
In a Business Analyst capacity, assessing how organizations are performing and improving business processes and systems.
Ability to work with stakeholders to understand business needs and elicit business requirements.
Experience in eliciting, analyzing user feedback and usage data to inform service decisions.
Understanding of transit operations and technologies, tools, and practices used to deliver transit services.
Knowledge of transit technologies used on buses, trains, and facilities managed by Metro transit.
Knowledge of the transit operational environment.
Strong communication skills in writing, speaking, and presenting.
Ability to prepare clear, concise, and accurate documentation, reports of work performed and other written materials.

Note: Highest completed degree in the following majors: business administration, project management, management information systems (MIS) or a related field will count towards the minimum eight (8) years of required work experience.
Associates degree counts as two years of experience
Bachelor's degree or higher counts as four years of experience

What additional skills and experience would be helpful in this job (desired qualifications):

IT Service Owner Experience.
Have a good working knowledge of Transit technologies; examples include:
Prior experience using and/or implementing onboard technology or management technology for buses and trains.
Acted as a Project Manager on a prior implementation or significant upgrade.
Participated in or elicited and documented business requirements analysis for transportation technologies.
Assisted in the development of or has created user stories for transit technologies and/or its riders.
Knowledge of Agile methodologies.
Experience working in Agile development teams.
Ability to think creatively and strategically to drive service innovation and differentiation.
Experience guiding a Community of Practice around a technology product or service.
Overseeing implementation of services and systems features.
Certification as a Business Relationship Management Professional (BRMP®).
Experience leading planning cycles that include strategic roadmaps, technology plans, and innovative opportunities.
Ability to listen, build rapport, and develop credibility as a strategic partner.
Be able to shift opinions using influence over positional power.
IIBA or PMI Business Analysis Certification.
ITIL Certification.
Knowledge of IIBA Business Analysis Core Concepts.
Experience promoting an equitable, positive, and respectful work environment that values culture and diversity among all employees.


What knowledge, skills and abilities you should have within the first six months on the job:

A Strong understanding of Metro Transit and/or Metropolitan Transportation Services systems and current technology such as HASTUS, Trapeze, or Cubic used to deliver business outcomes.
Ability to write and update service level agreements focusing on business outcomes which articulate the value of IT services.
Ability to build strong relationships and deliver customer-centric solutions.
Navigate complex processes and interpersonal dynamics with a focus on uniting diverse stakeholders to common outcomes.
Build consensus and motivate people to act and participate.
Knowledge of Information Technology Information Library 4 (ITIL 4) service management concepts and delivery of IT service or previous Service Management experience.
Ability to facilitate requirements elicitation sessions utilizing multiple tools and techniques.
Ability to be flexible, adaptable, and responsive.

Christensen Farms is one of the largest, family-owned pork producers in the United States, marketing approximately 3 million hogs per year. Headquartered in Sleepy Eye, Minnesota, the company operates throughout the Midwest with facilities in Minnesota, Iowa, Nebraska, Illinois and South Dakota. Christensen Farms owns four feed mills, manages 145,000 sows on 44 farms, and oversees more than 350 nurseries and grow-finish sites. The company employees nearly 1,000 people and maintains 1,500 contract partnerships.





The company is vertically integrated with a strong presence across the pork value chain - from farm to fork. Christensen Farms is the largest shareholder of Triumph Foods LLC, a producer-owned primary pork processing plant in St. Joseph, Missouri. In turn, Triumph Food members own 50 percent of Daily's Premium Meats, a specialty pork processor bacon and other premium pork products. Triumph Foods also holds a 50 percent partnership in Seaboard Triumph Foods, LLC of Sioux City, Iowa, a primary pork processing plant.





Position Overview & Responsibilities

The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for leading the requirements definition process of IT development and software implementation projects and participates through the whole software development (or implementation) life cycle process. Additionally, the BA serves as the primary level-2 support for assigned key business applications. In this capacity, the BA must gain/maintain a deep understanding of the underlying business processes being served by the related software functionality. The BA serves as a liaison between the business user and the technical resource (typically a software developer or implementer). The BA must work cooperatively and actively with both IT and business user resources, always seeking the highest quality and value achievement in each project.


Major Areas of Accountability

Gathers and documents requirements for new application functionality, whether custom software or off-the-shelf software configuration.
Provides 2nd level end user support for assigned business applications.
Documents current and desired business process flows and recommends solutions to fill gaps or to improve the flow and/or efficiency of processes.
Creates and maintains software based workflow processes as applicable.
Performs basic customizations within the assigned application suites to streamline or extend functionality.
Works closely with developers and business users to ensure that developed functionality meets documented requirements.
Develops and maintains user documentation including manuals and training materials.
Develops and maintains use case documentation for testing purposes.
Gathers and documents user suggestions for new features and content for assigned applications.
Leads QA/user acceptance testing of assigned applications, including custom applications.
Diagnoses application problems, determines root causes and either resolves the issue(s) or passes along to the relevant people that can resolve the issue.
Other duties assigned within the scope, responsibility, and requirements of the job.


Education, Training and Experience Requirements:

Minimum formal education required: Bachelor's degree in an IT related discipline or agricultural discipline or 6+ years of equivalent work experience.
Experience creating process maps, gathering business requirements, writing functional specifications, writing user stories, creating test plans and writing test scripts.
Clear, concise, and precise written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with people of various backgrounds including non-technical audiences.
Strong solution-oriented approach to team problem solving.
Ability to multi-task and to prioritize objectives, anticipate situations and take quick action.
Computer skills required: Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Visio


Additional Desirable Skills/Qualifications

Certifications in any of the following are a plus: Business Analysist (IIBA, PMI-PBA, etc.), ITIL.
Experience working in an agricultural business, particularly the swine industry.
Experience in Business Process Management.
Experience in Application Management
Experience in Database Management
Experience in Level 1 and/or Level 2 user support (Freshservice or similar ITSM tool).
Cloud technologies (Public, Private, Dedicated, Hybrid).
End user computing devices including Windows, Android, and iOS.

This job description is not intended to limit the responsibilities of an employee assigned to this position to those duties listed above. The employee is expected to follow any other instructions and perform any other duties requested by the immediate supervisor or company management. The level of involvement may vary based on company and individual capabilities.

Overview:
The Business Technologist is responsible for managing and configuring our platform to perform work for our manufacturing/operations teams. This includes managing the day-to-day management, configuration, and troubleshooting of the platform and processes in support of the manufacturing and operations teams.
Responsibilities:
Develop and document business objectives, use cases, business requirements, system specifications, workflows, and process documentation

Help to develop and maintain workflows and processes in NetSuite to optimize the platform for manufacturing and operations
Manage vendors and third parties who assist with the configuration and management of the platform (Turning Point)
Validate and document results by testing and/or facilitating the testing of systems or process changes
Transition support to helpdesk, desktop support, system administrators and others following implementation and/or upgrade and assists with escalated service tickets.

Create and execute a test plan and tests in the Sandbox environment to be utilized prior to upgrades, ensuring all functionality works as expected and without interruption

- the project planning meetings

Knowledge & Skills
Experience with ERP/MRP platforms and processes (Oracle NetSuite, Infor, SAP., etc.)
Excellent analytical, problem-solving skills and ability to find creative solutions
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
Strong interpersonal skills with emphasis on customer service, collaboration, decision making, conflict management, and teamwork
Ability to plan, organize, and perform work with deadlines

Position Summary
At Polaris, the Operations Analyst is a crucial part of our dynamic supply chain, responsible for the planning, communication, and delivery of Off-Road Vehicle shipments. This role serves as a cornerstone in cross-functional collaborations, connecting logistics, manufacturing, sales, and finance departments. Success in this role hinges on the ability to proactively identify bottlenecks and develop effective countermeasures, while maintaining a high service level to our dealer network. Strong analytical skills with the ability to sort through large amounts of data in the most efficient way utilizing databases is essential part of this role.
Key Responsibilities:
Strategic Planning & Execution: Take charge of the monthly and quarterly Ship Plans for the Off-Road Vehicle category, in alignment with financial targets, Sales and Operations Planning (SIOP), and Logistics.
Retail Strategy: Lead initiatives to optimize shipping to retail, including fast-pass and order prioritization strategies, while communicating key findings to senior management.
Data-Driven Operations: Apply accurate shipping dates to customer orders, coordinating closely with the SIOP team to flexibly adapt to demand changes.
Metrics & Reporting: Develop, monitor, and disseminate key performance indicators that measure service level efficacy.
Continuous Improvement: Routinely identify opportunities for process optimization and implement best practices for Retail Flow Management.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience
Advanced proficiency in Excel
Strong analytical skills
Exceptional communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work both collaboratively and independently in a high-paced environment
Proficiency in Alteryx & Power BI preferred
Working Conditions:
Standard office environment
Minimal travel required (5%)

Job Title: Lead Business Product Analyst - Learning Management
Job Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Business Execution Consultant, to join the Talent Management and Learning team within HR Product Management! This is an exciting opportunity to help lead Wells Fargo's Human Resources transformation to deliver a new experience to our team through process and technology.

The Lead Business Execution Consultant, will deliver compelling and integrated Learning technology solutions and ensure alignment to HR Product and Portfolio Management standards and best practices. The ideal candidate is a hands-on, proven contributor with strong leadership, communication and problem-solving skills, knowledge of the project tasks required to deliver solutions leveraging both in-house and SAAS based applications.

In this role, you will:
Evolve the HR Portfolio and roadmap in partnership with Product leadership, HRIS, our HR business owners, and other stakeholders across the business.
Work closely with business partners to evaluate business requirements, plan projects, and participate in efficient development, delivery, and deployments.
Function as the highest-level internal consultant within technology and business groups by building and/or re-engineering HR technical and business processes and tools for greater efficiencies with significant impact to the business.
Lead the planning, support, and execution of configuration and testing activities.
Produce effective documentation to capture and communicate business process and requirements in the format of business process flow diagrams, data flow diagrams, data definition documents, decision trees, logic diagrams, requirements documents, and user experience flows.
Influence, guide and lead less experienced members of the team.
Lead and facilitate workshops and discussions to effectively gather requirements and achieve a detailed understanding of client objectives and desired outcomes.
Own and execute on system administration for Learning systems, including configuration, business processes, security & compliance, notifications, auditing, and data quality management.
Assist in decomposing epics into effective user stories.
Maintain task status in JIRA or similar Agile management tool.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of Business Execution, Implementation, or Strategic Planning experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.
Desired Qualifications:
Deep knowledge of Learning & Development business functions and products.
4+ years of HR Systems experience (including learning) preferably in a global environment with multiple integrations. Experience with Cornerstone a plus.
Experience implementing learning centric SaaS applications (previous LXP implementation/configuration preferred)
Experience operating in an Agile environment and/or strong knowledge and understanding of Agile (Agile certification a plus)
Experience leading and facilitating workshops and discussions to meet client objectives and desired outcomes.
Experience driving the requirements process with both technical and business partners.
Experience interpreting business and technical needs and translating them into user stories.
Experience managing complex technology projects and presenting to multiple levels of management.
Ability to operate as part of cross functional work streams to execute projects with quality and on-time.
Knowledge of HR business processes.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Strong organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills
Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment.
Job Expectations:
Ability to travel up to 5% of the time.
This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship
Office locations: Charlotte, NC; Minneapolis, MN
Must work on-site at posted locations, in the office at least 3 days/week.

AtriCure, Inc. provides innovative technologies for the treatment of Afib and related conditions. Afib affects more than 33 million people worldwide. Electrophysiologists and cardiothoracic surgeons around the globe use AtriCure technologies for the treatment of Afib and reduction of Afib related complications. AtriCure’s Isolator® Synergy™ Ablation System is the first medical device to receive FDA approval for the treatment of persistent Afib. AtriCure’s AtriClip® Left Atrial Appendage Exclusion System products are the most widely sold LAA management devices worldwide. AtriCure’s Hybrid AF™ Therapy is a minimally invasive procedure that provides a lasting solution for long-standing persistent Afib patients. AtriCure’s cryoICE cryoSPHERE® probe is cleared for temporary ablation of peripheral nerves to block pain, providing pain relief in cardiac and thoracic procedures. For more information, visit AtriCure.com or follow us on Twitter @AtriCure.

We foster a culture of inclusion by embracing diverse experiences and individuals where everyone’s authentic self is welcome. We offer supporting programs and resources that provide enriching and equitable opportunities for each person to contribute professionally and personally.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The CRM Business Analyst is responsible for helping to define and determine the strategy for delivering ongoing improvements to our CRM application. As a CRM Business Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting and analyzing requirements to suggest and implement the solutions within our Microsoft Dynamics CRM solution. You will focus on our sales initiatives by collaborating with Sales, Marketing, Education and other departments as needed. You will be responsible for ensuring that the business requirements are met while providing a variety of advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training. The ideal candidate must have a good understanding of CRM project implementations as well as specific experience with MS Dynamics. We're looking for a self-starter who thrives in a fun but results-oriented work environment, passionate about delivering measurable results and enjoys working on a wide variety of projects.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Own all aspects of CRM support/business needs for the company
Document business needs but being able to distinguish between needs and wants; identify gaps between business needs and standard CRM application functionality; design and document solutions that fill the gaps; and provide detailed business requirements.
Perform application configuration and customization of the CRM system (building screens, designing custom objects, developing workflows, etc.), including testing and evaluation to ensure quality and consistency
Evaluate and implement any add-ons to enhance the CRM system.
Prepare and document data conversion requirements for mapping from company systems into CRM
Develop, document, and execute test plans to assess the integrity and accuracy of business processes, CRM module functionality setups and modifications, enhancements, customizations, and patches.
Develop and maintain end user training documentation and deliver training to users as required.
Develop and maintain business process documentation and consider compliance in all business process analysis and redesign activities.
Support, analyze, and resolve critical production application issues as required.
Construct summary and detailed views in MS Dynamics for all CRM subject areas.
Provide guidance for system/process workflow template development and data filtering criteria
Ensure consistency of CRM usage conventions, compliance with best practices, and integrity of data.
Perform and/or provide oversight on mass data uploads into CRM system
Understand and provide recommendations for other departments.
Follow new releases, patches, and system updates.
Lead small & mid-size projects from inception through implementation following SDLC and project managements best practices.
Drive user adoption of CRM systems to ensure compliance and success of the tool.
Become a subject matter expert in all things Atricure; products, hierarchy, personnel, etc.
Perform other job-related functions as assigned.
ADDITIONAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Hybrid work environment
Regular and predictable work performance
Ability to work under fast-paced conditions
Ability to make decisions and use good judgment
Ability to prioritize various duties and multitask as required
Ability to successfully work with others
Additional duties as assigned
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in a related field of study is required
2-3 years experience with MS Dynamics CRM
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access, Word, & PowerPoint
Ability to communicate and build relationships at all levels within the organization
Highly effective verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical abilities with solid attention to detail
Ability to learn and apply new technology
Ability to travel up to 20%
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Sales operations experience within the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or medical device industry
Experience using Scribe, PowerBI, etc.
Experience with Business Analysis
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

Ability to regularly walk, sit, or stand as needed
Ability to occasionally bend and push/pull as needed
Ability to pass a background check

We exist to help people achieve financial clarity. At Thrivent, we believe money is a tool, not a goal. Job Summary

Thrivent Treasury operates in a highly complex, regulated environment where processes, technologies and risk factors constantly evolve. This position is responsible for performing key Treasury functions such as cash positioning and cash flow forecasting, wire/ACH transactions, debt compliance and administration, dividends and capital contributions. This is a top tier critical function, impacting up to $1B in cash movement per month as needed to fund the firm’s operations and investments.

Job Responsibilities and Duties

Determine the necessary levels of borrowing and investing according to the firm's daily cash position by capturing and analyzing transactional data within the treasury management system. Ensure all financing occurs in a manner consistent with established objectives and policies. Monitor and manage bank balances and associated liquidity risks.
Monitor excess cash and maximize the return on investments in compliance with the company's investment policies.
Generate various cash flow forecasts; perform trend and variance analyses.
Interact frequently with external banks, vendors, internal and external auditors, and field staff to research and resolve issues such as potential fraud cases. Recommend new bank services or changes to services.
Play a critical role in implementation and testing of Thrivent’s new Treasury Management System (TMS). Operate and monitor the TMS, including all transactions and interfaces. Assist in the optimization and maintenance of the system where applicable.
Execute fund transfers between internal and external bank accounts totaling $1B per month to ensure optimal liquidity while minimizing idle cash balances. Manage daily ACH activities and check processing, including researching and resolving complex issues.
Manage unclaimed property program and system. Leveraging knowledge of state-by-state unclaimed property laws, handle due diligence and create state filings for Thrivent and its subsidiaries.
Manage and monitor FHLB advances ($100M each) and related cash flows, incorporate into cash position and forecast.
Perform and respond to frequent audit tests and inquiries. Interact with internal and external auditors to advise on our processes. Maintain operational procedures and business continuity plans.
Work with Treasury Manager and business partners to optimize cash flow, improve process efficiencies, implement treasury strategies, ensure compliance and controls, and assist with bank relationship management.
Perform special requests for Treasury management, as well as assist other individuals or business units in solving treasury-related issues and serve as treasury system and process expert/consultant within the Company.
Model Thrivent’s leadership competencies – Model the Way, Rally the Team, and Deliver Outcomes.
Support an environment in which Thrivent employees and colleagues are focused on continuous improvement, exceptional employee engagement, and an unwavering commitment to our clients. Help shape and/or support a culture that represents the Thrivent purpose, promise and values, ensuring that Thrivent’s trust and reputation remain strong with its clients.

Job Qualifications

Required

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Business Administration or other related course of study or equivalent work experience.
Minimum 1-3 years experience in Cash Management, Investments or Finance/Accounting.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail due to the complexity of the function.
Advanced technical skills in Excel.
Strong interpersonal skills and oral and written communication skills to deal effectively with internal and external business partners whether remotely or in person.
Individual must be deadline oriented with excellent organizational and project management skills.
Resourcefulness, ability to think logically, work independently to resolve issues, and confidently present findings and recommendations is essential.

Preferred

Preferred candidate will have cash management or investments/investment accounting experience in a complex financial services organization or large corporate environment.
Experience with accounting practices, processing of financial transactions, banking-related activities, cash flow theory, investments and related terminology is strongly preferred.
Working knowledge of Treasury management systems is also highly preferred.
Well-developed quantitative skills including financial modeling experience is beneficial.

Additional Information

This position allows a flexible work arrangement meaning you may work on-site and/or remotely from the Minneapolis, MN or Appleton, WI area.

General Summary

We currently have an opening in our Integrated Operations Centerwith a strong focus on network and telecommunications within our Information Technology Division. The position ensures availability of critical infrastructure and services by monitoring, analyzing, and taking action to remedy/resolve network, system, and application performance issues and security events.

Main responsibilities include:

Support availability of our multi-technology resilient network built on private fiber, private wireless, leased services, and DMVPN architectures for mission-critical services.
Enable automation with upgrades and updates using Python and Ansible to keep our infrastructure current and secure.
Beyond infrastructure, support availability for server, backups, and applications.
Act as our major incident manager during infrequent but visible outages.
Resolve incidents and communicate with all levels in the organization following standard procedures and ensuring adherence to service level agreements using our
Maximo ticketing system.
Lead the CAB and oversee the change management program and other operational activities such as DR testing.
Utilize various monitoring and management tools for event detection, problem identification, trending or historical analysis, and take corrective or remedial actions where appropriate.
Recommend and oversee implementation of additional monitoring efforts to promote proactive incident detection and response, preventive maintenance, and change management practices.
Respond to information requests from business customers, telecommunications providers, and interconnected utilities, and coordinate planned or unplanned outages with appropriate parties.
Monitor and triage backup, network, anti-virus, and other security or operational alerts as they are generated throughout the day.
Participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a technology related field and 3+ years of experience in IT operations OR 2+ years post high school education in a technology related field and
5+ years of experience in IT operations.
Strong network troubleshooting skills. Working knowledge and maintenance of WANs, LANs, routing protocols, SNMP, Internet Protocol Suites and Cisco networking equipment.
Deep understanding of the OSI and TCP/IP model.
Experiences with IPv4 addressing, subnetting, routing protocol (OSPF and BGP) and switching (VLAN, VTP, Spanning Tree, etc...)
Experience with Cisco IOS upgrades and familiar with Infoblox.
Good understanding of how DHCP and DNS work.
Knowledge of MPLS, TDM and RF network transmission systems and integration of these technologies in a large-scale, complex, regional network is a plus.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to relate complex technical issues to non-technical audiences.
Experience with SolarWinds Orion and SIEM tools to proactively find and prevent potential problems.
Experience in application, system, and network monitoring and incident response.

Job Title: Analyst III, Business Product Owner Sales Force Service Cloud
Job Description:
This role will serve as the business owner and primary subject matter expert for Sales Force Service Cloud, and maximize its value for customers/users through implementation, operation, optimization, measurement and support. The Analyst III, Business Product Owner works cross-functionally to understand customer needs and business drivers, translate these into user stories (functional requirements), and prioritize them in the product backlog based on business value and impact. They collaborate with capability leads to maintain the product roadmap and partner with the product delivery team (IT) to execute that roadmap through sprint planning, development, acceptance testing and delivery. They also manage the product release cycle and coordinate deployments and associated change management. This role will also be responsible for operational excellence of the product or platform. This includes continuous process improvement, monitoring performance metrics and user feedback, as well as maintaining a well-functioning support model. This role will also establish KPIs, implement measurement of the product, and communicate operational metrics, progress, decisions, impediments and risks to leadership and stakeholders. As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development, and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in several ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking, and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees.

Duties & Responsibilities
Collaborates across the commercial business and enabling functions to understand customer and business needs, identify value-added features, discover bugs and manage requests.
Creates and refines user stories with acceptance criteria, and prioritizes the product backlog.
Partners with an agile delivery team to execute the product backlog and delivers on the product priorities.
Clearly articulates the 'what' and 'why' of each user story or bug and serves as the primary point of contact for the delivery team throughout implementation.
Attends all sprint planning sessions, reviews and retrospectives.
Ensures quality through acceptance testing and approves release-eligible work.
Owns and defines the release schedule for the product, including minor and major releases.
Determines what is included in each release, coordinates releases, creates release notes, updates documentation and manages internal and external communications.
Ensures appropriate change management and training are addressed as needed across all impacted stakeholders.
Collaborates with the appropriate capability lead(s) across Local and Global CE and IT to provide feedback into the overall strategy and co-develop the long-term product roadmap.
Measures, analyzes and communicates insights related to the activities of the product, including qualitative and quantitative measures of customer experience and business value.
Reports to stakeholders and leadership on operational metrics and insights.
Recommends updates to strategy, tactics, processes and the product accordingly.
Ensures operational excellence of the product and all integrations with the broader ecosystem.
Ensures the performance, availability, and integrity of product are in-line with business requirements, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and service level agreements (SLAs).
Establishes and maintains support processes for internal and external customers/users, and serves as a point of escalation and problem solving as needed.
Ensures adequate monitoring is in place as well as communicates and resolves outages when they occur.
Ensures that the product overall provides an exceptional customer experience and advocates on behalf of the customer across projects, initiatives and daily operations.
Requirements
Bachelor’s in business, Marketing, Information Systems, or another related field
Minimum of three (3) years of relevant professional experience
Experience working with Sales Force Service Cloud
Experience working with application delivery, web development or other related IT project teams
Working knowledge of Agile (preferably scrum), managing user stories and a product backlog as well as familiar with Agile Tools and the role of the Product Owner
Experience working with Jira and Confluence or similar preferred
Ability to deliver initiatives from conception through completion
Good understanding of release management best practices
Solid understanding of digital user experience (UX) and customer needs
Strong analytical skills, ability to interpret data and trends, diagnose problems, and recommend action plans to resolve issues
Experience working with geographically distributed teams
Strong presenting, writing and verbal communication skills
Strong reasoning and problem-solving skills
Self-motivator, focused on delivering solutions for business benefit
Passion for creating great customer experiences
Requires specialized mix of digital, business, technical, analytical and data management skills to manage the product and measure product success.
Ability to work across several functions to achieve desired results.
Ensures process optimization over time to ensure efficiency, effectiveness and continuous improvement and drives successful execution of the digital product/platform.
Familiar Kanban and related methodologies
Animal health industry expertise preferred.
Ability to interpret reporting, analytics, and research to surface insights.

Must be willing to take a drug test and post-offer physical (if required)
Must be 18 years of age or older

The Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis is seeking a Compliance Business Analyst for the Audit Standard 5 (AS5/COSO/SOX) compliance function to interact with a wide variety of individuals in all Bank departments including senior management. AS5 partners and assists Bank management in assessing the effectiveness of internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR) under Auditing Standard No. 5 (AS 5) and facilitating the AS 5 COSO/SOX program for the Bank.
Job Description:
AS5 responsibilities include partnering with business lines to assess the design of internal controls and testing of internal controls on behalf of division management. The Business Analyst will devote approximately 70 percent of their time to internal controls and related AS5 activities, and the remaining 30 percent to support other Compliance and Risk Management work.
AS 5 responsibilities:
Understand process, risk and internal controls.
Evaluate the effectiveness of ICFR by conducting tests of department identified internal key controls.
Follow Federal Reserve System and AS5 guidance on testing and documenting work.
Prepare testing workpapers and assist in preparing reports, procedures, and presentations.
Interact with various levels of department staff, including senior management, as appropriate.
Other Compliance and Risk management responsibilities:
Review and provide feedback to business units on their strategic and risk management plans and objectives.
Administer the Control System Evaluation (CSE) survey, conduct Enterprise Risk Management assessments, and participate on other projects as assigned.
Contribute to other Bank efforts or System work groups and complete special assignments, studies, and analyses, as needed.
Interact with business partners and collaborating with internal stakeholders.

Qualification Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree with coursework in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and related work experience.
Five or more years of analytical and/or project management experience to include experience assessing internal controls.
Strong communications skills: individual can professionally and effectively communicate (both written and verbal) with people from different levels of the organization.
Strong analytical skills, attention to details, and the ability to learn and apply new concepts quickly.
Ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously.
Excellent team player with the ability to work independently.
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Internet Explorer.
Certification desirable (e.g., CPA, CIA, or CISA).

Job Title: Solution Architect

Location: 100% Remote

Duration: 6+ Month

Description of Project:


Our client is seeking one (1) full-time staff augmentation resource to perform Solution Architect duties pertaining to the assessment phase of an Access Modernization project.

Commerce currently has 23 Access applications that are used to track various aspects of Commerce business. These applications range in functionality from simple to quite complex, and many are critical to business functions. There are also numerous manual paper processes associated with these Access applications. The focus of the Access Modernization project is to replace obsolete and unmaintainable Access applications that no longer meet business needs with modern solutions that meet business needs and are streamlined, efficient, and secure. This will include the automation of manual processes associated with the applications where possible.

The Solution Architect resource will assess the 23 Access applications (including high-level business requirements, data flows, and any related manual processes) and provide recommendations as to replacement with off the shelf software, replacement with custom built application, or leaving as is.

The 23 identified applications are in the table below:

Complaints


FMLA Tracking


Fuels Monitoring Report (FMR)


Grants


Insurance Examinations

JOB SUMMARY:

Supports the optimization of the Finance/Accounting systems and functional Finance/Accounting applications. Solves organizational information problems and requirements by analyzing requirements; designing computer programs; recommending system controls and protocols. Responsibilities includes review of business processes in order to gain a complete understanding of current procedures, identify improvements, document processes, and connect finance resources to IS resources as appropriate. Acts as a liaison between Finance and other departments on Finance/IS related issues. Supports and implements patient safety and other safety practices as appropriate. Supports and demonstrates Family Centered Care principles when interacting with patients and their families and with co-workers.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Informatics or related field.
3 years at a minimum of analyst experience (e.g., proficient in report writing, advanced Microsoft Office skills including Excel and Access).

CORE FUNCTIONS:

Key accounting and/or AP resource leading the GL, FA, and/or AP components of the Oracle application.
Coordinates and serves as central point of contact for all interactions with internal IS&T resources, other departments, CCH entities, and external application vendors.
Ongoing management, support, and enhancement of the general ledger and related functions, with a focus on continuously identifying, recommending, and executing on opportunities to better streamline and gain efficiencies in the Accounting and Finance function through leveraging Oracle and VBA/SQL in Access and Excel.
ERP team point of contact for changes or enhancements to Accounting and AP functionality.
Actively engage and educate business process owners on solution optimization, simplification and standardization capabilities within Excel, Access and Oracle through the reference of prior experiences and other relevant use cases.
Troubleshoot system errors and document consistent problems for future enhancement. Conducts Root Cause Analysis for high priority/repetitive incidents in partnership with IS&T and other functional areas as applicable.
Manage Oracle projects and streamline business processes in accounting and AP areas by collaborating with business teams and technical teams.
Build effective training program so that all key business users are properly trained to be more productive in the current and new enterprise systems such as Excel and Oracle.
Maintain strong knowledge and understanding of business needs, evidenced by the ability to establish and maintain a high level of trust and confidence.
Work with members of Accounting and AP to align & evolve financial configuration with Oracle based on new opportunities or requirements.
Completes system testing for new Oracle functionality implementation and upgrades in partnership with IS&T and other functional areas.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Finance experience preferred.
Reporting experience preferred.
Oracle experience preferred.
SQL and VBA knowledge preferred.
Experience with ERP system implementations preferred.
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of employees and management.
Must demonstrate critical thinking and problem solving abilities.
Must be able to work independently, managing multiple priorities and deadlines.

Purpose/Scope:
The Finance Analyst II - Operations will be responsible for creating and maintaining standard costs, analyzing cost variances, executing monthly close procedures, and assisting in inventory reporting and analysis. This position is a member of the Finance Operations team and will support the information needs of cross-functional partners including Global Sourcing, Manufacturing, Logistics & Distribution, and Compliance. The roll will interact with management staff and all levels of production and use analytical and problem-solving skills to meet the goals of the organization.

General Responsibilities:

Support the execution of accurate, timely, and efficient financial close processes related to manufacturing and operations
Work with business unit and plant accounting staff to validate, record, and communicate manufacturing variances
Maintain proper account balances in accordance with company policy and U.S. GAAP, including Excess & Obsolete reserves and LIFO reserve for North America manufacturing plants
Prepare month-end account reconciliations and accompanying journal entries
Support the analysis and formal review of general ledger activity to ensure the integrity of account balances at a location level while supporting business insights
Execute operations-related processes and internal controls to ensure compliance with U.S. GAAP, Sarbanes-Oxley, internal polices, and statutory and/or local regulations
Establish and maintain adherence to company policy related to the cycle count program
Monitor results, support initiatives to improve and maintain compliance
Perform quarterly SOX testing specific to inventories and product cost data
Support inventory disposal process
Prepare year-end work papers for external auditors
Prepare consolidated and plant-level operations reporting
Analyze manufacturing costs and processes to identify areas of improvement that will improve efficiency and impact profitability
Analyze key weekly / monthly inventory and manufacturing measures
Evaluate monthly variable budget updates and spending variances
Develop annual standard costs and support ongoing cost updates and training
Support standard rate development by plant and work cell on an annual basis
Develop and implements control mechanisms specific to product costing and variance accounting
Assist in SAP costing implementation at manufacturing facilities and provide product cost training
Advocate for process standardization and improvement across all accounting activities including implementation and/or enhancement of tools, systems, and processes
Develop & maintain SAP training materials specific to standard costing mechanics and requirements
Actively support cross-functional support stakeholders
Support cross-fuctional team with purchase price variance analysis
Supplier relationship management support including supply issue and liability/risk resolution, performance management tracking, and operational support (Direct/Indirect)
Support the maintenance and oversight of freight rates (inbound / outbound)
Demonstrate proficiency in key/appropriate sourcing systems, including SAP
Professional Experience / Qualifications:
The successful candidate will be an engaged, high-energy financial professional with solid cost accounting experience, ideally in a manufacturing-based industry. Also, the candidate will possess a strong, positive ‘roll-up-your-sleeves and do whatever it takes’ attitude.

The successful candidate’s qualifications should include:

B.S. degree in accounting or finance, MBA a plus
3+ years serving as a Cost Accountant and/or Financial Analyst
Experience in a manufacturing organization preferred
Continuous improvement mindset and experience to drive repeatable and efficient processes, including experience with integrations
Proficient in finance, accounting, and costs control principles including US GAAP, SOX, company internal policies and procedures, and internal control frameworks
An undergraduate degree and CPA are required, with an MBA or master’s desired being highly desired.
Strong Microsoft skills, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with Power BI, Business Warehouse, or other data mining tool experience a plus
SAP experience preferred
Strategic thinking and process improvement focused
Strong verbal and written skills
Ability to influence and persuade a plus

Job Title: Principal Business Analyst, Pricing and Contracts – Minneapolis, MN
Job Description:
Careers that Change Lives



Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to support medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.

We believe that when people from different cultures, genders, and points of view come together, innovation is the result —and everyone wins. Medtronic walks the walk, creating an inclusive culture where you can thrive.



A Day in the Life
At Medtronic the Principal Contract Analyst has responsibility for working with the Cardiovascular Enterprise Accounts organization to develop and implement regional and local based contracts that support Medtronic Cardiovascular business strategies and objectives. The primary responsibility will be to work with the Cardiovascular Enterprise Accounts Sr Managing Directors and their direct reports to develop strategies and tactics that support revenue and market share growth in regional IDNs, and to conduct other financial and operational analysis to support contracting strategies as needed.

Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned.

Act as a liaison between the Enterprise Accounts organization and Operating Units to develop and implement regional contract strategies for Integrated Distribution Networks (IDN) that are consistent with the US Market objectives and support the Enterprise Accounts sales strategies.
Provide comprehensive business reviews, enable programs and contracts to drive revenue, monitoring pricing integrity and protecting margin will be key responsibilities.
Execute and monitor negotiated contracts from implementation to expiration to ensure accurate invoicing.
Support Customer Care, Credit Financial Services and other organizations to resolve pricing discrepancies and other related issues.
Support the contracting needs of the Enterprise Accounts assigned region. This includes executing on pricing strategies, strategy development in response to customer pricing requests and complying with the price governance process. Complete hospital requests in a timely manner in accordance with Medtronic pricing strategies, terms, and conditions.
Provide robust and accurate pricing analysis. Negotiate pricing under parameters as set forth by management in conjunction with Sales, Legal and Marketing. Provide rationale behind pricing approvals to help facilitate positive outcomes in pricing discussions.
Support quarterly business review efforts with regional offices and local sales teams as needed. Participate in cross-functional teams to develop strategy and tactics for key business initiatives across different functional areas.

This role is part of a hybrid team based in Medtronic's operation headquarters facility, and all candidates must be able to accommodate a weekly on-site requirement as part of the hybrid schedule.

Must Have: Minimum Requirements

To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume.

Bachelors degree and 7+ years contracts, pricing, sales operations or finance/business analytics

OR

Masters degree and 5+ years contracts, pricing, sales operations or finance/business analytics

Nice to Have

Experience presenting to upper-level management and sales leaders
Confident in driving contracts and pricing strategy and able to influence key stakeholders to help drive negotiations toward a favorable outcome
Demonstrated proficiency with Excel Spreadsheets, Business Objects, and SAP.
Experience creating Excel documents, including spreadsheets, formulas, charts, graphs, and functions.
Additional experience in sales, marketing, purchasing, healthcare or related areas desirable.
Knowledge of contract law.
Ability to work in fast paced environment with high attention to detail.
Strong relationship building, communication and interpersonal skills.
Proven ability to operate in a matrixed marketing environment and work effectively with sales, sales
Proven ability to build and facilitate strong, productive working relationships with a wide variety of cross‐functional teams and customer contacts.
Ability to identify, analyze, and solve problems with minimal direction and make decisions with confidence.



About Medtronic



Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Physical Job Requirements

The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)

A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create. We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage. Learn more about our benefits here .

This position is eligible for a short-term incentive plan. Learn more about Medtronic Incentive Plan (MIP) here .

The base salary range is applicable across the United States, excluding Puerto Rico and specific locations in California. The offered rate complies with federal and local regulations and may vary based on factors such as experience, certification/education, market conditions, and location. Compensation and benefits information pertains solely to candidates hired within the United States (local market compensation and benefits will apply for others).

Description:

This is a hybrid role based out of our Minnetonka, MN office.


ABOUT THE COMPANY

We’ve been building businesses on Amazon for more than 10 years and we continue to be on the forefront as Amazon platforms evolve. We’re uncomfortable calling ourselves experts - since Amazon is always changing, we’re constantly adapting - but the breadth of our knowledge is vast, and our team’s diverse experiences elevate our partners’ businesses. We’re marketers, advocates, data scientists, supply chain managers, Amazonians, advertisers and merchants. But most importantly, we’re brand builders. Let’s build brands together.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The Business Intelligence & Reporting Manager is responsible for managing reporting and business intelligence that support Global Overview in achieving our goals and objectives.

The position leads a variety of projects, maintains a deep knowledge of the various data available to, and reported by, the different data sources and suppliers to Global Operations. The Manager will be responsible for overseeing dashboard development and reports consumed by end users and Global Overviews clients, and is responsible for managing, mentoring, and developing a team of analysts.

You collaborate with leaders across the organization to instill a data first mindset in all that we do, using?an innate understanding of the business to drive success for your team.? You are the consummate player-coach. To be successful in this role, you will strive to be viewed as a partner, advocate, and subject matter expert in how to access and leverage the wealth of data available in our Data Warehouse and available to be accessed.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The position manages a portfolio of projects and maintains a deep knowledge of the various data available to, and consumed by, the different departments within Global Overview
The Manager is responsible for overseeing dashboards and reports consumed by end users, and is responsible for managing, mentoring, and developing a team of analysts
Drives the ongoing maintenance and development of effective tools and reporting to ensure timely and actionable information to be available across the organization
Including development of new repeatable, automated reporting out of persistent sources as well as ad-hoc analyses by regularly reviewing and monitoring the efficacy of existing reports and dashboards
Identify and explore new ways to convey meaningful information with Global Overview team members and clients, including data visualizations
Develop and solidify an understanding of the operations of the functional groups within the company, and collaborating with individuals in those functions to maximize the utilization of reporting
Be proactive in exploring new concepts to bring forward for discussion or consideration is critical to the ongoing continuous improvement of data analytics within GO
Monitor internal department activities, as well as coordinate with stakeholders from various departments, to support the use of data and maintain effective understanding
Includes the assessment of requests for information, as well as continuously managing available reporting and tools by being an active leader in the Agile Sprint processes
Projects will include the improvement of existing reporting processes, as well as the effective implementation of alternative tools, processes, and data assessment
Manage, train, and develop a team of analysts who support Global Overview and maintain the Business Intelligence offering to the organization
Perform other duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS

Must have 7+ years of work experience, preferably in a reporting or analyst role
Minimum 2+ years leading others in the delivery of Business Intelligence and Reporting, either in a consulting or supervisory capacity
Experience in similar industries such as agency, retail, fintech or consumer analytics industry a plus
Bachelor's degree, preferably in business/analytical discipline
Certifications related to Tableau, Python, SQL, AWS or other data visualization tools a plus
Clear and professional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent organization and time-management skills
Proficiency with SQL, Excel ODBC, Microsoft Office Suite, Tableau and other analytical tools
Capable of managing competing priorities within a dynamic business environment
Proactive and eager to take on additional responsibilities based on needs of the organization
Deep understanding of agile methodologies and approaches, willing to think dynamically and move forward with ease
A passion for customer experience, business focus and the ability to negotiate, facilitate and build consensus
Ability to promote a strong teaming and collaboration, motivating and coaching team members and peers at different stages in their software and analytics career

Sponsorship is unavailable for this role.

Requirements:

Qualifications

7+ years of work experience, preferably in a reporting or analyst role
Minimum 2+ years leading others in the delivery of Business Intelligence and Reporting, either in a consulting or supervisory capacity
Experience in similar industries such as agency, retail, fintech or consumer analytics industry a plus
Bachelor's degree, preferably in business/analytical discipline

Trimble Transportation is transforming how carriers, shippers and brokers operate across the transportation supply chain continuum. As the leading provider of Transportation Management Software (TMS), Asset Management Software (AMS), and Fleet Management Software (FMS) we are devoted to propelling companies in the trucking industry toward increased efficiency, improved productivity, and optimized and sustainable operations.

The Transportation Mobility business, a division of Trimble Transportation, is a provider of telematics, workflow, navigation, video intelligence and compliance technology that enables commercial transportation fleets to operate efficiently, safely and per federal regulations by reducing costs, increasing uptime, improving driver experience and providing visibility into fleet operations.



Position Overview

The “Product Owner (PO) - Telematics Applications” position rolls up to the Transportation Mobility Foundations product line, a fundamental area in the business that empowers all downstream fleet management solutions by supplying essential, rich field telematics data.

This role will be centered explicitly around Mobility’s vision to shape the Transportation Industry’s evolution to Electrical and Autonomous Vehicles, while strengthening its current partnerships with the largest OEMs. The selected candidate will be responsible for the entire lifecycle and delivery of Mobility’s Telematics suite of applications; is comfortable and fluent in a highly technical environment; and is passionate about building a solid foundation of applications that peer product lines can leverage and depend on.



Responsibilities:

Conduit between business, product & technical teams
Collaborate with Engineering and Product colleagues to align on future product enhancements in forming a roadmap.
Engage with customers, customer experience, peer product teams, user experience researchers, and other subject matter experts to understand workflows, feature gaps, dependencies and extrapolate technical requirements.
Translate the “why” and the “what” to Engineering teams, and assist in the “how”
Lead the breakdown of large solution requirements into an executable technical backlog.
Refine requirements with the team and inspect, accept, or reject completed work from the sprint
Make tough calls on scope and content within the delivery cycle.
Responsible for the health and prioritization of the product backlog based on priorities, events and dependencies with other teams.
Conduct external and internal customer acceptance testing.
Communicate priority and delivery goals to ensure alignment with Leadership.
Communicate work in progress and upcoming work to key stakeholders
Coordinate with other Product Owners, delivery teams, and shared services to ensure success.
Support and train other Trimble staff on product use and technical product details.
Create product training content, including videos and demonstration tools.
Leads Agile / Scrum ceremonies
Work with appropriate stakeholders to ensure cross-functional teams are aligned and prepared for product release.
Support and generate product launch materials as necessary.
Participate in industry trade associations, technical working groups, seminars, etc.

Required Skills:
