Responsibilities:
The Salesforce Business Systems Analyst is responsible for the facilitation and support of the Salesforce application solution to meet the needs of the business. The Business Systems Analyst will act as liaison between end-users and technical team members to ensure application solutions meet business needs. This position will facilitate and lead requirements definition and analysis, system design, testing, training, documentation and implementation of new solutions, release cycles and application changes. The Business Systems Analyst will manage application projects from concept phase through implementation.
Demonstrate strong leadership, collaboration, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Positively challenge ideas, requests and needs to ensure business value is delivered.
Work in a complex, high speed environment in search of desirable results under conditions of high uncertainty and high change.
Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for improvements to new, changed or failing functionality.
Assist with the prioritization, planning, designing, and implementation of new functionality.
Facilitate and communicate project deliverables to the requesting user and technical staff to assure an accurate and timely design, test, and implementation.
Create functional and technical specifications to ensure accurate development of desired capabilities.
Develop, document and retain a repository of business rules and process flows.
Create system documentation, test scripts and end-user training material.
Create and present reports to leadership team members to support recommendations using a variety of data analysis and organizational tools to uncover insights.
Participate in user acceptance testing to validate applications function according to specifications.
Assist in the ongoing cleansing of data with the support of data owners and custodians.
Assist in transforming data into needed formats for data loads (ETL).
Demonstrate exceptional written and verbal communication skills, presentation and facilitation skills and the ability to communicate at all levels of the organization
Provide Operational Support of Salesforce platform
Qualifications:
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in technical field or 6 years of related work experience that includes analyst experience performing requirements elicitation, analysis, documentation and design in a highly integrated environment.
3 years of experience as a business analyst
Project Management and SDLC methodology (e.g. Iterative, Waterfall, Agile) principles.
3 years related experience in requirements analysis: data mapping and data analysis, value stream mapping, business process management, systems requirements elicitation, use case modelling, data flow diagraming, business rules analysis, business capability mapping.
Experience with Sales, Service Cloud, and Communities cloud. Lightning experience is a plus.
Preferred Qualifications
Salesforce Certification: Administration, App Builder, Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant, Pardot Specialist

Tools: Power Designer, Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint).
Min: USD $81,111.00/Yr. Max: USD $114,510.00/Yr. Overview:
The Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation is the largest nonprofit addiction recovery organization in the United States. It is also one of the most mission-driven places you will find. The Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation team is passionate about providing hope and ultimately healing. As a living, growing and evolving institution, the Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation is – at our core- a people-powered organization. Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation is comprised of 1600+ employees, seventeen treatment sites and produces $190 million dollars in annual revenue. This exemplary organization serves nearly 25,000 people annually and is committed to provide hope and healing for those experiencing addiction to alcohol and other drugs.

What makes this organization unique is its total ecosystem approach to prevention, education, research, advocacy and treatment. All of the parts of the organization work together to inform, develop and deliver evidence- based practices that help people reclaim their futures and restore their hope.

Being “a best place to work” is a strategic goal of Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation and it’s a goal that every employee plays an active role in helping to achieve. Our culture is a reflection of how encouraged and energized we each feel about contributing our ideas and performing to our greatest ability. Join us and do meaningful work.

We deeply value our employees. Working at Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation includes a comprehensive benefits package, including:
Competitive Health, Dental and Vision Plans
Retirement savings plan with employer match
Paid time-off
Tuition reimbursement

The Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We believe that diversity and inclusion among our colleagues is critical to our success as a force of healing and hope for individuals, families and communities affected by addiction to alcohol and other drugs; and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

Job Title: Configuration & Claims Operations Optimization Analyst Sr.
Job Description:
As the Configuration and Claims Operations (CCO) Optimization Analyst Senior, you will be responsible to support CCO with business transformation efforts by assessing CCO’s current business operations and developing recommendations and strategies to improve the efficiency and customer experience. Partner collaboratively across the organization to help improve critical end-to-end processes that need improvement. Ensure decisions and/or recommendations are communicated timely to stakeholders. Work alongside business and technical teams to increase collaboration and optimize productivity and communication. Ensure requirements and solutions conform to departmental, corporate, industry and government standards as specified.

Collaborate with Business Sponsors, Business Owners, Project Team Members, Vendors, and Subject Matter Experts to understand the business problem and needs. Gather and document requirements as well as translate these requirements into high quality solutions.


Responsible to identify and implement business and operational processes to improve efficiencies, reduce cost and increase customer satisfaction.


Make recommendations to CCO leadership about ongoing improvements to departmental processes, policies, and procedures to increase quality and to ensure the insurance operations and transactional process meet UCare and customer expectations.


Participate in formal and informal project teams and lead inter-departmental initiatives as assigned.


Lead Communication across CCO business teams, while also ensuring other internal stakeholders are informed of changes that will impact their business. Coordinate with change management resources to ensure a successful roll out of new and/or improved processes.


Other projects or duties as assigned.

Education

Bachelor’s degree; demonstrated work experience may be considered in lieu of degree.

Required Experience

At least five years of experience in a managed care organization or other health insurance environment, with at least three of those years in a Health Care Claims Operations role and with HealthRules system experience. At least two years of business analysis experience that included successful requirements documentation. Knowledge of commercial, Medicare and state program products and services. Intermediate to advanced Excel skills and proficiency with using all programs in the Microsoft Office Suite. Process improvement experience.

Preferred Experience

Experience working with claims, provider service, configuration or related operational functions. Business process management or improvement experience. Understanding of claims and other operational data sets.

THE UCARE DIFFERENCE

The UCare difference is our people power – employees actively working on the behalf of our members to get them access to the health care they need. We value and respect each individual's ideas and contributions, and provide the freedom to grow both personally and professionally. We are centrally located, and offer onsite education, equipment and wellness resources, and a myriad of volunteer activities. If you're looking for an inclusive environment that celebrates your people power, helps you build on your strengths and gives you the opportunity to truly make a difference, we invite you to apply.

As an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, we welcome and employ a diverse employee group committed to meeting the needs of UCare, our members, and the communities we serve.

JOB POST DATE: 11/13/2023

Job Title: IT Data Analytics Product Owner and Business Analyst
Job Description:
Overview:
Cretex Summary
Cretex is a diversified family of manufacturing companies serving the medical contract manufacturing market. For over a century, Cretex Companies has been expanding to new industries, investing in innovative technologies, making strategic business acquisitions, and cultivating our team. Our strong financial position and long-term perspective enables us to better serve our customers in the manufacturing and engineering services now and for years to come. We're excited to have you join our team!
Responsibilities:

Position summary

As the Data/Analytics Product Owner / Business Analyst, you will shape the strategic vision of our data products and ensure that this vision is implemented effectively. This hybrid role will require you to understand business needs, analyze and interpret data, and use these insights to drive decision-making. You'll collaborate with stakeholders, data analysts, and data engineers to develop a roadmap and deliver successful outcomes.




Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand business processes, identify opportunities for leveraging company data, and drive business solutions.
Perform business analysis to identify data requirements and ensure that they align with the business strategy and objectives.
Define and prioritize the product backlog items, balancing the requirements of stakeholders with the resources of the development team.
Drive the planning, execution, and delivery of data-focused projects, ensuring that the team is working on the highest-priority items.
Develop user stories and acceptance criteria to clearly communicate the business needs to the data team.
Monitor the effectiveness of data products post-implementation and use feedback to inform future improvements.
Work closely with the Scrum Master and data team to ensure user stories are clear and the team is ready to execute them.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Business, Data Analytics).
Prior experience in a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or similar role, with a focus on data or analytics.
Experience with Agile methodologies and tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to think outside the box.
Excellent leadership, communication, and teamwork skills.
Strong data literacy — ability to understand and use data to make decisions.
Desirable Qualifications
Prior experience in manufacturing is a plus.
Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) certification.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools like Tableau or PowerBI.
Applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, family status, status with regard to public assistance, or any other protected status as required by law.

At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

Responsible for performing client presentations, product training, product demonstrations, facilitating special handling needs, client education, and working with the Foreign Exchange (FX) Sales team to address needs. Develops unique presentations alongside FX Sales to promote bank products and improve client-bank relationship. Provides support to all FX Operations Servicing Teams and assists with project planning, support, and implementation. Makes decisions on the spot and aids in the sale of bank products. Performs research, analysis, and review of data to make informed decisions on products and to respond to client inquiries.


Defines and performs internal and external training strategies for the bank’s Foreign Exchange E-Commerce platform to improve workflow and operating efficiency. Makes recommendations to standardize procedures and processes. Makes recommendations to introduce new technology or improve existing technology. May identify areas of inconsistencies and work with business partners to solve issues.


Builds and maintains effective working relationships with key internal and external partners. Learns multiple roles in FX and serves as a subject matter expert to the department. Analyzes current costs and estimates the cost or cost savings. Acts as a project lead or liaison between departments and may coordinate and direct a team of project staff.


Handles clients complaints and issues technology service alerts. Performs client onboarding tasks, maintains internal and client-facing documentation, and strategizes and distributes mass client communication.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent work experience
Four or more years of related experience

Preferred Skills/Experience

Thorough knowledge of policies, plans, procedures, products and regulatory requirements for assigned business unit
Ability to conduct an analysis of a business need, including scheduling meetings, planning agendas and conferring with business line leaders
Good understanding of project management and testing methodology and procedures
Ability to develop test schedules, review testing plans, track test issues and report on test results
Strong analytical and forecasting skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously
Ability to work as part of a project team
Effective verbal and written presentation and communication skills
Proficient computer navigation skills using a variety of software packages including Microsoft Office applications

If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.


Benefits:

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):

Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)

Basic term and optional term life insurance

Short-term and long-term disability

Pregnancy disability and parental leave

401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan

Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)

Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities

Adoption assistance

Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law

EEO is the Law

U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

E-Verify

Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.

The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.

Join the 2,500+ professionals of Minnesota IT Services (MNIT) who connect Minnesotans to services that will improve their lives. This position serves our partners at the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH). The MNIT MDH team provides services for over 250+ applications and delivers the information technology to drive one of the leading public health systems in the nation. You will support an agency that works to protect, maintain, and improve the health of all Minnesotans.

Job Summary



As a Division Application Supervisor at Minnesota IT Services (MNIT) you will supervise and oversee the planning, design, development, implementation, integration, and maintenance of advanced applications and information technology systems for assigned Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) division. In coordination with MNIT leadership, division leadership, and MDH and MNIT program managers, you will establish IT goals, objectives, strategies, and timelines. You will serve as the IT management lead for Division and will be responsible for a broad range of technical, administrative, planning, and support functions.

You will provide advanced professional supervision and oversight to MNIT MDH staff and ensures that division interests and needs are represented in larger IT planning and service delivery activities.

This position is currently eligible for full-time telework:

Telework for Minnesota IT Services allows an employee to perform work from a telework location and an employee may be required to be in the office based on business needs and other dependencies in St. Paul, Minnesota.
Only candidates located in Minnesota and bordering states (Iowa, North Dakota, South Dakota, or Wisconsin) are telework eligible.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must clearly demonstrate these qualifications in their resume:

Position requires a minimum of three (3) years of experience in a complex and large IT application management and support role.

Experience must include the following:

Working closely with management teams, architects, and technical leads to set the technical and architectural direction for the team.
Development and quality best practices and their application within various software development life cycle methodologies (e.g., Agile).
Ability to deliver effective verbal or written messages that facilitate a mutual understanding on both parties.
Customer service skills that include active listening, empathy, and problem-solving.
Preferred Qualifications
Application development principles, including frameworks, and modern programming languages.
Ability to present complex concepts to non-technical people. Strong technology (development and quality) mindset.
Lead work or supervisory experience.
Experience with Project Management (PM) methodologies, including traditional and Agile approaches.
Cybersecurity as an information technology discipline
Formal business analysis (BA) processes experience, including requirements analysis, workflow analysis, and data modeling.
Thorough knowledge of principles of application development, including frameworks, modern languages, and forward-looking approaches such as server-less techniques
Knowledge of principles of cloud computing and the opportunities afforded by this type of infrastructure.
Additional Requirements

Other legally required checks

Minnesota IT Services is the information technology agency for the State of Minnesota. MNIT partners with agencies, boards, councils, and commissions to deliver secure, reliable technology solutions as we set IT strategy, direction, policies, and standards statewide. Work for MNIT and be part of a nation-leading IT organization that helps to create an innovative government that works for everyone. Our culture promotes collaboration, demands agility, and encourages us to embrace change. Be a part of something bigger than yourself, something to be inspired by; come to work for MNIT.

We are committed to continually developing a workforce that reflects the diversity of our state and the populations we serve. The varied experiences and perspectives of employees strengthen the work we do together and our ability to best serve the people of Minnesota.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

We will make reasonable accommodations to all qualified applicants with disabilities. Influences and supports business improvement efforts on core business process variable in size to deploy solutions for short (quick wins), medium (process changes), and long-term (organizational transformation) across departments to ensure consistent, and efficient operations.
This individual will be responsible for the facilitation of process design workshops/sessions with various (Business Process) CBP stakeholders, identifying risk and process gaps, potential process enhancements, and/or inefficiencies.
Partners with process owners to drive critical process improvements and automation in functional areas. Including assessment of pain points, gaps and interdependencies, and design and implementation of future state.
Supports in defining the business case for each initiative with input from stakeholders by identifying and gaining agreement on project objectives, scope, timing, resources and return on investment.

Advanced understanding of Lean and Six Sigma methodologies is preferred.

And more!

Thank you for your interest in becoming part of the team at Legrand!
GENERAL PURPOSE
The eCommerce Sales Analyst plays an important role in supporting all online sales initiatives for the Sanus and Echogear brands by analyzing sales and advertising KPIs across the eCommerce sales channels. This is an integral role working with both eCommerce 3P/marketplace teams and North America retail account management teams to drive market share growth in an exciting and evolving industry.
DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES
Analyze and inform a proactive strategy based on data for expanding Legrand Audio Video Division’s online presence across marketplaces such as Amazon and Walmart.com as well as retail.coms.
Analyze and report on traffic, advertising, competitive activities, product performance, etc.
Support the execution of online marketing plans and initiatives for consumer and trade audiences (including site optimization and SEM efforts).
Responsible for analysis across sales, advertising, and competition in key retail.com channels (Best Buy, Walmart, Costco, Target, and more).
Collaborate with retail account management and Sanus marketing teams to grow share via SEO, advertising, conversion, and new product launches.
Engage with our retail customers’ advertising teams to learn new methods, optimize performance, and strengthen our partnerships.
Provide project management support for ongoing activities including, web updates, online promotions, retail.com efforts, etc.
Develop sales forecasts in conjunction with Demand Planning and Logistics to ensure inventory stays in stock at 3rd party distribution centers.
Be the eCommerce expert for online analytics tools for advertising, trends, and best practices.
Assist with monitoring online reputation of multiple brands across multiple 3rd party marketplaces.
Understand workplace hazards and take steps to proactively prevent and report hazards or injuries in the workplace. Cooperate in safety programs, initiatives, and investigations.
Demonstrate our five core values of Integrity, Customer Responsiveness, Innovation, Passionate Contribution & Empowerment and Continuous Improvement
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Essential Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Strong organizational, analytical and project management skills
Proficient in the use of personal computers, internet and MS Office suite of software including Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook (or related e-mail system)
Familiarity with social media sites
Ability to work in a team environment, and leverage additional resources as needed
Follow-up and influential skills to gain support and inspire others
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy environment
Ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external parties
Minimum Education and Experience Required:
Bachelor’s degree required. Degree focus in marketing, advertising, business, or related field preferred
Minimum 3 years’ experience in online consumer sales/marketing
Minimum 3 years’ experience with paid search, affiliate, SEO, and/or affiliate marketing preferred.
Minimum 3 years’ experience with Amazon Seller Central, eCommerce, extracting and reporting data all a plus.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Retailer Vendor Portals and Systems
Strong PC skills (Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.)
Experience/passionate for the consumer electronics industry is a plus
WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required (for the majority of the working day) to sit and make coordinated movements of the fingers for data entry on a keyboard.
Ability to occasionally lift 30 lbs
Comfortable with use of general tools and power tools
General office environment
May require regular ground travel to other company facilities
Long-distance or air travel as needed – not to exceed 10% travel

es

Job Title: Business Execution Consultant - Power BI Specialist
Job Description:
#HRJOBS

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking an infrastructure support Business Execution Consultant to join the Learning & Development (L&D) Business Execution Team. This team provides infrastructure and workflow support to the L&D department. This role specializes in using data analytics and Power BI to enable faster decision making through data.

In this role, you will:
Using Power BI to develop solutions using analytical, critical thinking, and creative design skills to enable end users to understand complex data and make faster decisions.

Position Objective:
Provide management with an accurate forecast that can be used to drive financial statements and determine sourcing/production requirements. Responsibilities:


Manage the Home Finishing sales forecasting process to include monthly forecast meetings with the respective Account Managers, forecast recap, and weekly point of sale reporting. Communicate forecast changes to procurement to ensure inventory availability to meet our customer’s level of service expectations and escalate significant forecast deviations to management.
Assist Account Managers in executing business objectives, help develop sales presentations based on point-of-sale results, and leverage opportunities to standardize reporting across the retail channel. Provide ad hoc reports to Account Managers and Leadership as required.
Collaborate with procurement to improve inventory management for Home Finishing through forecast accuracy and proactively communicate with Account Managers regarding inventory issues, forecast issues, promotions, and special orders. Ensures data transmissions from internal and external sources are accurate and occur as scheduled each week. Partners with retailers and outside vendors to identify and troubleshoot data issues and seeks to automate these processes where possible.
Other duties as assigned.

Occasional communication directly with customers and vendors

Sunrise Banks, based in Minneapolis/St. Paul, MN, is the digital financial inclusion leader. POSITION SUMMARY

As the ESG Analyst of a mission-driven bank, you will assist with ensuring compliance and accuracy with various reporting requirements. This reporting includes Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials (PCAF), B Corp Certification renewal, Community Development Financial Institution compliance, Financial and Technical assistance awards, among others. Sunrise Banks is a CDFI, Certified B Corp, Public Benefit Corporation, and is a member of the Global Alliance for Banking on Values. This position will initially focus on PCAF reporting, so a passion for environmental sustainability is a must. Local candidates preferred. Experience with HMDA or CRA experience a plus.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Maintain and enhance ESG reporting process to ensure complete and timely Bank compliance with its ESG reporting requirements.
Work on a cross-functional team to monitor new ESG reporting requirements for the Bank.
Respond to internal and external requests relative to the Bank’s ESG disclosures.
Communicate ESG reporting requirements and coordinate with various areas across the Bank.
Annual reporting and annual tracking of carbon emissions of loan portfolio
Coordination of data and reporting with creative team to produce annual reports.
Coordinate with various departments to accurately complete tri-annual B Corp Certification
Assist with ensuring accurate reporting for other impact-related reports, including CDFI, BEA, and ECIP
Assist manager and CRA Officer with review of volunteer activity and determination qualification and impact for CDFI and Community Reinvestment Act.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

None

COMPETENCIES

Alignment w/Sunrise Core Values
Adaptability
Communication
Compliance
Dependability & Flexibility
Initiative
Integrity
Judgement
Organizational Skills
Productivity
Professionalism
Quality Service
Teamwork
Technical /PC Skills
Work Quality

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

4 Year college degree BA/BS with emphasis in finance, business, economics, accounting, or sustainability related field preferred.
Minimum 3 years’ experience required as business analyst or financial analyst related roles.
Experience in the banking industry preferred.
Superior skill set in the use of the following software applications: Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, and Outlook.
A comprehensive skill set in data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Experience and/or familiarity with greenhouse gas emissions and other ESG-related reporting requirements is also a plus.

Job Title: IT Applications Analyst, Senior - Sales and Aftermarket
Job Description:
IT Applications Analyst, Senior - Sales and Aftermarket

Description

We are looking for a talented IT Applications Analyst, Senior - Sales and Aftermarket to join our team specializing in systems/information technology for our Power Systems Business Segment in Minneapolis, MN

In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:

Provides comprehensive application functionality, configuration and support expertise for application software solutions; works with business analysts, architects, technical experts and software vendors on the solution requirements, design, configuration, functionality gap resolution, implementation, support, maintenance and enhancement of the applications.
Analyzes and evaluates application functionality and provides recommendations to increase utilization of standard application functionality to improve business processes and capabilities.
Determines and documents optimum application setup and configuration to meet functional requirements and specifications; configures and verifies application setup and configuration

Develops expertise in emerging application and solution trends and functionality; provides functional recommendations for assigned applications and systems.

Conducts analysis of potential application solutions, identifies and recommends solutions to address functionality gaps in the application.
Develops and maintains strong relationships with relevant vendors; works with vendors to improve application functionality and resolve functionality issues.
Partners with process owners, business analysts, systems analysts and architects to gather, document and review functional, architecture and technical requirements and define application functional designs.
Serves as subject matter expert and point of contact on content, processes, procedures and functionality associated with assigned applications for projects and application support (as needed).
Creates and manages functional specifications for a given project from which programs and configurations will be applied to create the program, application, or complete solution

Qualifications

To be successful in this role you will need the following:

Skills

Solution Design - Creates and defines the solution design complete with instrumentation and measurement, using industry standards and tools, version control, and build and test automation to synthesize diagrams, models and documentation in order to build a solution that meets buildability, business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.
Solution Functional Fit Analysis - Composes and decomposes a system into its component parts using procedures, tools and work aides for the purpose of studying how well the component parts were designed, purchased and configured to interact holistically to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.
Solution Modeling - Creates, designs and formulates models, diagrams and documentation using industry standards, tools, version control, and build and test automation to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.
Solution Configuration - Configures, creates and tests a solution for commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) applications using industry standards and tools, version control, and build and test automation to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.
Solution Validation Testing - Validates a configuration item change or solution using the Function's defined best practices, including the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) standards, tools and metrics, to ensure that it works as designed and meets customer requirements.
Business insight - Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization’s goals.
Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
Tech savvy - Anticipating and adopting innovations in business-building digital and technology applications.
Manages complexity - Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.
Global perspective - Taking a broad view when approaching issues, using a global lens.
Optimizes work processes - Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.
12Manages conflict - Handling conflict situations effectively, with a minimum of noise.

Education, Licenses, Certifications

College, university, or equivalent degree in Information Technology, Business or a related subject required.
This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations.

Experience

Intermediate level of relevant work experience required. 3-5 years of experience.
Ability to partner with test services team at Cummins to drive the PSBU IT Sales team test strategy; define and facilitate test planning and execution.
Team and/or testing leadership.
Share process knowledge with internal and external team members through communication mechanisms defined in a communication plan, with consideration for the audience.
Self-starter with the ability perform deep-dive analysis and articulate recommendations and risks; illustrates/articulates effectively with graph, Visio, PowerPoint etc. Provide/prepared leadership updates.
Dev Ops experience desired.
Ideal candidate would be familiar with Project Management, Continuous Improvement and 6Sigma.
Agile development knowledge/experience desired. Ideal candidate will have experience with Jira, Q-test and test automation.
Salesforce/Salesforce CPQ experience ideal.

Compensation and Benefits

Base salary rate commensurate with experience. Additional benefits vary between locations and include options such as our 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, Cash Balance Pension Plan, Medical/Dental/Life Insurance, Health Savings Account, Domestic Partners Coverage and a full complement of personal and professional benefits.

Cummins and E-verify

At Cummins, we are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law. Cummins validates right to work using E-Verify. Cummins will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.

Job description



· Client currently has 23 Access applications that are used to track various aspects of client’s business. These applications range in functionality from simple to quite complex, and many are critical to business functions.



· There are also numerous manual paper processes associated with these Access applications. The focus of the Access Modernization project is to replace obsolete and unmaintainable Access applications that no longer meet business needs with modern solutions that meet business needs and are streamlined, efficient, and secure. This will include the automation of manual processes associated with the applications where possible.



· The Solution Architect resource will assess the 23 Access applications (including high-level business requirements, data flows, and any related manual processes) and provide recommendations as to replacement with off the shelf software, replacement with custom-built application, or leaving as is.



· Interview end users of Client Access applications to define and document:



· High level business requirements for each application.



· Data flows in and out of each application.



· Manual processes associated with each application.



· Make recommendations on whether each existing application should be replaced by off the shelf software, be replaced by a custom-built application, or stay “as is”, in order to meet business needs.



· For each application where replacement with off the shelf software is recommended, identify software option(s) including product name(s), estimated costs, estimated time to implement, and pros/cons of each option if there are multiple options. Where multiple off the shelf software options are identified, provide recommendation as to which option should be chosen.



· Present findings in writing and verbally to the project team as research/recommendation for each application is completed.



· Provide knowledge transfer to client staff.



· Perform other related duties as requested by the client.






Minimum Qualifications



· Five (5) years’ experience defining high level requirements



· Five (5) years’ experience defining business needs



· Five (5) years’ experience defining data flows






Desired Qualifications



· Experience with project(s) where software selection was the end product



· Experience with software selection project(s) for a government agency



· Experience with Access or other legacy applications



· Experience with modernization project(s)



· Experience with business analysis

Job Title: Senior Analyst - Compensation/Business Analytics, Peripheral Interventions
Job Description:
Senior Analyst - Compensation/Business Analytics, Peripheral Interventions

Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance

At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.

About this Role

As a Senior Analyst – Compensation/Business Analytics you will play a key role in helping build, optimize, and scale critical sales compensation process and tools. We are seeking someone who is highly motivated and analytical to join our Commercial Operations & Strategy team in our growing Peripheral Interventions division, which leads the market in less-invasive treatments for peripheral vascular disease and cancer. This role is an integral part of the business team administering sales incentive compensation and territorial sales quotas within the high impact, fast-paced selling organization.




Key Responsibilities

Partner closely with divisional compensation team to build/optimize Anaplan solutions to support business needs
Support existing Anaplan models and continually improve, add new capabilities, and provide error resolution on current models
Perform performance and compensation analytics
Become an expert on data sources, ensuring data accuracy when using them
Follow/construct compensation related details at the granular level with the ability to communicate at a high-level
Work closely with the divisional compensation team and commit to delivering results under tight deadlines
Demonstrate team-first mindset while leveraging individual skills/ability to work independently
Develop skills with business intelligence applications such as Anaplan, Tableau, Alteryx, SAP BusinessObjects
Identify opportunities for process improvements and establish effective and efficient processes
Participate in special projects as they arise

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or STEM
Strong math skills with the ability to solve complex problems using a logic-based approach
Curious mindset and takes an active interest in data accuracy
Excellent strategic thinking capabilities with ability to synthesize large amounts of information and logically structure deliverables
Can-do attitude with attention to detail and oriented to precision, accuracy, continuous learning and development
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
Ability to work both independently and on a team in a fast-paced matrix environment, prioritize own work, and adhere to tight deadlines
Holds self accountable to a performance culture building performance excellence
Advanced Excel user who is comfortable with pivot tables, vlookups and building formulas

Other Preferred Qualifications

4+ years of Commercial Operations, Accounting, Finance or analytical work experience
Previous experience with incentive compensation or with a hierarchy-based system
Proven track record of high performance, innovative approaches to quantitative analysis, and ability to multi-task
Experience with SQL, PowerBI, Salesforce, Anaplan, Tableau, AlignMix, or Alteryx

Job Title: Mgr- Franchise Performance - Washington D.C/ Minneapolis, MN
Job Description:
We are Subway Headquarters! A dedicated team of professionals supporting thousands of franchisees around the globe.

Hungry for a fresh, new career? Look no further because one of the world’s most iconic brands can help you get there.
We are looking for Manager, Franchise Performance to support one of the following territories: Washington, DC / Minneapolis, MN / Salt Lake City, UT

**This role will travel overnight fulltime in the early stages and will transition into less travel after a determined amount of time.**

The Manager, Franchise Performance will provide strategic business direction and alignment in order to influence Subway franchise owners in maximizing profitability of their portfolio and help to align store operating procedures to Subway's brand standards. This role will communicate the expected performance level of the locations and franchisees within their assigned area in relation to the company's KPIs and metrics. They will implement business growth by identifying potential operational opportunities for improvement and provide training to strengthen locations.

Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Provide operational and food safety guidance and education during restaurant visits: Consistently evaluate SUBWAY restaurants using the PBE model on quarterly basis.
Document adherence to Company compliance standards, improvements made, areas of opportunity and direction on how to improve, if needed during coaching sessions.
Evaluate how the restaurant is performing compared to SUBWAY policies and procedures, analyze sales and cost data and provide specific customized direction to improve in these areas.
Review franchisees portfolio and have regularly scheduled business reviews to see growth potential and areas of opportunity.
Coach and counsel franchisees to reach individual store and territory goals.
Provide guidance to franchisees to grow their business both within the local community in store and though online sales and delivery.
Build Territory Relations by visiting all assigned restaurants at least quarterly depending on performance level, communicating with franchisees via voicemail, e-mail, territory meetings, individual franchise meetings and written communications.
Gains respect from franchisees to be recognized as an asset to the business and leader in the field.
Assist Territory Director and shared services team with site reviews by conducting three day parts of customer intercepts for all reviews within assigned area
Provide direction and proficiency to franchisees and staff with regard to New Store Openings & Transfer Training Hours
The successful candidate will have:

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Communications, Business Analysis or related field preferred.
3+ years of restaurant experience preferred.
The ability to learn technology initiatives and cascade this knowledge to others.
Excellent written and verbal communication,
Ability to problem solve and business analysis skills.
High degree of detail orientation and ability to work within a team, hands on approach during in restaurant visits.
Must also be able to work autonomously and be professional.
AA/EOE/M/F/D/V

The Company is only considering applicants who are currently authorized to work in the country the position is based. AA/EOE/M/F/D/V

Business Unit Overview:
Headquartered in Lakeville, Minn., Post Consumer Brands, a business unit of Post Holdings, Inc., is dedicated to providing people and their pets with delicious food choices for every taste and budget. The company’s portfolio includes beloved brands such as Honey Bunches of Oats®, PEBBLES®, Grape-Nuts® and Malt-O-Meal® cereal, and Peter Pan® peanut butter, as well as Rachael Ray® Nutrish®, Kibbles ‘n Bits® and 9Lives® dog and cat food. As a company committed to high standards of quality and to our values, we are driven by one idea: To make lives better by making delicious food accessible for all. For more information about our brands, visit www.postconsumerbrands.com and follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news.
Brand:
Post Consumer Brands recently acquired several iconic pet food brands, venturing into a new market while remaining true to our purpose to provide delicious and accessible food that our consumers love. We’re always searching the center store for the next exciting product to add to our portfolio, and right now, we’re growing and need passionate, driven individuals with diverse perspectives to help us reach greater heights. Headquartered in Lakeville, Minn., Post Consumer Brands, a business unit of Post Holdings, Inc., is dedicated to providing people and their pets with delicious food choices for every taste and budget. The company’s portfolio includes beloved brands such as Honey Bunches of Oats®, PEBBLES®, Grape-Nuts® and Malt-O-Meal® cereal, and Peter Pan® peanut butter, as well as Rachael Ray® Nutrish®, Kibbles ‘n Bits® and 9Lives® dog and cat food. Responsibilities:
The Senior Financial Analyst will be a strategic partner supporting the Operations Business Managers and work closely with the following functional departments Demand/Supply Planning, Procurement, and the Supply Chain Operations to analytically identify opportunities across our network. This role is responsible for developing financial scenarios and recommendations with the primary goal of improving total delivered costs.

Responsibilities Include:
Support the Operations Business Managers by providing data driven opportunities. This includes:
Gathering and validating cost inputs, including raw materials, labor, warehousing, and transportation.
Developing tools to identify areas of opportunity that drive improvements in total delivered cost.
Presenting scenarios and recommendations to leadership.
Support monthly forecasting process by verifying accuracy of inputs, monitoring forecast accuracy, and improving methodology when necessary.
Prepare monthly financial results including, variances to forecasts, key metric trends, and highlighting opportunities.
Assess capacity to ensure optimal network design for the next 4-18 month time horizon.
Support the holistic financial impact of new products, line extensions, and quality improvements.
Develop best practices related to the commercialization process that drive efficiency.
Assist with development of long-range plans by technology.
Actively participate in monthly business review meetings with your cross-functional partners.
Work with team members to share insights and continuously improve processes, reporting, and enhanced decision making.
Develop and maintain strong relationships at all levels of the organization in order to provide meaningful and timely insights and guidance.

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Statistics, Data Analytics, or Economics preferred.

Experience:
Minimum five years of job experience in a role where analytical skills were applied.
Financial scenario modeling with large data sets.
Preferred prior CPG background and experience.

Skills:
Strong financial and analytical skills.
Strong understanding of manufacturing and supply chain cost inputs.
Ability to think critically, draw conclusions from information and develop recommendations.
Must be able to effectively interact, collaborate and communicate across multiple functions in the organization, cooperating and building consensus to drive results.

Ability to work through ambiguity, take initiative, and navigate challenges.
Ability to influence business decisions with financial support.
Ability to plan, prioritize, and manage workload in an environment of competing priorities.
Must be organized, thorough, and accurate.
Computer skills: MS Office with advanced Excel knowledge; TM1 experience a plus.

Job Title: Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Analyst Senior
Job Description:
As the Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Analyst Senior, you will be responsible for managing and coordinating the Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery program components. Lead analysis and execution of organization-wide efforts to develop policies, risk mitigation strategies, identify priorities, and ensure implementation of action plans. Provide technical leadership and business resource for business continuation and disaster recovery programs. Responsible for leveraging knowledge and experience to deliver end-to-end solutions for our business continuation and disaster recovery program, which includes collaborating on technical solutions for IT and business process solutions, organizing and prioritizing development effort, interfacing with vendors and management, and coordinating the efforts with IT teams and business teams.

Lead cross-functional effort to develop and oversee business continuation and disaster recovery strategy and priorities, policies and project plans.


Manage Business Continuity Plan for UCare including: documentation, coordination and project management. Update and maintain BCP and DR plans at least annually and when significant updates to business or infrastructure occur.


Collaborate with UCare department leaders to develop and maintain written business continuation plans, provide training on plans and coordinate business continuation tabletop exercises. Ensure business continuation plans are maintained within Compliance 360.


Create KPI’s and associated reporting to ensure BCP and DR processes are operating effectively and ensure service levels are known and being met by team.


Collaborate with IT architecture and engineering on UCare’s Data Center strategy to ensure all necessary components (e.g., Network, Server, Storage, Firewall, etc.) are implemented for High Availability and/or recoverability to meet regulatory requirements.


Collaborate with business and IT team members to develop application-specific BC and DR test plans. These plans should contain specific functions within applications to be verified and the expected results associated with each.


Create and document procedures necessary to conduct regular business continuity and disaster recovery tests. Identify and document repeatable steps to establish an environment in which BC and DR testing can occur. This process should also include the activities needed to decommission the test environment and resume normal operations.


Oversee the execution of annual business continuity and disaster recovery tests. Partner with personnel within IT, designated business units, and SaaS providers to carry out tests of selected applications and infrastructure functions. Document the results for audit/compliance purposes. Identify and remediate opportunities for improvement in future tests.


Create and document the procedures required to declare a business disruption/disaster and coordinate with Leadership to activate the BC/DR site for production usage.


Review and update the BIA (Business Impact Analysis) to ensure that applications are appropriately classified and assigned to tiers for recovery. This would include an examination of the Recovery Point Objective (RPO’s) and Recovery time objectives (RTO’s) associated with each tier. Work with ITSM and business owners to correctly categorize systems.


Co-manage process associated with BC/DR incidents. This includes assembling necessary resources to address incident, guide team through resolution, conduct root cause analysis meetings and ensure appropriate problem tasks are created.


Co-manage process for communicating outage/emergency activities to the organization.


Participate in the Contract Review Board to ensure new vendors/systems brought into UCare complies with the BC and DR regulatory requirements.


Other projects and duties as assigned.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business or related degree. Advanced degree preferred.

Required Experience

Five years’ experience managing business continuation/disaster recovery with at least two years of prior program management or project management experience.

Preferred Experience

ITIL certification. Prior experience managing business continuation/disaster recovery plans. Prior health care experience preferred.

THE UCARE DIFFERENCE

The UCare difference is our people power – employees actively working on the behalf of our members to get them access to the health care they need. We value and respect each individual's ideas and contributions, and provide the freedom to grow both personally and professionally. We are centrally located, and offer onsite education, equipment and wellness resources, and a myriad of volunteer activities. If you're looking for an inclusive environment that celebrates your people power, helps you build on your strengths and gives you the opportunity to truly make a difference, we invite you to apply.

As an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, we welcome and employ a diverse employee group committed to meeting the needs of UCare, our members, and the communities we serve.

JOB POST DATE: 9/29/2023

University of Minnesota Foundation Investment Advisors (UMFIA) is seeking a Senior Investment Operations Analyst to join its team of ten investment and operations professionals. The position supports the operational diligence and execution needed to provide upfront and ongoing monitoring and reporting of UMFIA’s investments and will liaise with all members of the UMFIA team to achieve this objective. University of Minnesota Foundation Investment Advisors (UMFIA), is an independent nonprofit subsidiary of the nonprofit University of Minnesota Foundation (UMF). UMF is a key partner with the University of Minnesota in building and sustaining excellence among students and faculty and fueling discovery in important areas on all University‐wide campuses. UMFIA was formed in 1998 to provide dedicated professional management of UMF’s investments and manages the endowment across a broad range of asset types. UMFIA aims to achieve an appropriate risk‐adjusted return on client assets by linking intelligent asset allocation with skillful investment implementation. UMFIA utilizes a wide variety of securities and partnerships in the execution of its investment strategy. Position Summary: The Operations team at UMFIA is at the forefront of the operational implementation and execution of UMFIA’s internally developed portfolio strategy. Working alongside seasoned operations and investment peers, the Operations team is challenged to ensure UMFIA and its investment managers maintain a strong control environment while remaining nimble and creative in order to support the team’s innovative approach to deal structuring. The Senior Investment Operations Analyst will assist with all operational aspects covering the life cycle of a UMFIA investment while working closely with other members of the operations team and the UMFIA investment team. The Senior Investment Analyst will be involved in the upfront onboarding of new investments, including the related determination and implementation of appropriate operational controls for said investments. The Senior Investment Operations Analyst will develop relationships with, and oversee the work of, third‐party vendors who support UMFIA’s investment objectives. This role will also be responsible for creating financial/performance packages for select investments, validating fee calculations, and assisting the Controller with ongoing accounting and reporting work for UMFIA and its clients. The Senior Investment Operations Analyst will be expected to develop and maintain a thorough understanding of UMFIA’s work product, policies, procedures and relationships. Additionally, this position assists and/or backs up senior members of the operations team with a variety of tasks. Primary Duties and Responsibilities:  Lead the upfront operational onboarding and settlement processes for new investments and service providers  Manage relationships with external service providers, measure and monitor performance against agreed upon service agreements, and hold providers accountable to UMFIA service level expectations  Ensure investment manager compliance to UMFIA documentation requests Job Posting – Senior Investment Operations Analyst  Create financial reporting packages for internally serviced investments  Prepare UMFIA and client reporting packages per desired cadence  Review investment activity posted to investment manager bank accounts  Identify, develop and promote process documentation, policies and procedures that support the quality and effectiveness of UMFIA investment operations practices  Promote knowledge‐sharing and training of operations staff Minimum Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance  Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in investment operations, accounting, performance reporting, and working with third party service providers  Strong critical thinking skills and tenacity when researching potential issues, reconciling inconsistencies, and resolving problems  Experience with a Windows PC environment and with Microsoft Office suite, particularly Microsoft Excel Please note: Applicants must be presently legally authorized to work in the United States for any US employer; this position is not eligible for employment‐based visa sponsorship or relocation. Compensation: A competitive base salary and annual incentive award are commensurate with experience and earnings history. UMFIA provides a strong benefits package. Working Conditions: This is a typical office environment in which employees use office equipment like personal computers, fax machines, copiers, telephones; stand or sit at a desk for long periods of time (2‐3) hours; may need to lift and move documents and supplies (not to exceed 25 lbs.); and bend to file or retrieve documents. Our organization follows a hybrid work structure where employees can work remotely or from the office, as needed, based on demands of specific tasks or personal work preferences. Working from the office is encouraged during the onboarding process and when working on tasks that require a high degree of collaboration. To apply: Send resume and cover letter to: charlotte@umfia.org. Deadline to submit resume is November 13, 2023. The University of Minnesota Foundation Investment Advisors is an equal opportunity employer without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, age, marital status, disability, public assistance status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. Indigenous, people of color, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA+, gender nonconforming and members of other historically underrepresented communities are highly encouraged to apply.

Job Title: Functional Business System Analyst – Finance/Costing SAP
Job Description:
Minnesota - Other

Hollstadt Overview

Hollstadt Consulting is a management and technology consulting firm dedicated to placing professionals at engagements where they will excel. When you work with us, you'll work with a refreshingly real company led and staffed by seasoned experts who are also down-to-earth, good people. We're committed to treating you with respect and helping you achieve your career aspirations.

Since 1990, Hollstadt has been a trusted partner to more than 150 domestic and global companies and has successfully completed over 2,000 projects. Our continued growth has created challenging and rewarding opportunities for accomplished IT and Business Consultants. Hollstadt Consulting is an equal opportunity employer including disability/veteran.




Job Description

The SAP Senior Product Costing Analyst will provide product costing expertise to ensure resources used during the manufacturing process are systematically recorded and reported in support of costing and profitability strategies. In this role, you will work closely with the finance and operations team to develop activity-based product cost standards that represent the true cost of goods manufactured, ensure when changes are proposed, the effects on the product costs are as intended and monitor the product costing process to ensure that transactions recorded reflect actual activity. As the domain specialist for product costing, you will analyze price and usage variances and advise the operations teams on possible methods to sustain or improve the manufacturing process.


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field or equivalent experience.
Strong knowledge of enterprise resource planning product costing.
Minimum of four years of related work experience.
Intermediate to advanced English skills.

Preferred

Experience within an activity-based costing environment.
Working knowledge of production flows and processes including supply chain.









Benefits + Perks





Comprehensive Benefit Plan

Hollstadt offers a competitive and comprehensive benefit package which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Long Term/Short Term Disability, and Life Insurance. With three different medical plans to choose from, you can enroll in the coverage you need from single to family, or anywhere in between!




Remarketing Process

Hollstadt is based on retention and relationships. We get to know your strengths and career wishes throughout your assignment and then start remarket discussions 6-8 weeks prior to your end date. By being proactive, we are able to keep your down time between assignments as short as possible, unless you choose otherwise.




Professional Development

Hollstadt offers free bi-weekly training courses for our consultants as well as on-demand access to past sessions through our consultant portal. Trainings give our consultants the continuing education they need to excel on their projects.





401k + Matching

One popular benefit is our 401(k) match on the first 4% of your contributions. Hollstadt wants to help you reach your long-term financial goals and understands that planning for your future is critical. Consultants also have access to support from a Financial Advisor.




Bonus Opportunities

We appreciate and reward loyalty. Join Hollstadt, stay for 5 years, and we’ll give you a $5,000 Longevity Award bonus! Additionally, we know great talent knows other great talent. If you are on contract with Hollstadt and refer one of your connections who gets placed, we’ll pay you $1,000!




Ongoing Support & Networking

We have made a significant investment in building a support program for our consultant team - so you never have to feel like you are going it alone. We also have a Consultant Coach program which acts like a 'work buddy' to provide a safe ear for questions or concerns at your client site.

Are you an analytical and strategic thinker with a passion for work system optimization? Do you thrive on working with data to identify challenges and suggest improvements? Loffler is seeking a Tactical Business Analyst to manage project planning and execution support for our core process initiatives. In this role, you will work with departments across the organization, gathering data and analyzing work systems to derive simplifications and improvements. You'll create project charters, define project scope and objectives, and manage operational process analysis and workflow development. With your strong communication skills and attention to detail, you'll ensure successful project outcomes and build positive relationships with all Loffler departments and partners. This is a hybrid-remote position that will report to our St. Louis Park, MN office. Apply now and take the first step towards a rewarding career at our Loffler!

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

All areas of responsibility listed below are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position, with reasonable accommodation, if necessary. Any non-essential functions are assumed to be included in "other related duties as assigned":

Assist departments with documenting their Work Systems and Work Improvement Plans. Break down the long-term organizational goals, into shorter-term targets (ie. Quarterly).
Identify where challenges lie, and then collect and analyze data, and suggest work system improvements.
For resulting projects, create the project charters and through interviews with Product Owners, help define project scope, identify stakeholders, and understand the vision and objectives.
Define future state for project outcomes by outlining the greater vision, defining SMART (specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, time-bound) goals, and identifying processes that may need to change.
Define change strategy for project outcomes, and ensure a project delivers its intended results and outcomes, so there is adoption by all stakeholders.
Write effective project tasks with clear acceptance criteria, to achieve project requirements.
Define the current state of systems and processes, gather information about how a system really works and where the root problems exist.
Consult with the Operational Business Analyst on specific requests for change, and follow established department guidelines as it relates to Change Management.
Consult with the Strategic Business Analyst to discuss any alignment with larger business strategies
If needed, assist the Operational Business Analyst or other project team members, write out the necessary project tasks to achieve the deliverables, and create the acceptance criteria.
Manage operational process analysis and workflow development.
Utilize tools to create process diagrams, decision trees, and mind mapping to create the necessary workflows, alerts, dashboards, reporting, and security required for the business units to be as efficient as possible.
Follow established departmental procedures using ConnectWise Manage and project management software to track the status of change and issue tickets, project tasks, and the time spent on both.
Maintain open lines of communication and build good working relationships with all Loffler departments and partners.
Consistently exhibit Loffler's Core Values: Can Do Positive Attitude, Professional, Results Driven, Customer First, Integrity, and Innovative.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Strong attention to detail and critical thinking/problem solving skills.
Self-starter with ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Excellent listening and communication skills.

Education/Experience:

College degree is required
Business Analyst certification required or 5 years experience in business analyst work. May consider project management or IT Project Services experience as a substitute, depending on relevant experience.
Knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma is preferred.
Technical aptitude is preferred, ability to identify tools and create solutions.
Ability to write out user stories.
Experience with creating Power BI or Tableau dashboards and knowledge of how to extract data is preferred.
Knowledge of how to use Microsoft Productivity Suite, including, but not limited to, Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, and project management software is required. Lucid Chart is helpful.
Working knowledge of Loffler's core applications is helpful but not required: Eautomate ERP, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, ConnectWise Manage.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The noise level in the work environment is usually minimal.

Datasite is where deals are made. We provide the data rooms and SaaS technology used in M&A and other high-value transactions, to deliver projects in more than 170 countries. Carrying that success into the future is all about you. Your useful skills, your unusual experience, your unique ideas. Everyone here brings something unexpected. What’s yours? Invest your talents in us, and we’ll return the compliment.
Job Description:
Datasite’s Salesforce Team is seeking a Salesforce Developer to help implement and optimize our Salesforce platform. This individual will utilize their experience to provide innovative solutions for the business needs while balancing effort and feasibility with cost and maintainability.
A successful candidate will have a solid record of delivering technical solutions under timeline and budget constraints and a proven track record of working efficiently with business and technical teams. In addition to being responsible for developing high performing solutions on the Salesforce platform, the Salesforce Developer will provide insight in advanced business analysis, conduct needs assessments, and configure apps as required.
This position is remote based within the United States.
Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop end to end Salesforce solutions using declarative configuration and customization using APEX Class, Triggers, Aura Components, Lightning Web Components, etc.
Accountable for Salesforce technical delivery - build, system testing handover/co-ordination, technical documentation, and deployment activities
Collaborate on cross-system integrations with ERP systems such as Workday.
Present solution options, evaluating the pros and cons of declarative configuration against code and customization.
Deliver Salesforce solutions across Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Revenue Cloud, Salesforce Experience Cloud (Communities) and Force.com platform.
Solution, implement, and manage the Salesforce technologies to meet business requirements.
Collaborate with other team members on the end-to-end solution architecture.
Demonstrate solution functionality to business stakeholders as needed.
Perform impact analysis for scope change requests, document changes to requirements, configuration, and data mapping.
Provide technical and functional expertise to project team.
Guide colleagues in rationalizing and deploying emerging technologies that drive increased business value.
Provide support on projects and current production environments including troubleshooting and solving issues.
Convert functional requirements to technical requirements.
Ability to analyze/identify gaps in functional/business requirements, discuss with functional and product owners on required changes that aligns with Salesforce product stack and architecture.
Interact with 3rd party tools.
Participate in declarative system configuration when necessary.
Experience and Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business, or a related field
3+ years of experience in architecting solutions on multiple Salesforce Clouds with an in-depth understanding of several Salesforce clouds; Revenue Cloud highly preferred (Sales/Service/Community/Marketing/Revenue)
Proven experience as a Salesforce.com developer using one or more: Visualforce, APEX programming, Lightning, Force.com, APIs, JavaScript, REST, Web Services and other web technologies Ability to work independently and be a self-starter.
Proven ability to analyze, design, and optimize business processes via technology and integration.
Continually study new Salesforce Industries & Salesforce technologies and functionality, as well as be involved in projects that push the capabilities of existing technologies.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Able to effectively develop materials that are appropriate for the audience.
Experiences with enterprise data management and migration
Passionate about solving tough problems.
Experiences with integration platforms, specifically Mulesoft

As a global organization, Datasite knows that diverse perspectives are essential to our success. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse workforce to serve our customers around the world. Datasite is an equal opportunity employer (EEO) and furthers the principles of EEO through Affirmative Action.

The Workforce Operations Analyst II will be responsible for managing the intraday workforce process to optimize service level performance and resource utilization. The analyst will seek and identify opportunities for offering real time insight, reporting and management of resources to best meet required SLAs, while also maintaining relationships with Service Center, BPSS, Client Operations Teams and Client Admin Teams.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Coordinate appropriate staffing allocation and availability of Service Center staff in order to achieve service level objectives
Monitor teams to ensure optimal staffing levels and partner with the Team Manager to ensure adequate staffing is maintained
Adjust intraday forecasts derived from understood business drivers to determine required staffing levels by projecting call volumes, call duration, and required staffing levels using current trends and historical data
Administer volume contingency action plans as deemed necessary and appropriate
Run and analyze reports with the result of making recommendations for adjusting staffing levels to meet departmental productivity and profitability goals
Facilitate real-time discussions with necessary stakeholders
Complete root-cause analysis to determine and quantify reasons for forecast variance and recommend changes to enhance forecast accuracy and effectiveness
Process daily exceptions requests, update schedules and respond to escalated issues and ad-hoc requests
Create and maintain CSR schedules and client forecasts
Ensure that all reports originating from the department are accurate and reliable
