Job Title: Sales Analyst
Location: Minneapolis, MN
We are seeking a results driven and customer-obsessed Sales Analyst to join our team. In this role, your insights and expertise will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making and maximizing sales performance to drive incremental market share and elevate our brands as a category thought leader. You will work closely with our Sales Leadership and our Vendors to provide insights and recommendations that positively affect the business.
Responsibilities:
Drive collaboration and support with our vendor partners and work cross functionally to support growing their business with us
Conduct weekly sales reporting from retailer POS systems to provide insights into sales performance
Partner with Sales Team to provide analysis with insights and recommendations to positively affect the business
Conduct product and vendor analysis to identify opportunities for growth
Leverage Circana and POS data to deliver comprehensive quarterly PSi and Market analysis to evaluate comparative performance of our brands
Provide ad-hoc analysis, reporting, and support requests as needed
Lead the product pitch lifecycle to evaluate commercial opportunities from our brands
process and work cross-functionally to complete all requirements for the forecast cycle
Identify and analyze weekly POS performance and trends to identify risks and opportunities
Develop strong rapport with vendor partners to support current and future business needs
Support inquiries on business outlook, review, and special requests
Support annual operating plan activities
Prepare reporting for Finance to support net revenue management
Plan, document, and recap all promotional and marketing program performance
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a related field, emphasizing a strong business background
Minimum 2 years of experience in insights, sales, or business
Strong analytical skills with experience in sales analysis
Excellent communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills
Demonstrate creativity, innovation, and initiative
Ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
Experience with NPD/Circana and POS data analysis tools

The Senior Financial Analyst will have a key role in the development of analytics to track and report on sales programs for the Marvin business. This role will also lead the preparation and analysis of financial results for the sales team. Reporting to the Sales Finance Manager, this role will partner with the sales team using these results and analytics to assist with sales program development and strategy.

Highlights of your role

Develop and maintain financial models related to sales and related customer programs.
Report and analyze actual program costs incurred, trends, and opportunities for improvement.
Support and participate in sales and related marketing program strategy.
Create forecasts for monthly sales expenses.
Assist with annual budgeting process for the sales team.
Lead the monthly financial review with the sales team.
Support sales team leadership and the Sales Finance Manager, with the development, analysis, and communication of ad-hoc reporting.
Support and execute various projects, presentations, and processes as requested.

You're a good fit if you have

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field
5+ years of accounting or finance work experience
Data analytical skills using spreadsheets, systems and business intelligence tools
Solid working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and budgeting fundamentals.
Experience with financial and statistical software.
Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple projects.
Ability to present financial data to non-financial professionals.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and analytical skills.
Ability to communicate and work as an effective team member.
Some travel is required.

Your opportunity for better living

At Marvin, we’re driven to imagine and create better ways of living. And that goes beyond our customers, to our communities and the colleagues beside us every day. We offer competitive compensation, an extensive benefits package that includes health insurance on day one of employment, paid time off and paid holidays, and a 401K retirement savings match.

We also support your overall wellness in other meaningful ways, including your own company-funded well-being account that can be used for anything from travel to a day at the spa, gym memberships or fun experiences with family and friends. You will be rewarded through our profit-sharing program, which recognizes the important role all employees play in making Marvin a success year, after year.


As a premier company with locations across North America, Marvin’s portfolio also includes three additional premium brands: Infinity Replacement Windows, TruStile Doors, and Marvin Coastline. Together, we share one purpose and live our values. Our culture is built on generations of doing the right thing and putting our people first. Join us, and experience better living at Marvin.

The Salesforce Administrator will collaborate to complete user requests in cadence with regular sprint releases, as well as assist with regression testing for Major Salesforce releases.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop and maintain a clear roadmap for Salesforce tightly aligned with the needs of the business.

Drives data integrity in the platform to support pipeline forecasting and accuracy.
Ensure upcoming changes documented and disseminated to the affected users and training staff.
Assist support staff with troubleshooting and ticket resolution.

BA/BS degree.
5+ years of Salesforce.com experience.
3+ years of business analyst experience.
Excellent analytical, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills.

Job Title: GIC District Sales Manager - Minneapolis District
Job Description:
Coordinate in-field activity to achieve results and agreed-upon targets. Maximize market, segment, and team dynamics to drive both top- and bottom-line results.
Ensure smooth, collaborative efforts in both day to day and long term business execution. Set tone and pace for business process and organization.
Understand and present a market and franchise/business point of view when leading teams and championing in-field meeting by developing a mastery of product and disease state information, as well as pertinent Market dynamics, including Managed Care landscape.
Coach, mentor, educate and develop direct and indirect team members to enhance individual skills and elevate overall team performance. Hold direct reports accountable to behaviors and expectations.
Provide direction and insights to key internal partners in business planning process.
Consistently exemplify the AbbVie Ways of Working.

Bachelor's Degree.
Sales experience.
Business analysis and planning skills that drive sales performance.

At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

The Sales Operations Analyst plays an integral part in helping senior management understand how to scale the sales organization and drive incremental revenue and growth opportunities. They are responsible for collaborating across the business with the broader sales enablement team, data and analytics team, sales team, product, marketing, finance, and external parties such as consultants to analyze, create, and/or provide sales data and analytics.

Specific responsibilities include but not limited to:

Work with Head of Distribution and finance partners to develop revenue metrics and targets to monitor sales-effectiveness.
Works with sales management to define opportunities and support business decisions by providing primary and secondary research support.
Lead Sales Intelligence effort to gather insights by collecting and compiling data from different sources, including CRM systems, marketing automation platforms, social media networks, and public records to provide meaningful sales intelligence around overall market opportunities.
Conducts research and gathers information and data from internal and external sources to identify market opportunities and prospects.
Works with marketing to provide lead lists applicable to sales campaigns and analytics/lead scoring as campaigns are running and leads are being funneled to sales representatives.
Leverages AUM and HR database resources to provide RFP response information and/or consultant database responses as needed.
Compiles economic and historical data for use in management forecasting and planning.
Manage and maintain sales territory data inclusive of market opportunity.
Create ad hoc reports (potentially integrating data from multiple sources) to address the one-off information needs of the business as they arise.
Strong collaboration with the data and analytics team, Sales Enablement CRM Coordinator, and sales leadership around reporting, forecasting, and pipeline management.
Assist with maintaining the functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, and ensuring data integrity throughout our CRM system.
Partner with sales leadership to build a territory management and account planning process to optimize performance of sales reps and align sales rep coverage to geographic opportunities.
Develop and track meaningful and relevant sales enablement analytics such as win rate and close rate and provide meaningful insights to sales leaders so they can identify areas to improve sales performance.
Identify KPIs to measure sales efficiency and help identify bottlenecks in sales process and opportunities to streamline processes and automate manual tasks.
Evaluate new technologies and act as a liaison to vendors and various levels of management.

Basic qualifications:

Three to Five years-experience in the financial services industry working in Sales, Account Management, and/or Marketing department.
Experience in B2B Sales Operations.
Asset Management experience a plus.
Well-developed analytical, mathematical, and research skills.
Proven experience combining data from multiple sources to produce reports and analysis.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (macros, VLOOKUP’s, etc.).
Familiarity with Government and municipal sales strategies preferred.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

Job Title: Analyst I, Parts Supply - The Toro Company
Job Description:
JR#8616 - Analyst I, Parts Supply - The Toro Company

Who Are We?

The Toro Company is a homegrown, Minnesota-based company that has been in business since 1914. We pride ourselves on providing world class equipment to help maintain the environment that we love, while putting an emphasis on giving back to the communities that surround us. From residential lawns and gardens, to venues such as St. Andrews Links and Target Field, we are a company with a global footprint and a passion for helping people beautify whatever landscape they may be in. With 100 years of operation under our belt and an average employee tenure of 15 years, come find out what makes The Toro Company the best place in the Twin Cities to build a career.


The Parts Supply Analyst is responsible for the ongoing procurement of service parts in quantities sufficient to maintain the 98% customer service fill rate requirements at a minimum financial investment. Maintain main point of contact to/from the supplier responsibilities to include questions related to forecast, capacity, delivery, and receipt of goods.

This role is not a parts expeditor -but a strategic analyst for the long-term cost-effective planning of parts and supplies.

Work location: This opportunity is on-site at the Minneapolis/Bloomington Corporate Headquarters. Remote/Hybrid is not available for this opportunity at this time.

Sponsorship: This opportunity is NOT eligible for VISA Immigration Sponsorship, now nor in the future.

What will you do?

Responsible for setting and monitoring the parts controls to assure adequate inventory balances at a minimum financial investment.

Using past history, Demand Solutions forecast, and other data available, determine lot sizes and safety times for materials assigned to ensure that fill rate and inventory turn goals are achieved. Run monthly reports to validate forecast. Research variances and work directly with Strategic Forecast Analysts to determine action plans. Report weekly metrics including past due POs, backorders, pending’s, etc.

Develop economic order quantities, lot sizes, and schedules delivery consistent with required procurement and manufacturing lead-time. Develop part delivery schedules with suppliers to meet customer fill rates, inventory goals, and financial objectives.

Issue shop work orders for assembly, disassembly, and packaging of accessories and parts kits.

Conduct root cause analysis on backordered parts. Exhaust all resources to gain shipment of needed part(s) for unit downs.

What do you need?

BA/BS degree in Business, Sourcing, Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering or related field preferred.

1-3 years of previous Retail Business Analyst or Operations experience required; Experience in inventory control and basic mechanical aptitude required.

Time management, multi-tasking and organizational skills/experience required. Must have the ability to work in a fast paced, high demand problem solving environment with the ability to meet and/or negotiate timelines as necessary. Highly self-motivated, ability to work under pressure, manage and prioritize multiple objectives concurrently, attend to details, and meet deadlines in a fast paced environment.

Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively and diplomatically interact; must be patient, tactful, and flexible with people from a wide range of disciplines.

Proficient computer skills including SAP, SharePoint, MS Excel, MS Word.

Capacity to work independently as well as within a team-oriented, collaborative environment

0 to 10% travel (domestic).

What Can We Give You?

At The Toro Company, we are always working to make sure our employees know just how valued they are. In addition to a competitive salary, an affordable and top tier medical/dental/vision plan, 401k, and many other great benefits - The Toro company offers employees at our Bloomington, MN Headquarters location a variety of perks, including:


Dress for your day - We know you're more productive when you're comfortable, which is why TTC employees are encouraged to take advantage of our casual, corporate environment.

Location – Conveniently located at the corporate headquarters, near both St. Paul and Minneapolis, we are centrally located for most commuters!

Food - Take advantage of our onsite café, which serves both breakfast and lunch. With a Caribou Coffee attached, you can grab a snack and a coffee at any time during your day.

Wellness - The Toro Company’s HQ offers complimentary use of our onsite fitness facility to employees. In addition to physical wellbeing, TTC offers a variety of mental health and financial health resources to all employees.

Competitive Salary – Salary will be determined by experience and qualifications. If you need to, you can access your pay early with the One@Work app.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


#LI - Onsite

#OFCE

Rise Baking Company was founded by bakery experts passionate about providing our customers with high quality products and providing a positive, collaborative place to work for our people.

We are a company built on elevating expectations. It’s what sets us apart from others in the baking industry. And our people are our finest ingredient.

We believe the quality of our people is just as important as the quality of our products. Our environment encourages creativity, and we value an entrepreneurial and industrious approach to work —a place where honesty, respect, and trust are the essential ingredients for how we do business. We take pride in working with creative individuals with a passion for what they do, and we’re always looking to expand our team.

We offer a wide variety of professional and management opportunities, including sales, product development, account management, general management, finance, engineering, administration, and information systems management. We also employ a diverse workforce of hourly food production, packaging, quality assurance, warehouse, sanitation personnel, leads, and supervisors.

Like our products, our benefits package offers quality that makes a difference.

Coverage options may include:

Medical, dental, life, disability, vision, and supplemental insurance
Company paid holidays
Paid Time Off (PTO) plans
Performance bonus potential
401k plan with company match

Expectations Deliciously Exceeded.

Job Purpose

Implement and support the SAP solution at Rise Baking Company, providing expertise for all aspects of Production Planning (PP) & Quality Management (QM) modules in SAP. Work closely with the SAP support team, business process owners, and subject matter experts to define and standardize end-to-end business processes across the company.

Essential Functions

Utilize SAP best practices to design, configure/develop, test, and deploy an integrated ERP solution with SAP ECC/S4 HANA at the core
Deliver solution models and architectures in line with business requirements, organization, and industry standards across all manufacturing plants
Work with project stakeholders to understand the business outcomes and recommend options that provide fit to-standard solutions
Assess the impact of business change requests on the existing model and assist with prioritization
Provide direction and guidance, adhering to design standards and target operating model
Support the SAP team to determine high-level functional and technical requirements, maximizing the use of standard and out-of-the-box features and capabilities
Work and effectively communicate with a wide range of stakeholders across the company to develop solutions that meet the needs of the business
Develop and maintain documentation to support the SAP environment ensuring consistent and reliable procedures and change management processes
Support food safety program, quality standards, and legality of manufactured products
Perform other job-related duties as assigned

Qualifications (Education, Experience, Competencies)

Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field; Master’s degree preferred
4-8 years of hands-on SAP configuration and functional development design experience
1-3 years of manufacturing industry experience; food manufacturing industry experience preferred
Strong understanding of manufacturing and warehousing business process flows and SAP process design
SAP MM, PP, QM, WM, SD certification preferred
Knowledge of SAP CRM, SRM, BW, FICO, EDI, PO, SAC modules preferred
Experience working on large, enterprise-scale projects, with diverse project teams
Experience with at least two full cycle implementations in SAP
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Ability to effectively communicate with multi-level personnel as well as suppliers, customers, and their representatives
Ability to organize, manage multiple priorities, and maintain high attention to detail in a fast-paced environment
Self-motivated, goal oriented, quality driven, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision


Expectations (Exhibit and Promote Company's Core Values)

People: We engage, empower, and appreciate our people- they are our finest ingredient
Safety: We invest in systems, policies, and training that ensure safety
Customer Partnerships: We make decisions with the customer experience in mind and ensure win/win outcomes
Collaboration: We leverage each other's unique experiences to drive the best outcomes for our expanding company
Communication: We inform and listen to our team members, customers, suppliers, and investors
Results: We prioritize activities that drive profitable growth, and we celebrate our achievements


An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Job Title: Advisory Lead Business Analyst 1 - PDM Senior Consultant
Job Description:
Risk and Financial Advisory - Hybrid Operate

Lead Business Analyst - PDM Senior Consultant

Do you have a drive to be a part of the technology evolution , and a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages? If so, please consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. The Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model tailored to long-term, client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing the need for extensive travel . As a Lead Business Analyst in our Hybrid-Operate business, you'll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience, share ideas, and collaborate with leading professionals as we engage a diverse set of industries with effective solutions

Work you'll do

As a Lead Business Analyst, you will work on client teams , supporting technology products - including onboarding new client implementations, performing data analytics, and expanding existing business features and functionality to meet client needs. You will be working with other analysts and developers to identify and address technical and non-technical issues. Additional responsibilities m ay include:

Documenting highly complex business processes, data flow and architecture for new systems and data
Creating business cases to provide cost effective solutions.
Following complex data flow to interpret source of information in support of new systems and data.
Recommend ing change s based on business system impact analysis.
Serving as functional lead in technical implementation of agreed upon solutions.
Translating business requirements into test cases
Facilitating User Acceptance Testing of system enhancements and new applications, including initial root cause analysis of failures
Preparing and presenting complex written and verbal materials such as reports, findings, and systems training
Building reports using Crystal Reports and SSRS and, ad-hoc queries and dashboards leveraging market leading business intelligence tools
Serving as an escalation point, and guiding less tenured business analysts to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Participat ing in Agile development process and contribut e to sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives
Help develop requirements for, and assist in testing of, software enhancements including providing market and user insights

The desired candidate is a team player who is passionate about learning and working with technology, finance, and alternative investments. The candidate will be detail oriented, possess strong listening, verbal/written communication skills, and able to collaborate well with others.

The Team

We are a growing global team of Analysts and Technology professionals. You will be working directly with team members at all levels, with the focus on enhancement or customization to meet the needs of our clients. Our teams understand the dynamics of serving complex, global clients across multiple industries, and the importance of increasing transparency around business performance. Learn more about our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte.

Technical Knowledge and Experience :

Required

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience
5-7 years of relevant experience
Minimum of four years of work experience in IT and data driven projects as a Business Analyst/ Product Manager
Experience working in Agile projects with good understanding of Agile ways of working
Ability to influence peers and leadership stakeholders
Relevant certifications in Agile, Scrum or project management
Strong experience in IT consulting and business analysis - process definition, requirements gathering, Proficiency in writing Business Requirements Documents ( BRD ) , and Functional Specification Documents ( FSD )
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. and user stories



The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $75,924 - $133,200.

Work Shift/Work Hours: Day Shift
Days of Work: Monday - Friday
Travel Required: No
Salary Range: $37.81 - $64.89 / hourly; $78,947 - $135,490 / annually
Classified Status: Classified
Bargaining Unit/Union: 216 - Middle Management Association/MMA
FLSA Status: Exempt - Executive
Telework Eligible: Yes - #LI-Hybrid
Designated in Connect 700 Program for Applicants with Disabilities: Yes
Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.

The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.

Join the 2,500+ professionals of Minnesota IT Services (MNIT) who connect Minnesotans to services that will improve their lives. This position serves our partners at the Bureau of Criminal Apprehension (BCA) within the Department of Public Safety (DPS). MNIT BCA provides comprehensive IT operations and support services, custom application development, and dedicated business- specific support functions for investigative and specialized law enforcement services. You will support an agency that partners with law enforcement, public safety, and criminal justice agencies to prevent and solve crimes.

Job Summary



This position provides leadership and management oversight for business systems analysis efforts and Scrum framework coaching/mentoring for application development and technical product teams within the Minnesota Justice Information Systems (MNJIS) at the BCA. These teams work on information technology initiatives that support strategic departmental and organizational objectives in an agile environment. This position is accountable for guiding, developing, coordinating and directing organization-wide business systems analysis standards, guidelines, processes, tools, and measures for information technology services within the organization, as well as providing management oversight and coaching to a team of business analysts, some of which conduct scrum master functions. Responsibilities also include centralized management of business rules and requirements for business products, features, and the enterprise. This position is critical to promoting collaboration and teamwork across all MNJIS teams including software development, quality assurance, project management, enterprise architecture, network operations, and technical support to implement business systems analysis best practices in all dimensions of software development and technical support.

As a member of the MNJIS Management Team, this position participates in long-term, organizational planning by creating the MNJIS four-year strategic plans and is responsible for implementing strategies to meet MNJIS, BCA, DPS, and MNIT strategic goals.

This position requires an employee to be onsite at the work location 3 days per week.

Telework for Minnesota IT Services allows an employee to perform work from a telework location and an employee may be required to be in the office based on business needs and other dependencies.
Only candidates located in Minnesota and bordering states (Iowa, North Dakota, South Dakota, or Wisconsin) are telework eligible.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must clearly demonstrate all of the following qualifications in their resume:

Position requires a minimum of four (4) years of experience in IT theory, principles, and practices of business and technical analysis in an agile environment. Work experience must include two years of lead work or supervisory experience.

Experience must include:

Selection, training, development and evaluation of Business Analysts to ensure desired performance outcomes. Establishment and communication of clear performance standards and delivery of performance evaluations.
Working with large-scale software development projects to include analysis, software development, testing and deployment.
Experience with the use of Agile methodologies, Scrum and Kanban frameworks, and user story writing (Behavior Driven Development (BDD) preferred).
Working in a Business Analyst role with experience conducting business, data, and technical analysis. Knowledge and experience with business analysis principals, techniques, and tools.
Software development lifecycle theory, principles, and practices.
Ability to deliver effective verbal or written messages that facilitate a mutual understanding on both parties.
Customer service skills that include active listening, empathy, and problem-solving.

It is the policy of the Minnesota IT Services that all employees submit to a background investigation prior to employment. The background check may consist of the following components:

SEMA4 Records Check (applies to current and past state employees only)
Criminal History Check
Employment Reference Check
Social Security and Address Verification Education Verification
Fingerprinting Background
Check Drug Screening
Other legally required checks

*Minnesota IT Services will not sponsor applicants for work visas. All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US.*

Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a criminal justice information technology environment or combination of related fields.
Knowledge of human resource policies, procedures, and labor contracts sufficient to interview and select affirmatively, assign, schedule, direct, train and evaluate the work performance of business analysis and scrum master staff.
Principles, methods and techniques for mentoring/coaching staff members.
Ability to plan strategically, appropriately and effectively set priorities, and adapt to a quickly changing environment.
Communicate verbally or in writing sufficient to communicate expectations to technical and managerial teams, communicate technical information to non-technical audiences, and effectively represent the agency to external customers or stakeholders.
Strategically identify, plan, and execute on long-range business systems analysis goals and needs to meet organizational strategies and priorities.
Ability to strategically plan, visualize and iterate long-range business systems analysis goals and needs.

MNIT partners with agencies, boards, councils, and commissions to deliver secure, reliable technology solutions as we set IT strategy, direction, policies, and standards statewide. Work for MNIT and be part of a nation-leading IT organization that helps to create an innovative government that works for everyone. Role: Senior RPA Consultant
6 Months
Look for local to Minneapolis, MN (Hybrid)
W2 position

We need pure play Business Analyst with RPA automation on Oracle EBS with supply chain domain exposure.
We are looking for a consultant who can seed the automation program. we need a consultant with CoE setup evangelize the program, create more automation opportunities etc.. –these consultants are not going to code. Robotic Process Automation Center of Excellence (RPA CoE)
Experience: 10-15 years of experience
Qualification: B.E /B. Tech/ MBA or equivalent. Master’s degree is preferred but not mandatory.
Overview

Your role as a Senior RPA Consultant will be to work in partnership with customers, advising them the best use their automation platforms in order to meet their business objectives and ensure enterprise scale governance of automation discovery, implementation and support
Primary Skills:

Must have knowledge in process discovery and ROI calculations for automation
Must have experience in setting up governance for automation implementation in consultation mode in large enterprises
Experience in implementing solutions using leading automation (RPA) platforms specifically Automation Anywhere, UiPath and Blue Prism
Assist in ensuring that Automation CoE team meets deliverables and makes decisions on time
Build positive relationships at multiple levels with key business partners, act as advocate for Automation CoE throughout the organization
Excellent consultative, listening, communication, and analytical skills; you can optimally and regularly lead, facilitate, and drive individual and group meetings
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to work across the organization and interact, influence, and negotiate effectively with all levels of management and peers
Customer-obsessed and have demonstrated a commitment to delivering frequent, high business value features
Ability and desire to lead, direct, and empower team members without formal management authority
Look for opportunities to innovate and take thoughtful risks to get the work done better and faster
Ability to blend business analysis with technical skillset to develop efficient processes for automation
Strong analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills are detail-oriented, and able to understand complex customer needs and translate them into user stories with measurable acceptance criteria
Must have enough technical background to be able to create proper functional requirements and detail specifications.
Must be able to take direction well but work independently, have the ability to learn and assimilate information quickly.
Aware of software development process (AGILE/SCRUM, Waterfall)
Ability to prepare standard and ad-hoc presentation decks in a timely manner on required topics, from high level functional overview to detailed technical overview of key data flows
Knowledge on business trends in automation
Hyper automation concepts and road map
General:

Should be able to manage consulting engagement by defining scope, budget, timelines and quality, with full responsibility and authority to complete the assigned project
Knowledge of technology in terms of databases, API’s, RPA platform, client server architecture, software design tools and business process models.
Knowledge on cost benefit analysis with respect to data, operation, technology and Finance
Leads project teams consisting of cross-functional, global and virtual groups and directly supervises staff, ensuring the appropriate expectations, principles, structures, tools and responsibilities are in place to deliver the plan and deliver excellence
Working with Program Management teams to build and maintain pipeline
Communicates with internal stakeholders to ensure teams are driving toward the necessary tactical and/or strategic solution to meet customer needs, communication status and buffers team from potential distractions
Crafting drafts of epics and stories to seed product backlog to begin the refinement process
Experience with Automation Platform and RPA tools like AA, UiPath, Blue prism, Python, scripting based or other source control and defect tracking tools.
Exposure to process mining tools like Celonis and UiPath process mining
Character:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, especially the ability to articulate advanced technical topics; both verbal and written
Strong technical leadership skills and ability to command respect at all levels of the organization
Sincere passion for building great business solutions and taking pride in the quality of your work.
Time Management Skills - ability to prioritize tasks across multiple projects and work effectively under pressure
Ability to come up-to-speed quickly on new technologies
Self-motivated and self-disciplined
Ability to craft solutions that address client’s business drivers and constraints.
Ability to work effectively in both a team environment and independently, both with internal and external stakeholders
Critical need will be Oracle EBS automation experience.

Create Your Career With Us!

Sanford Health is one of the largest and fastest-growing not-for-profit health systems in the United States. We're proud to offer many development and advancement opportunities to our nearly 50,000 members of the Sanford Family who are dedicated to the work of health and healing across our broad footprint.

Facility: 3801 Building

Location: Bemidji, MN

Address: 3801 Bemidji Ave N, Bemidji, MN 56601, USA

Shift: Day

Job Schedule: Full time

Weekly Hours: 40. 00

Salary Range: $43.00 - $71.00

Pay Info: Pay starts at $43 and increases according to years of applicable experience.

Job Summary

Technology Business Management is a newly established program within Sanford Health s Technology area that will manage and communicate the cost of Information Technology, known within the industry as Technology Business Management (TBM).

This principal position will be responsible for the analysis of IT finance, cost, and other related IT management information to include the IT service catalog, IT contracts, project management office, and architecture. Responsible for evaluating and supporting IT management systems and tools; capturing, generating, synthesizing, and reporting IT investment life cycle management data; and improving IT financial planning, budgeting, and transactions and reporting workflows and processes.

In addition, this position will support the IT Financial Management (ITFM)/Technology Business Management (TBM) program initiative for Chief Information Officer, System Executive Director, and Technology Leadership. The ITFM/TBM initiative's overall objective is to develop IT financial, management, and cost data associated with IT investments beyond the finance view to include IT service views and business views. The goal is to support executive decision-making, thereby leading to improved IT cost transparency, IT investment accountability, and IT value delivery to Sanford s business and mission components. Develops, implements, and administers IT Financial Management (ITFM)/Technology Business Management (TBM) processes, data, systems, and tools used for planning and life cycle management for IT budgets, assets, and capital resources. Follows well established and understood financial management best practices within a standardized ITFM/TBM taxonomy and framework. Provides expert advice related to ITFM/TBM processes, systems, tools, and data to CIO IT portfolio and sub-portfolio owners, applications portfolio, and enterprise architecture components. Identifies, collects, and analyzes ITFM/TBM related cost, financial, and other related management data. This includes IT financial, cost, and enterprise architecture data related to business capabilities, services portfolio, functional towers, projects, and enterprise architecture components.

Provides expert guidance in resolving complex problems and/or issues affecting IT financial, cost, and data collection, extraction, and reporting of IT spending and management data. Collects analytical management data essential to the investment planning, contracts, and project management of CIO portfolios. Advises and assists Finance with the conceptualization, design, and development of costing methodologies, cost allocation, and variance analysis. Support the monthly budget and forecast process in managing consumption, chargeback, show back, and savings in collaboration with Finance, Technology, and Business Lines/Operations. Provides advice and guidance to resolve, implement, or manage ITFM/TBM program, process, data, and technology issues that may arise.

Researches, analyzes, and provides expert technical advice on findings associated with cost optimization opportunities. Recommendations may relate to complex conclusions drawn from data generated from ITFM/TBM or financial and other management systems and tools to include reports, metrics, dashboards, and related analysis. Provides substantive supporting data to aid in operational and executive management decision making by working committees and executive management to include CIO, the Operational Leadership Committee, and the Priority Executive Committee. Capable of motivating and managing organizations as part of cross functional teams to deliver desired results. This role involves close collaboration with technology, operations, and finance professionals at all levels within the organization.

Determines and documents data mapping rules for movement data between applications. Adheres to and promotes the use of data administration standards. Extracts and analyzes data from specific applications, systems, and/or databases to create reports and provide recommendations based on the analysis of the data. Investigates and resolves data issues across platforms and applications, including discrepancies of definition, format, and function. May create data models, including robust data definitions, which may be entity-relationship-attribute models, star, or dimensional models. May be responsible for employing data mining techniques to achieve data synchronization, redundancy elimination, source identification, data reconciliation, and problem root cause analysis.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, healthcare administration, or related field required.

Minimum of seven years experience in Technology required.

Understanding of technology infrastructure domains including data centers, network/communications, server utilization, virtual environment, storage, and application development.

Knowledge of financial management processes and best practices such as cost allocations, capital & operating expense management, program portfolio management, and application/infrastructure support.

Knowledge of large corporate technology operations. Ability to learn emerging technology trends to develop cost, quality/performance, and value of that technology.

Strong Excel software skills, especially VLOOKUP, IF statements, pivot tables, and macros. Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI software, SQL database development, and Microsoft Access databases.

Experience with C-Suite communication, presenting, and Technology Business Management tools.

Demonstrated leadership and organizational skills.

Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified Management Accountant (CMA) or other professional certification is preferred, but not required. TBM Certification preferred.

Benefits

Sanford Health offers an attractive benefits package for qualifying full-time and part-time employees. Depending on eligibility, a variety of benefits include health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, a 401(k) retirement plan, work/life balance benefits, and a generous time off package to maintain a healthy home-work balance. For more information about Total Rewards, visit https://sanfordcareers.com/benefits .

Sanford is an EEO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vet. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation for help with your online application, please call 1-877-673-0854 or send an email to talent@sanfordhealth.org .

Sanford Health has a Drug Free Workplace Policy. An accepted offer will require a drug screen and pre-employment background screening as a condition of employment.

Job Title: Business Analyst, Principal Lead - local Twin Cities metro area candidates only
Job Description:
Description:

The American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Principal Lead Business Analyst to join- and provide mentorship, work direction, support, and guidance- to our dynamic growing Transformation Office (TO) team.

In this role, you will lead and collaborate with business and project resources to gather, analyze, and document processes, requirements, and user stories using multiple methodologies and industry leading practices. You will perform research and analysis, evaluate options, and determine the best possible solutions. You'll also manage the requirements lifecycles in Agile and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) efforts and communicate effectively with multiple levels in the organization as they align current and long-term business needs.

Duties and Responsibilities

Principal Lead Essentials

Direct activities and work of other TO members.
Delegate work tasks to project team members to ensure timely project delivery.
Provide recommendations to management on resource needs.
Mentor and coach TO members on industry best practices, rules, and principles.

Business Analyst Essentials

Translate business rules, functional needs, and process flows into requirements, process models, user stories or other requirement documentation.
Establish a strong understanding of business processes and related systems for which requirements are being created.
Engage appropriate stakeholders for requirements gathering.
Facilitate cross-functional requirements gathering sessions.
Diagram current and future state business operations and supporting processes utilizing ARRT standard tools and techniques.
Collaborate with the business to explore creative, effective, and practical solutions.
Identify outcome success criteria – define what should be measured or assessed to confirm the level of outcome achievement.
Apply understanding of technical or system concepts to assist the design review of solutions.
Liaise with project stakeholders to ensure collaboration.
Communicate promptly and clearly, providing updates on work progress. Including: successes, impediments, and forecasting of remaining duration and work effort.
Assess performance measurement methods and compare against desired results for newly implemented solutions.
Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, and uncover areas for improvement.
Manage the requirements lifecycle. Assist in estimating work for stories and requirements, track or trace requirements, and develop relevant acceptance criteria.
Facilitate refinement and prioritization of stories, support release planning activities, and demonstrate functionality.
Prepare design flow, wireframe, and reporting documentation.
Assist with planning and execution of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) as needed, including utilization of requirement matrices or similar construct.
Perform research into project-related issues and products.
Proactively identify recommendations for changes in project scope, issues, risks, and contingency plans.
Own the product backlog, facilitate grooming, and prioritization, of stories with all stakeholders.
Along with the Project Manager, ensure adoption of the standardized project processes and capabilities, on task estimation, and on BA-centric elements of project plans.
Other duties as assigned.
Requirements:

Minimum Requirements

A bachelor's degree in information technology or business management, or equivalent industry experience.
12+ years of professional experience as a Business Analyst

Preferred Qualifications:

Master's degree
Previous experience in leading process initiatives.
Experience supporting Organizational Change Management (OCM).
Business operations experience.
Professional certification in Business Analysis (ECBA, CCBA, CBAP or equivalent)

Skills and Abilities:

Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.
Analyze, simplify, and translate complex business problems into logical business solutions.
Resourcefulness and ability to devise creative solutions to problems.
Ability to organize, prioritize, delegate and respond well under pressure.
Proven success in operating in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work independently, collaboratively, and with full responsibility for multiple areas.
Understand core functions of the business area(s) and supporting systems for which requirements are being created: what the business does and how it operates.
Strong understanding of business analysis concepts, tools, techniques, and best practices.
Plan, organize, and structure to drive project-delivery results to multiple levels in the organization.
Analyze the impact of new requirements and features.
Quickly adapt to department, environment, and team dynamics.
Motivate people and align expectations effectively.
Understand and follow various Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and project management methodologies.
Handle concurrent projects of complex scope.
Lead and participate in an array of interactions with a variety of audiences, reaching consensus and resolution of questions, issues, or requirements.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (especially Project, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) and collaboration tools (e.g., Jira/Confluence, Azure, DevOps).
Professional and client-friendly presence.
Establish, foster, and commit to building strong relationships and team orientation.

Review a full Job Description which includes additional information including physical demands. This fulltime position is considered hybrid with partial remote work, along with occasional on-site office requirements. Local metro candidates only. We are located in Mendota Heights, Minnesota.

The American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) is the world’s largest organization offering credentials in medical imaging, interventional procedures, and radiation therapy. We certify and register technologists in a range of disciplines by overseeing and administering education, ethics, and examination requirements. Visit www.arrt.org for more information and for details on our robust Benefits Package.

Job Title: Sr. Business Accountability Specialist- Analytics, Reporting & Presentation
Job Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Business Accountability Specialist to join the HR Business Risk Management Team. The position will be responsible for standards and controls in the business, ensuring effective design, assessment, monitoring, and execution through establishment of protocols, assessment, risk mitigation, oversight, reporting, and self-assurance activities.

In this role, you will:
Be a key member of a growing and evolving team supporting Human Resources Risk Management.
Manage projects and drive initiatives through implementation.
Develop and organize standard documentation.
Coordinate and organize cross-team initiatives
Analyze reporting and data, including trending and themes
Develop executive presentations to tell the story of the data, forming clear calls-to-action
Lead or participate in moderately complex initiatives and deliverables within business and contribute to large-scale, cross-functional planning related to mitigation of current and emerging business risk issues and concerns
Assess, analyze, and design moderately complex controls, protocols, and approaches with respect to risk mitigation and the control environment, including ensuring effective planning for sustainability, ongoing control adherence, reporting, measurement, technology impacts, and monitoring
Independently make decisions and resolve moderately complex issues while leveraging solid understanding of the business's functional area or products, operations, and regulatory environment; facilitate decision-making and issue resolution, and support implementation of developed solutions and plans; lead peers and key business partners to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives
Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and mid-level managers to address current and emerging risks associated with business activities and operations, and provide guidance or support in interpreting, developing, and implementing risk-mitigating strategies
Partner with peers and the business in interactions with external parties to support appropriateness and timeliness of response, and effectiveness of communications and materials
May serve as a mentor for lower-level staff
Required Qualifications:
4+ years of risk management, business controls, quality assurance, business operations, compliance, or process experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
Desired Qualifications:
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Project management experience
Experience identifying risk exposure and propose solutions as well as key issues, involve affected parties, design solutions, obtain buy-in and communicate effectively through resolution
Experience presenting information in a manner that persuades, educates, and enhances understanding at all levels
Ability to create and manage capacity planning and gearing ratio tools
Experience with Power Bi and Tableau creating dashboards
Enhanced Microsoft Excel skills, including pivot tables, macros, charts, and VLOOKUPs.
Advanced PowerPoint design skills, including development of Executive decks, with the ability to tell complex stories succinctly and visually.
Job Expectations:
This position will require onsite presence at one of the locations listed below in a hybrid work schedule
Ability to travel up to 10%
Relocation assistance is not available for this position
This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

401 S Tryon Street, 24th floor, Charlotte NC
7001 Westown Parkway West Des Moines, Iowa
4101 Wiseman Blvd. San Antonio, Texas
1301 Solana Blvd, Westlake. Texas
550 S. 4th Street, Minneapolis, Minneapolis
2222 W. Rose Garden Lane Phoenix, Arizona

As the Marketing Manager, Customer Analytics, you are responsible for analyzing customer & business data, generating strategic insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and enhance decision-making processes. Your expertise in data analysis, business intelligence tools, and market research will be instrumental in uncovering valuable insights and shaping our marketing and organization's overall business strategy.

Role & Responsibility

Data Analysis and Insights Generation:

Conduct in-depth analysis of customer & business data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement
Utilize statistical techniques and data modeling to derive actionable insights and support strategic decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks to track business performance
Monitor market trends, industry benchmarks, and competitor activities to identify areas for differentiation and improvement

Business Intelligence Tools and Reporting:

Leverage business intelligence tools and platforms to facilitate data analysis, visualization, and reporting
Develop requirements for dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to stakeholders across the organization
Work closely with the Sr. Manager of Customer Information to align business insights with customer data and marketing/business initiatives
Regularly communicate key findings and recommendations to senior management and other relevant stakeholders

Market Research and Competitive Analysis:

Lead market research initiatives to gather insights on customer preferences, market trends, and industry dynamics
Conduct competitive analysis to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for our organization
Collaborate with marketing and product teams to incorporate market research findings into product development and marketing strategies
Monitor and report on market and industry trends that may impact our business performance

Strategy Development and Recommendations:

Provide strategic recommendations based on data-driven insights to drive business growth and competitive advantage
Collaborate with senior management to develop and refine business strategies and tactics
Identify new opportunities and areas for innovation based on market insights and industry best practices
Support the development and execution of data-driven marketing strategies

Job Requirement
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Economics, Marketing). A master's degree is preferred
Proven experience in business analysis, business intelligence, or a related role
Experience: 7>10 years, 5+ years of analytical experience
Travel: <10%
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL) and business intelligence platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Experience in conducting market research, competitor analysis, and industry benchmarking
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to derive insights from complex datasets
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey insights to stakeholders at various levels
Solid project management skills, with the ability to handle multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
Strong business acumen and understanding of key business drivers
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment
Familiarity with customer data platforms (CDPs) and marketing analytics is a plus

As a part of the Doosan Group, which employs more than 43,000 people in 38 countries worldwide, the company offers its customers products and solutions to help build stronger businesses and communities. Based in Seoul, South Korea, with its North America headquarters in West Fargo, North Dakota, Doosan Bobcat is a leading global manufacturer of construction, agriculture, landscaping and grounds maintenance equipment, attachments and services. Job Title: Commerce - Access Modernization Project - Solution Architect
Job Description:
Role : Commerce - Access Modernization Project - Solution Architect

Location : Remote
Job ID : 2864

Client : Minnesota Department of Commerce

Job Responsibilities

The Minnesota Department of Information Technology Services (MNIT), partnering with the Minnesota Department of Commerce, is seeking resource to perform Solution Architect duties pertaining to the assessment phase of an Access Modernization project.

Commerce currently has 23 Access applications that are used to track various aspects of Commerce business. These applications range in functionality from simple to quite complex, and many are critical to business functions. There are also numerous manual paper processes associated with these Access applications. The focus of the Access Modernization project is to replace obsolete and unmaintainable Access applications that no longer meet business needs with modern solutions that meet business needs and are streamlined, efficient, and secure. This will include the automation of manual processes associated with the applications where possible.

The Solution Architect resource will assess the 23 Access applications (including high-level business requirements, data flows, and any related manual processes) and provide recommendations as to replacement with off the shelf software, replacement with custom built application, or leaving as is.

The 23 identified applications are in the table below:


Complaints

FMLA Tracking

Fuels Monitoring Report (FMR)

Grants

Insurance Examinations

Regional Energy Information Systems (REIS) Utility Data

Registration

Renewable Energy Production Incentive (REPI)

Revenue Yearly Upload

RFP Database

Self-Insurance

Weatherization Assistant

Weatherization Assistant - State Reports Module

Weatherization Monitoring Issues Log

Sircon Reports

Distributed Generation /Qualifying Facilities Reports,

Financial Exams (AKA Financial Institutions)

Actuary

Financial Programs

Power Clerk Data Viewer

Commonline

E85 and MidBlend Fuels

Petrofund

Tasks

Interview end users of Commerce Access applications to define and document:

High level business requirements for each application.

Data flows in and out of each application.

Manual processes associated with each application.

Make recommendations on whether each existing application should be replaced by off-the-shelf software, be replaced by a custom-built application, or stay "as is”, in order to meet business needs.

For each application where replacement with off the shelf software is recommended, identify software option(s) including product name(s), estimated costs, estimated time to implement, and pros/cons of each option if there are multiple options. Where multiple off the shelf software options are identified, provide recommendation as to which option should be chosen.

Present findings in writing and verbally to the project team as research/recommendation for each application is completed.

Provide knowledge transfer to State staff.

Perform other related duties as requested by the State.

Minimum Qualifications

Five (5) years' experience defining high level requirements

Five (5) years' experience defining business needs

Five (5) years' experience defining data flows

Desired Qualifications

Experience with project(s) where software selection was the end product

Experience with software selection project(s) for a government agency

Experience with Access or other legacy applications

Experience with modernization project(s)

Experience with business analysis

Consumer-first mindset

Life-Science Innovations has a new, full time opportunity for a hybrid-remote IT Senior Project Manager to join their team.

The IT Senior Project Manager’s role is to support the intake of new project ideas, working closely with business sponsors to define project scope and vision, business case development, and project prioritization. The ideal candidate should be detail oriented, analytical, and possess a strong curiosity and innovative problem-solving skills.

Our Purpose is to Share Smarter, Serve Better - By providing tailored professional shared services, partnering with our customers to become an extension of their team.

Life-Science Innovations is the administrative partner that serves a group of companies involved in agri-business, bioscience, and technology, located on the beautiful MinnWest Technology Campus in Willmar, MN.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Responsible for the successful delivery of a project during the initiating, planning, executing, and closing phases.

Author Project Contract documents such as Statements of Work, Change Orders, Work Authorization Forms, and/or Project Charters for the provision of services to customers (affiliates) and collaborate with third party vendors to co-write project contract documentation for the receipt of services.

Assist IT leadership in designing, refining, and implementing the project intake, prioritization, and execution processes that support project management.

Conduct lessons learned and project closure activities.

Initiate project health check surveys and solicit feedback from SMEs and stakeholders throughout the project and at closure.

Drive process, policy and transformation changes needed.

Ensure IT best practices are consistently followed within projects.

Author other standard project management documentation such as communication plans, quality plans, RACI matrices and RAID Logs.

Work with LSI finance, and affiliates as needed, to secure Capital Improvement Project (CIP) funding by preparing CIP forms as well as presentations and supplemental materials for the board to approve.

Facilitate steering committee meetings.

Formulate project scope and delivery strategies, establish milestones/schedules, maintain and report project status.

Plan and identify resources needed for assigned projects.

Manage the project budget by performing cost estimation, confirming funding sources, and capturing actual cost throughout the project.

Prepare and report on project financials.

Review resource time sheets to ensure time is properly tracked to the project. Work with resource managers and HR to correct timesheets when needed.

Work with IT Leadership, Finance and HR to define project charge codes, and ensure that they are set up in the time-tracking system and assigned to the appropriate resources at the outset of the project as well as closed out at the conclusion of the project.

Work with finance to ensure projects are appropriately closed out including the closing of CIP codes in the ERP system and the billing of the project to customers/ affiliates.

Manage project close out process including conducting lessons learned sessions, generating project closure surveys, and measuring the results against project KPIs; produce required reports / presentations to share with Project Stakeholders.

Manage transition of software and / or hardware from project team to support team post go live.

Create project plan with a clear work breakdown structure that can be easily understood by both project team members and stakeholders.

Create team collaboration area / site (ex: MS Teams, SharePoint, etc), organize project file structure.

Onboard project team members.

Responsible for Project Kick Off meeting content and presentation.

Build a baseline of scope, schedule, and cost to measure against throughout the project.

Keep project plan updated and adjust baseline as necessary.

Report project status and variances on a set schedule.

Lead the project change process, including the writing and management of change orders, and the building of business cases where necessary to justify the change.

Track issues, risks, and action items.

Serve as initial point of escalation for all project related issues and risks.

Develop and propose risk mitigation and issue remediation plans; coordinate activities necessary to drive through to resolution.

Keep leadership informed of key issues and risks so that they understand the impacts of the project and can make informed decisions regarding them.

Assign work, set expectations, and hold teams accountable for completing assigned deliverables within planned timeframes and in accordance with the project’s quality standards.

Work with project team members to ensure that they have the bandwidth, resources (hardware, software, etc...) and information they need in order to be successful on the project. Negotiate with senior leadership to remove roadblocks on behalf of project team members in order to ensure their success.

Deliver timely, honest, fact based, feedback (both positive and constructive) on vendor, team member, and contractor performance.

Work with all project team members to align their individual goals (rocks) with project activities.

Conduct formal written project performance evaluations of internal project team members.

Facilitate the evaluation, selection and securing of solutions (hardware, software, and services).

Facilitate the vetting and selection of external resources such as vendors and contractors.

Review contracts and Master Service Agreements (MSAs) and present to business stakeholders for approval.

Review vendor invoices prior to approval. Work with vendors to resolve billing discrepancies.

Collaborate with vendors and contractors throughout the project ensuring expectations are understood and agreed upon.

Structure and execute the project within the boundaries of LSI IT best practices.

The ideal candidate will have the following educational and experience background:

5+ years of experience in Project Management.

5+ years of experience in leading a cross-organizational or cross-functional team.

2+ years of experience managing projects with standard software implementation tools such as Azure DevOps (ADO), Team Foundation Server (TFS), JIRA, or the IBM Rational suite of tools (Clear Case, ClearQuest, ReqPro, Rose, etc…).

2+ years of professional services experience preferred.

2+ years of experience managing vendor relationships.

Experience managing IT Security and/or Infrastructure projects preferred.

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Information Management, Computer Science, Project Management, Business Administration or related field or an equivalent combination of technical education.

Certification in PMP, PgMP, PfMP, Certified Scrum Master, or Certified Product Owner is preferred.

Thorough understanding of portfolio and program management techniques and methods (e.g., prioritization, demand/capacity management).

Extensive knowledge and expertise in project management (e.g., documenting, project tracking and management reporting).

Proficiency with project management software.

Well versed in project planning, scheduling, forecasting, and tracking.

General knowledge of software development lifecycle.

Knowledge of standard implementation methodologies: Waterfall, Agile, Scrum

Knowledge of work breakdown structures and baselines.

General knowledge of ITIL and CMMI standards and practices.

General knowledge of at least one industry preferred: biotechnology, engineering, genetics, agriculture, retail, meat processing and consumer packaged goods.

Well versed in Business Analysis best practices and standards.

Knowledge of how to balance resources and project demands across programs and portfolios as well as support demands.

Strong leadership skills.

Excellent analytical, financial, and creative problem-solving skills.

Excellent active listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.

Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.

Highly self-motivated and directed.

Strong customer service focus.

Experience working in and building team-oriented, collaborative environments.

Understands and engages in business and technical perspectives.

Ability to generate excitement with end users regarding new features and functionality and able to build business cases to justify the project as a means of creating efficiencies and improving business processes and outcomes.

Trustworthiness: There are no substitutes for honesty and kindness and doing what’s right.

Benefits at LSI:

Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst/Sales Compensation - Edina, Minnesota
Job Description:
The Senior Analyst will report to the Director of Finance and will be an important part of the Corporate FP&A team. The role requires a strong understanding of communications both within the finance organization and overall business of a mid to large-sized company. The ideal candidate has a well-developed appreciation for data integrity and financial processes, as well as a firm grasp of best practices for financial modeling. The candidate is eager to identify, develop, and drive operational excellence and reliable analyses in order to support the next wave of growth. This role will also require an individual who is able to work independently and willing to roll up their sleeves as duty requires. They thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment and are able to collaborate with people of a diverse set of talents.
Main Areas of Responsibilities
Participate in the development, implementation, and communication of the new Sales Compensation program each fiscal year
Own the monthly commissions payment process and serve as a point of contact on commissions related issues for the sales team
Configure and ensure Xactly commission calculations align with Guidewire plan specifications and are accurate
Own onboarding new hires, promotions and terminations in Xactly
Prepare reconciliation, accrual, capitalization and payment files for on-time commission processing within the close period and process adjustments when necessary
Ensure internal controls are followed and provide support for applicable audits of processes, calculations and payments
Create and maintain procedure documents needed to effectively manage compensation tasks
Build relationships with Sales, Sales Ops and Finance to encourage continual process and systems improvements to increase workflow proficiency
Partner with Sales and Marketing business leaders to facilitate the annual budget process and drive accurate monthly forecasts thereafter
Promote financial discipline and accountability around hiring and procurement decisions by tracking new hires and purchase requisitions against the budget, and preparing reporting packages for executives
Perform forecast vs actual variance analyses for revenue and expenses to ensure general ledger accuracy during monthly close processes
Qualifications
Bachelor’s in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field3-5 years of experience in Finance. Sales Ops or Sales Compensation field; knowledge or focus on Sales and Marketing strongly preferred
Detail-oriented with strong critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills
Proficiency with Excel and/or Google Sheets
Experience working with Xactly or similar comp planning tool; other financial planning SaaS software experience (i.e. Adaptive Insights) a plus
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

we are seeking one (1) full-time website administrator resource to perform services pertaining to the migration of Commerce’s Caspio web forms to Formstack.

Commerce wishes to move off Caspio and onto Formstack as its web form solution. The resource under this engagement will conduct a complete inventory of all of Commerce’s Caspio assets/forms and determine if they are still being used or can be deleted. The resource will then migrate/recreate the assets/forms still in use to Formstack if possible. For assets/forms that do not fit into Formstack, the resource will provide recommendations for other solutions.

Commerce has at least 60 assets/forms in Caspio on a Tridion platform. There may be additional assets/forms not accounted for in this estimate. The bulk of these forms/assets should be able to be migrated to Formstack. The majority of the assets/forms are fairly simple single page forms with 10-30 fields each.

The work order may be extended/expanded to include the migration/recreation of additional or more complex forms, and/or the implementation of other solutions for the forms that cannot be migrated to Formstack.

Tasks

· Conduct a total inventory of Caspio assets/forms in Commerce’s account and work with Commerce staff to identify the business units that own each asset/form

· Work with business units to determine which assets/forms are still being used and which assets/forms can be deleted

· Delete unused Caspio assets/forms

· Migrate/recreate Caspio assets/forms that are still being used to Formstack

· Make recommendations for other solutions for Caspio assets/forms that cannot be migrated/recreated to Formstack

· Provide knowledge transfer to State staff

· Perform other related duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications

· Three (3) years’ experience in website administrator role(s)

· Six (6) months’ experience migrating between types of web forms

· Two (2) years’ experience with creating forms in Formstack

Desired Qualifications

· Experience migrating forms between Caspio and Formstack

· Experience creating forms in Caspio

· Business analysis experience

· Web development experience

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $45.00 per hour

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance

Ability to commute/relocate:

Saint Paul, MN: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

website administrator: 5 years (Preferred)
web forms: 1 year (Preferred)
Formstack: 4 years (Preferred)
Caspio: 5 years (Preferred)
Web development: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Job Title: Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst to join our Global Information Technology Group which is part of KPMG International.

Responsibilities:

Be accountable for managing daily security operations which focus on key business platforms ensuring integrity of changes which impact information security and control management
Collaborate with various Information Technology Services (ITS) Global teams on different security operations related tasks, analyze cloud compliance/vulnerability reports, technical review of exception request; help and guide junior team members to manage the service request queue (ServiceNow)
Work together with Automation, Cloud Security Posture Management and ITS Global Operations teams on the implementation, automation, and maintenance of new Cloud security monitoring policies within our cloud environment
Build a deep understanding of current environments, researching, and advising on IT infrastructure
Assist the Security Operations Group (SOG) Manager with daily management of core security operations process
Coordinate with platform Information System Security Officer with the daily management of information security related queries and requests

Qualifications:

Minimum five years of recent security and IT experience is required
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, computer networking, computer security or a related field, or equivalent work experience
Experience with Microsoft Azure is preferable: Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Azure Policies, Azure Application Gateways, Web Application Firewalls, Network Security Groups, among others
Network infrastructure knowledge on TCP/IP and Internet protocols
Experience with Palo Alto Prisma is preferable
CISSP, CISM, CCSP (Certified Cloud Security Professional) or CCSK (Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge) certifications or equivalent experience is preferred
